HLojXoKd-vpjrCxadlo0Aw.text: This place is poppin'. Music, crowd, it's a young, energetic vibe here. The decor is colorful and artsy. We came for a quick bite after exploring both Phoenix and Scottsdale. Got a couple beers and the brussel sprout nachos to share. I got the $5 beer and taco deal for checking in. I ordered the plantain taco. Overall, good experience, since we didn't order any entrees, I we would just caveat that. They did forget the extra fried egg we ordered for the brussel sprout nachos, which they brought out on a small plate after reminding them. The flies were a bit annoying, we kept having to shoo them away from our food.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wallpaper

pLA2ZluohByJt-sHWJ34og.text: DO NOT GO HERE. A friend and I were very excited to try the food here, when we first arrived we asked the bartender what she recommended, when she recommended the Brussel sprout nachos it didn't sound appetizing so we got something else.  Almost an hour later we asked to get a margarita and the bar tender told us she could not serve us, we asked why she got very defensive and got the manager. The manager, who's name was Cory told us he could not serve us because "we had the hiccups earlier." We were completely sober and were treated absolutely terribly. Worst costumer service I have ever experienced, will never go here again.

5pMU_mjSt1809CNve7roEA.text: Monday hally hour and half off tacos is hard to beat also have really good margaritas!

N5DwTa79YpEfB6dYsgnNcw.text: Came here for Cinco de Mayo during happy hour (3-6pm). I was able to use the yelp check-in offer for a taco and beer for $5 which is an amazing deal. Tacos are normally around $4-5. Each table comes with 6 types of sauces to add to your meals. Don't forget to try them out!  Service: The waitress was quick and thorough with taking and entering our order. However, the waitress kept forgetting things we requested such as extra napkins and cups of water. The person who brought our order out had no idea what he was carrying had to go back and forth 3 times before he got it correct.  Food: Braised Pineapple Pork was good. Pork was a little dry, but for $5 (combo with beer) definitely worth it. I wish it would've come with 2 tortillas so that i could split it in two. I also got the Sonoran Hot Dog. I enjoyed its Brioche bun the most. So SOFT! I forgot that it was supposed to have bacon until towards the very end of my dog... The beans might have overpowered a lot of the different ingredients including the bacon. I would ask for less beans.   Come here during happy hour and don't forget to check-in to use the yelp promo! Don't expect the best service during its peak time.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sonoran Hot Dog
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sonoran Hot Dog
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Gave us cute ponchos on Cinco de Mayo!

v1b1tkgyjxUWP9tnTTk9yw.text: Such a great spot  waters were on the table before we even asked (without straws!!) delicious tacos !!!!!

iHIFq6bsefYxsLdA4dVGJA.text: I was not disappointed with my first dining experience in AZ.    There is outdoor and indoor dining, and bars, available. There is a nice fireplace outdoors with seating around it as well.  It was a little chilly when we were here, but they had heat lamps available.  They did offer to move them closer to us, but someone had already beat us to the request.    My friend brought me to Diego Pops for tacos, but we started with the fabuloso brussel sprout nachos.  I was so mesmerized that I forgot to snap a quick photo! I appreciated that the menu indicated the customer favorites, as well as the award winning items.  I had endulged so much of the nachos that I ordered just one taco, the chili verde chicken.  I was quite pleased with my order.  The blend of flavors was exciting and I would absolutely go back for more.  They do have an array of fun mixed drinks.  We ordered something that came in a large coconut.  I would say it wasn't worth the $13, however.  (There is a full bar available.)    I would put Diego Pops on your 'to do' list.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YNh5mtQjgoVQb-Tsd6pLQQ.text: My best friend reserved two tables for my birthday dinner at Diego Pops. I had always wanted to visit because of the sign out front which drew me in. The parking out front is minimal. It was my first time visiting and most likely my last. Not in regards to service but the food was subpar and I could honestly get better elsewhere (Taco Guild).

hRJDUUeQWY2Ip3qG_9ER-w.text: I ordered the braised green chili chicken, charred skirt steak, braised pineapple porky and grilled shrimp tacos. Polished the order off with stewed pinto beans.  This place could be a franchise!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wonderful libations
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. I ordered the braised green chili chicken, charred skirt steak, braised pineapple porky and grilled shrimp.
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. It was way to hot to sit outside but if I come back in February I would consider it.

RZnWiFKnuI0poFKELbywQA.text: My family and I visited for the 1st time and the food was great. The service, however I would rate as lacking and poor. Starting from the hostess and ending with the server.  The hostess seemed leas interested in her job (eye rolling) and  sort of just waved us off.  The server  was not attentive at all, our food came and we asked for the special sauces. Instead of a quick reach for the sauces she decided to take the order of a large party of 6-7 people who had just been seated. While we waited and waited. The place was not packed, I've been to busier restaurants with better service.  We were missing silverware and my daughter got tired of waiting and grabbed  one from another table. The server however was VERY quick to give us our check and  came back quicker than she served us to collect  the payment!  This place has potential to remain in business for a long time if the hiring folk were more selective of their front line workers. The cooks in the back seemed friendlier than the servers!  I would have rather tipped the cooks than our server.

aup1wB7-5EW72OJUemIlgQ.text: Let me start by saying this review is based on customer service and not the food. I've been to Diego Pops several times. The food is consistently good, service is pretty good, and the atmosphere is upbeat. I went there for happy hour, around 4pm, with my boyfriend today and we noticed when we got our check, the prices on the receipt did not correspond with what they were on menu. Our server apologized, kind of acted like she didn't know how to address it and grabbed the manger on duty. She brought back the check and it was still incorrect so the manager came over to our table to talk about it.   This guy came over to our table wearing a pink Diego pops shirt and black shorts, and asked if he could clear our plates. Then he asked if we were waiting to speak with a manager and I said that we were and he stood there and said, "ok...". I asked him if he was a manager, he said he was. Although, he presented himself to be the person who busses a table. I told him the issue and I also asked why the add ons for the appetizers weren't part of happy hour since they were part of the appetizers. He said they just weren't and didn't provide an explanation. He didn't strike me as someone who would be a manager because he had a "too busy to care attitude," he didn't introduce himself, say hello, ask us how everything else was, offer us more water or anything, and his appearance certainly did not separate himself as authority. Managers are supposed to be problem solvers and go above and beyond for guest to make their experience a great one.  I am very disappointed and shocked with how the issue was handled, even if my check was adjusted. I hope with better training for their servers, managers, and fixing the prices on the menu it will improve because I enjoy eating here.

tzsgIcxSksBz2oyE6bZIlA.text: Thursday evening, service very sparse. Took 20 minutes just to take our order. Food came out okay or bad. Poke bowl had more apples than poke. Don't understand. I've cream machine broken. Didn't see our server for 20 + minutes.

EAhj41brSJzqUj9d2UAoQA.text: Vibe was too much of a show and a scene.  Plantain taco was okay, but the coconut ceviche was cloyingly sweet. Maybe some people like that way but not me.  If you're looking for a Miami-like place with so-so food, this place is the spot.

8HbhZjFHlY-mZ4nHgtepkQ.text: Was looking forward to trying this restaurant given all the great reviews.  But our experience was good food but not great with mediocre and inattentive service.  No need to rush back!

w7VEGxpFVegD9VTp7NCcZw.text: Great atmosphere for causal outdoor drinks and food. Food and drinks exceeded expectations, great service. The mango habanero wings have an amazing spice and less mango taste then I expected, which I loved! Watermelon margarita with mint was one of the best margaritas I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Skirt steak (right) fried cod (left)
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mango habanero wings (left) watermelon mint margarita (right)

MgEUcXKohZUu4b0ywLQmmQ.text: Love this place! The happy hour is so great! The decor and ambiance are also really fun! Try the brussel sprout nachos-you will not be dissatisfied! They are definitely something you can't find anywhere else and so tasty! The margaritas are also delicious and our server was excellent. Can't wait to go back and try other things on the menu!

Lx47Y4tl-GLCCS0vVAEl4A.text: Came here for happy hour on a Saturday! The quesadilla and Brussels sprout nachos were delicious! Love the different sauce that Diego pops had to offer. The California burrito (not part of the HH special) was okay. Felt like too much was going on! Overall really like the environment and would like to come back here again!

WIypEwUvH7oEq_Vxa0qQUA.text: 3/5 stars  We came here on a Friday night for dinner and this restaurant was very lively! The food and service was OK. Definitely a millennial type a scene.   Ordered: 1) Chip and Salsa: 3/5 salsa was good. Chips were okay. 2) Guacamole: 4/5 yum!! DELICIOUS. Fresh avocado and you cast taste it! 3) Grilled shrimp taco: 3/5 eh, okay, but not for the price.. 4) Braised pineapple pork: 3/5 again, okay, but not fantastic 5) Charred skirt steak: 3/5 eh, okay.  Overall, I probably won't be back.

cDX216rGw4IOx46rLnKs2Q.text: We came in for happy hour yesterday and enjoyed everything! Great service, wonderful food, and the manager, Cory was awesome!

SR_v8MhaBYQGthBY7sJtSw.text: I eat here every week whether it's in person or through door dash! Such a great variety of yummy selections! My top picks are the avocado Caesar salad with chicken, crispy braised chili chicken tacos, or a bowl of literally any variety. Good spot, great food!

Z7veMM59aGsg-KL8wVbUQw.text: Great unique menu. Loved the braised pineapple taco. Nice atmosphere and the staff was very friendly

jV0atUL1_u-fpLv83byDGQ.text: I am never coming back.  1. The first time I came in I asked for guacamole. The server brought us the chips and I asked my server if we can have salsa. She figured I was asking about the guac but she turned around and literally yelled that she is getting the guac. She later went to get a different server.  2. I decided to give it a second try. I asked for a vodka soda and she NEVER asked for what type of vodka. When I later checked I saw they charged me for titos.  Never coming back. Still have not had a good experience

Yvkk_545iKAbRNPUtgyfpw.text: I love Diego Pops, such an awesome and welcome addition to Old Town Scottsdale. It has good food, a fun and whimsical atmosphere without the attitude.   Food has always been pretty stellar, not mind blowing but pretty flippin awesome! Think your usual small joint taco fare with a few additions that take it over the top... think fresh poke bowls and honestly no visit is really complete without an order of their in my own opinion famous Brussels sprout nachos; yes I just said what you think I did, and seriously I get what is going through your mind but somehow they make brussels sprouts and nachos work. No joke, these are not your mothers Brussels sprouts doused in nasty cheese. Just try them and you can send me a thank you card later.   So go.... go on Margarita Mondays, Taco Tuesday, Wasted Wednesday, Tequila Thursdays you get my drift, any night is a good night for Diego Pops!

UaIiC4Z0btv1u9LTunDoJw.text: Such a cute restaurant!! Great place to take pictures! I had my bridal shower and it turned out so cute! The pineapple pork taco is my favorite! You have to try the snow cone drink when you go, so yummy!

3_R6gCn_CWQ-cJq2sJiC0w.text: We googled a place to eat in the Phoenix area and Diego Pops came up so we tried it. Yum. The Brussels sprout nachos were delicious and the rest of the meal was as delicious.  The service was excellent as well.

eu53aiynMr9KXzBC-rvcfA.text: We went in had the tacos and they were amazing! Loved the chips & salsa & that was also delish. Margaritas some of the best we've had. We went during lunch time and it was easy to get seated. Parking is a little tight if you're driving a bigger vehicle if you park up front so park in the back.

WFnT6L_g56ATdoES5_9Ihg.text: Great spot for outdoor dining! The design is very playful and colorful both indoors and out, but they nailed it on the patio.   This is a perfect spot to take that person that says "but I don't like spicy" when you suggest Mexican food. It's also a fresh, healthier menu than traditional places offer. Their dishes (especially the bowls) can sometimes err if the bland side, but they do give you a basket of sauces you can add to your taste, and their salsa is delicious. You can order their tacos in a bowl over rice or quinoa, but most would agree that it's overly filling in that format, especially because the fun part is sharing smaller plates here!  All the apps are delicious, and they have a great selection of specialty margaritas as well as some simpler, classic ones.   I knocked off a star for service, because it's pretty hit or miss. Their have been times that I've chosen elsewhere because I didn't want to deal with a snotty waitress based on past experiences, and then times when I've been pleasantly surprised. But I'll say there is enough other stuff to like about this place to give it a shot!

S5fP3QGv9BJMtqVUW-Md8w.text: Food was ok. Was disappointed we wanted to sit outside but it was chilly. We asked about the heat lamps but the staff gave us the excuse that not of them were working? We thought it was a bit of a lazy excuse. The guacamole has little flavor and the quesadillas were completely plain with no dipping sauce. We didn't realize there are canisters of salsa you can get until half way through our meal and had to ask for a set of them. Won't be going back.

WhD40lS-HisWMYNH2pbSPw.text: This place is fun, tasty, and comfortable.  It has a great tequila selection and a decor of bright colors and shiek 70s-ish style that will pop better and better as your eyes and brain adjust to the effects of their delicious drinks and shots of tequila.    Make sure to dig into their unique appetizers to help you "wash" down your delicious custom drinks.  To accompany your third drink go ahead and indulge in a couple of their unique custom high brow tacos.  Plus the delicious food will help cut the alcohol so the fantastic decor does not get too blurry.    Stop in for happy hour and get your night started right.

Vqw_wmvge9pMvktq9oTZKg.text: Great atmosphere overall. It's definitely more of a hangout with friends have a couple drinks kind of place. I had the braised green chile chicken quesadilla which was a must. Chips and salsa were fantastic. Wasn't a fan of the pineapple pork taco though. Not a lot of flavor. Pretty decent little place.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

T0lNrjrktLMaG635QNlWWQ.text: We went to Diego Pops for dinner on Sunday night. The vibe is young and fun, the decor is a little retro, and they played great music all night.  The food was good and not heavy. We ordered the brussels sprout nachos and chicken enchiladas to start and then I ordered the fish taco bowl with quinoa. The bowl is big and after the apps and few margaritas, I could barely make a dent in the bowl. I think the classic taco is the better way to go unless you're starving.  Food and drinks were great, price was right, and loved the outdoor ambiance. Will definitely come back on my next trip to AZ!

ZrzSBr4KNjLE4lJ-vsD3iQ.text: You can't come here with out getting the Brussel sprout nachos! The decor is very chic mexican mixed with ritzy scottsdale.   I usually order a few tacos and my favorite thing about diego pops is the carousel of sauces they bring out for you. I docked one star for slow service.

UyX_onrLtC9GEUXVMcUlZA.text: On a road trip from Portland to Tucson and this is, without a doubt, the best food we've had yet.   Actually, the pineapple pork burrito was the best burrito I've ever eaten.  And the guava coconut cocktail was delish too.  I would love to come back to Old Scottsdale and spend some more time rather than just overnight.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guava coconut cocktail.  Delish.
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pineapple pork burrito.   Too much for my little belly but absolutely the best burrito ever!

nonX1Pw1KoiFYcTB3fwZYQ.text: Taco Monday is where it's at! Also, get the Brussels sprouts nachos, so unique and delicious.

wH3rdOGEjHr71pjQZOSk5Q.text: This place was on my "Places to eat at" List. It did not disappoint! We started with the guacamole and quest and it was full of flavor. I grew up drinking horchatas, so anytime I see it on the menu I order it. This place has them and really that the reason I wanted to eat here. The horchata was delicious! Not many Mexican restaurants serve them, but this was one of the few that actually tasted authentic! Very cool and casual setting. We sat outside by the fireplace. Will be returning

vQtwp_Ook9P2VoFwTkPffA.text: What a fun little place. Stopped in during a bike ride for water, snacks and a margarita or 3. Place was happening! All enjoyed the food, drinks were good, staff great. Wew will be back!

Odz72SeY10RvNS1rmWmmEQ.text: The service here was fantastic! We were there tonight for happy hour "Sunday Funday" tonight with visitors from out of state. The margaritas were Delish! The food presentation and branding were spot on. It doesn't stand out compared to its surrounding venues as a passerby so you might pass it, but I highly recommend you check it out and check out the Brussel Sprout Nachos!!!! Wait!!! What???? Brussel Sprouts? That's right! Do it. Go! You will not be disappointed.

PtOulsCcqRrVNRz_VqqwqA.text: SO SO GOOD! My best friend and I have been here a couple times and both times have been great! The first time was in October and we sat out on the patio (since the weather was great in AZ, haha) and watched some baseball on the TVs. It was busy, although not too busy. We both had tacos, and let me tell you they were DELICIOUS! The second time was on Cinco de Mayo and it was PACKED! The tacos were still the best part. It was so crowded that we were placed in a tight spot around other large parties. We could barely hear each other and the pitcher margarita LITERALLY tasted like lemonade!!!! WHAT! When a pitcher is about $20 and it is Cinco de Mayo...please actually put some tequila in there. Disappointed about the margs and is why I didn't give a full 5 stars. We will definitely go back though :)

o1lk933YbphbFju3kMBjxQ.text: The house burrito here was amazing and the ambience of the restaurant was relaxed and welcoming. I used the Yelp check in offer and this place was great in honoring both from me and my friend. Would highly recommend the tacos and burritos here !

TZUW7qoXzf2t5P2lWnAsFw.text: Have darn good margaritas! The chips are really yummy and their house salsa is recommended! Tacos have unique flavors and different styles than your normal median place. I would definitely recommend it as a casual place to grab food and enjoy conversation. Definitely check the outside area!

_VCXKxBz2NUDJthLc7PqIw.text: I've been wanting to try this place for a while and it turned out to be pretty good. The decor and atmosphere is very fun with a mid century vibe and large patio. My husband ordered 3 tacos; steak, shrimp & cod and I ordered the sweet corn and avocado Caesar salad with added braised green chili chicken, and we both had the prickly pear iced teas. Service was fast, brief but friendly and our iced teas were kept full. All three of my husband's tacos were delicious. It was fun trying all of the sauces/salsa options that they brought to the table, each one was better than the next. I especially enjoyed the garlic beet crema sauce which went great on the cod taco. The standout was the braised green chili chicken that I added to my salad. It was cooked perfectly and had just the right amount of flavor, when I return I will definitely order this again.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel sprout nachos
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet corn &amp; avocado Caesar with braised green chili chicken

UoqSUjG6rnhOh9l0BO6a_Q.text: New kids on the block in Scottsdale.....great tacos and atmosphere. Can't miss the bright pink neon sign outside. Brussels sprout nachos looked amazing....if you're into that sort of thing! A great place for taco Tuesday!

1gQ955rk42MmXRHZwVP-wQ.text: This place gets me excited for Monday's. Taco Monday's are a must. Love the shrimp and bbq taco. Chips and salsa is good to! Beer selection is solid. The service is great.

StVDGxxbtoE2HsAbtK1yOA.text: Love the outside patio!! Great chips and salsa!!

qzBC4Rg1wx_u4-jpFbsHeA.text: My first time visiting and am glad I stopped by. We had their Brussels sprout Nachos which are so great!  They have a handful of sauces to choose from for your tacos. We tried their shrimp and cod tacos both very flavorful. Their coconut rice was delish. The churro and soft serve ice cream were on point and their service was great.  I want to return maybe for their happy hour so I can get a taste of all their different tacos and have a coconut drink or ceviche, idk but am certain I will return very soon!

M-v8vBVeiYM-gZMpKuehiA.text: I tried Diego Pops for the first time last week and it was amazing! The staff and service were both on point. Combine that with great food and a fantastic tequila selection, and Diego Pops has become my new favorite! PS - Get the Brussels sprout nachos, you won't regret it!

6qampuwMGmAAcVXsPQmaQA.text: Guava margarita.   Holy moly.  Straight. Out of a coconut   Brussels sprout nachos!!!!!  Coconut icecream is perfection.

Plkzy3OrUAXu7flomhGabw.text: What a great new spot! Cool modern taco shop & bar in old town. Very nice atmosphere for a quiet dinner or later on for some fun shots on tap and light eats. Cory and his team do an amazing job and truly bring home customized customer experience. I would recommend you check out this new hot spot .

RTHpegvlsLaVKgQNGLnL0Q.text: Fun vibe with great outdoor seating and bar area.  We tried three different tacos, chicken, pork & salmon and all were excellent.  If you don't like a sauce, they will leave it off and bring you eight more to choose from at your table, all homemade and delicious.  If you like salsa, don't skip the salsa & chips.  It isn't free like most Mexican restaurants, but it is far more tasty!  It too is made fresh daily and the heat can vary.  Last week it was milder, last night almost too hot for me, but my wife LOVED it.  Had to bring home an extra order!  We are going back.

D7ozCGMi_T8pGSJJD7kp6g.text: To begin with Diego Pops is my favorite restaurant to go eat at and hangout in Scottsdale, Arizona. They have an amazing patio outside to sit and enjoy your food and cocktails and if your not in the mood they have a very nice modern restaurant inside to sit at with a bar that serves many beers on draft and some signature made margaritas. But they have amazing decor there and some good vibes, you walk in they have music playing and its overall nice and relaxing. It's a nice place to show up for happy hour with your friends and hang out with friends or even have a family get together. Diego Pops is an amazing place to start, end or have a nice dinner out in Scottsdale.   Now the reason why Diego Pops is one of my favorites restaurant because of the food they have the best tacos in town hands down! Too start out they have phenomenal appetizers. When I went there I got the Brussels Sprout nachos, which were to die for. It came out with a sunny side egg on top which I've ever had before on nachos, also it came with chicken on it, cheese and some homemade sauces they have. And it's a perfect size to share with 3-4 people. Then after the appetizer it only gets better because they have the best tacos there! They have a wide selection of tacos like, steak, green chili chicken, cod, shrimp and more. But when I went I got the Beef machaca taco with a crispy taco and it was so delicious it watered in my mouth. Then I got another taco, which was the cod taco on a soft corn tortilla, and normally I don't eat fish but the way it was prepared with lettuce onions and there special sauce it was so good. Now if you're not in the mood for tacos, they also have burritos, salads and some poke bowls! After our specular meal we ordered a dessert, which was the churro sundae! It came out with vanilla on top with dulce and de leche with churros under it. To me I loved it because I'm sweet person but on the other hand my girlfriend wasn't the biggest fan.   After our visit our bill wasn't bad at all, we ordered a lot of food and drinks and it wasn't that much. But it also isn't cheap; it would be more in the middle for cost. But its all quality food for sure. Also they have a happy hour 3-6 pm Monday-Friday which has super good deals so take advantage of that. You can get there house margaritas for half off which is like 4 dollars. And when its not happy hour the tacos are a good price, for 2 BBQ chicken tacos its 10 dollars, for 2 chicken tacos its 9 dollars and for the steak its 11 bucks so all the tacos are priced fairly the same. Then there bar has drinks going from 8-15 bucks just depends on there signature margs you order or even a Mexican mule. There beer is also priced nice, 5 bucks for a pint and they have many to choose from. Overall I would say Diego Pops is very affordable for some good food.   What even made my experience at Diego Pops better was the service. When we first got there it only took us a couple minutes to get seated even when they were a little busy. Then we had our waiter approach us and help us go over the menu and told us all about the deals going on. The wait for food wasn't bad at all, it was in and out very quick and prepared nicely. The reason why I come back as well is because the service is always on point, fast and friendly!   Overall I would give this place a 4 out of 5 stars! I would recommend to anyone out there, Its to delicious and everyone should go try. But order wisely when you go and you shall have the time of your life at Diego Pops and definitely leave with a full stomach.

rpc2G47LfL1AppB3vNrTSw.text: Very loud slow innatentive service. Food? Who knows waiting 30 minutes already and no sign of it.

2rBEmWa7EnsQ2r9wKOJpIA.text: Such an awesome local spot.  Great food, amazing prices, and the manager is super friendly.  The brussel sprout nachos are to die for.  Funky fun place to get some great healthier Mexican choices.

K9LLAsUXD_VGUgqLe565ow.text: This was my first trip to Scottsdale.  We went to Diego Pops on Sunday evening and absolutely loved it. The service was great, the tacos even better. It was so good in fact that I took my friend there today for lunch.  My husband was jealous so I took him for dinner!  That's how much we loved this place!  We will be coming back--just for their awesome food!

0JK4ObM2fOgjS-JOdfQX_Q.text: Won't be coming back to this place. It only gets a star because the app won't let you proceed without it. The bartender had attitude written all over her face the moment we walked in and was absolutely rude. She took both mine and my husband's I.D. and told me my Georgia I.D. was weird but eventually gave it back. She took my husband's international driver's license and went through this book and comes back and says it's not a valid I.D. He gives her another form of I.D. and she says that's not valid either, he needs a passport. Not everyone is from Arizona genius. Like no he's not walking around with his passport on the off chance that he might stop in a crappy place like this one with terrible service. Not once in the seven months that he's been here has anyone treated him like this just to order a drink. He carries his driver's license like all the other people because it's accepted at all the other places. To make the situation even worse, the guy sitting at the bar enjoying his drink tells us she didn't check his I.D.

rsMwIQfkLS89VbnWvYwclw.text: First Visit to Diego Pops! Definitely won't be our last!   Be sure to ask to be seated at one of Steve Sparks' tables and order whatever he suggests that evening, he won't steer you wrong! Having grown up in the Valley and eating a lot of Mexican food, he said he felt like their tacos were some of the best in the Valley, and he wasn't wrong!  We tried the pineapple pork bowl with creamy beans and coconut rice. Brought half home and will definitely be looking forward to leftovers!  Also tried the green chile chicken taco in crispy corn tortilla, grilled steak in flour tortilla, grilled shrimp in crispy corn, and chicken adobo in crispy corn also! All were awesome-especially the grilled shrimp! I've tried grilled shrimp tacos from New England to San Diego and Portland to Miami, but have never had any with the flavors this had.   They have a nice selection of domestic and import beer along with a variety of tequilas and cocktails. The mix a mean Michelada that is spicy but refreshing at the same time.   Already looking forward to our next visit! Brussels sprouts nachos are first on the list!

Gl8vXlr2sNw4Kqtl5x8nzA.text: Saw the reviews and had to try it. It definitely is well worth it. Service was fast and great. Love the real coconut drinks. Taco's are great but I still like Sumomaya taco's

k0Pg1fBQSxkVY9jCM-oDlA.text: Love the tacos, chicken tortilla soup, and salads.  The salsas are wonderful.  I can't wait until we return.

xx5oj1ByvO9Rffo5-RwtnA.text: Great atmosphere, service, good food and decent prices. Terrific spot to spend and afternoon!

dVtP0Awav4EJuEcxHJNUHg.text: Chips, Salsa and Guac were all awesome. The crispy cod taco was great and the plantain taco's were pretty good. My only complaint was the sweet corn + avocado ceasar was weak on toppings - only trace amounts of corn and cotija, no croutons to be found and barely any dressing. I would also like more agua fresca options (beside hibiscus) and more non ice cream desserts.  I'll be back to try the nachos and a different salad.

jHs-gwQ8zIBdb5mOEzMyAg.text: Definitely for foodies! Excellent drinks and tacos. The brussel sprout nachos shouldn't be missed

dLFRkV1mMJW01lUZBavvTg.text: Delicious tacos. I had the skirt steak (highly recommend) and the pineapple pork tacos al la carte. Service started really good and slowly our waiter faded away into the distance. They were out of ice cream (what?) so no dessert but that's okay because we ate three platters of chips and salsa. Cute joint, I liked the pineapple wallpaper. Retro vibe. Overall, good experience and would return, especially with $2 taco Monday's!

KgYU3aTkPlcswS7ojtYcsQ.text: This was my favorite meal during a recent visit in Phoenix. The restaurant itself has a very fun and trendy vibe - I loved the neon lights, florescent pineapple wallpaper and creative touches such as a drink menu clipped to an old Baja California license plate.  The lunch prices overall were very reasonable and I liked the option of having a taco entree turned into a bowl with rice and beans, which is what I opted for. The table came with 6 different sauces including a creative roasted garlic beet crema to amp of the flavor of your meal however you choose. The guac we ordered as an appetizer fell a little flat for me - the portion was rather small and I thought there could have been a bit more seasoning.  If I was in the mood for a cocktail, I would have ordered one of the delicious looking snow cone margaritas.  Overall a great casual yet trendy option in Old Town Scottsdale with indoor and patio seating available.

EwVE0leGgLB2g4ohhvNxwg.text: Diego pops in my opinion is a little overhyped. Yes the atmosphere is AMAZING and the staff is awesome. Gotta love the people in Scottsdale.   The food itself was just okay. I had a few tacos and the nacho appetizer. It was interesting, wild, and fun- loaded with a lot of fun toppings (like brussel sprouts!), but just didn't really live up to the hype.   Would i go back? Yes- because the vibe is too cool to pass up. But next time I'm definitely just getting a drink and sharing some nachos.

NLS8W1Xdb_m6dcxAVYNgqQ.text: After a recent visit here I was pleasantly surprised by the menu options of lighter Mexican fare. They have tons of sauces to chose from, wide range of tacos which can be turned into bowls as well as appetizers.   Try the brussel sprout nachos.   A weird but delish twist on one of my fave snack foods.   Drinks are good but pricey.  Try to make it for happy hour !   And check in on Yelp, they have a great deal on beer and a taco!  Love the back patio.  Stays cool enough to dine outside in the summer months.  Will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Too bad we missed Sunday happy hour.   But still enjoying the patio !

a-YhCqaZDa5p6ECl_uaoDQ.text: Food is amazing and customer service with issues is excellent. I had an issue the last time we ordered this place but seeing that the owner reached out, I no longer feel the need to rate this place low. Definitely will be going back.

pYujJFcVl6Fl7x7FtOJqKQ.text: I came here for happy hour to get some drinks and appetizers and I was impressed with this place. I found this place by searching on Yelp and came here as a starting point for my visit in old town Scottsdale. This place has good reviews so I had to check it out.  I walked in and was pleasantly greeted by Rebecca who ended up being the bartender. She was friendly and gave some good food recommendations. I ended up ordering the Coconut Lemongrass Ceviche and Mango Habanero Wings. The ceviche was a bit different from the traditional ceviche I have tried but it was good to try something different. I still liked it for the taste and fresh flavor. The mango habanero wings were spicy and it was a lot better with the habanero sauce that came on the side.   There was also a Yelp check in special where you can order a beer and a taco for $5! You definitely can't beat that! The braised pineapple pork taco was very delicious and you must try it!  I would definitely come back here to try the other foods. Rebecca was awesome and the food was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mango Habanero Wings
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Coconut Lemongrass Ceviche
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Variation of Sauces

azy9PVGf3fX1cq5xJxTnfQ.text: Great food, atmosphere, location, and service. Food and drinks are a little pricey for what you get, but on par with Old Town.

xFJQncmwt29Ee54Q9AtYQw.text: Diego pops is AMAZING. Our server, David, was so personal and kind. He went above and beyond as a server. If you go to Diego Pops to eat make sure to ask for David, he won't let you down!!

5RpBbm6CtNXJmAn0ymvpVw.text: This is my new favorite in Old Town! Super happy upbeat atmosphere, creative menu, brussel sprout nachos with pink sauce, 6 different sauces to put on any dish, best prickly pear margaritas mmmmm my mouth is watering writing this post! And definitely get the elote corn on the cob!!!! You gotta go here!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best Taco Place In Old Town Scottsdale
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Elote Corn

sTY6qBsTOKYEQye3LrGj0g.text: This is not an easy town to eat in as a vegan but Diego Pops does it right!  They have a Brussel sprouts taco or make it a bowl. Its topped over black beans with brown rice and easy to leave off the queso!  Delicious!  And i love the various hot sauce/salsa they bring out, habanero diablo is my favorite and great, friendly service!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel sprouts bowl!

yc-hQL20CoBkbst0fW8kYw.text: I always have a good experience here. The food is great and I usually get good service too. The Brussel Sprout nachos are amazing!!! I loveeeee them. The margaritas are really good as well. Decently priced considering the portions and they have a nice happy hour :).

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

OGrXbwiex9B4yQsNz8zLFg.text: Great atmosphere good drinks and outstanding tacos. Exactly what we had hoped for when we headed into Old Town. We enjoyed our meal on the patio and soaked in the sun while sipping on cocktails. The green chile chicken tacos were especially flavorful but not too heavy. The adobo chicken was also tasty and the pickled onions and fresh topping brought a light flavor to the whole meal.   The service was prompt and attentive but not overwhelming. The perfect balance. We'd go back next time we visit Scottsdale for sure.

e0FZCIvfXZXYRdcQqmgCqA.text: Expensive for what you get. My grilled steak taco had six small pieces of steak. Every thing is a'la cart. You pay extra for 1/4 a cup of beans and rice. The food is ok. Nothing special. The service was really slow, one of those places you have to keep turning around to find your server. What really put me off was the way the female staff present themselves. If you want to see a  young woman with her ass hanging out of her shorts This is the place for you! Yuck.

Noze0p2rIVPRjSMGGuijIQ.text: Impressive.  It's a Wednesday night and the place was lively. Check in on Yelp and you get a taco and beer for $5. Winning? Damn right. The skirt steak was on point. I also had a poke bowl with roasted garlic and cucumber on top of coconut rice. All in all, a really great meal.   Service was a little sporadic but I really enjoyed the food quality and atmosphere.

U20OE3a4Tuq-hfO-2pzfWA.text: Diego Pops is now my go-to trendy, taco date spot. The decor is cute and trendy, very instagrammable. The vibe and atmosphere inside is great. Perfect place to sit at the bar and grab a drink or have a cute outing with some friends. Coming from San Diego where some of the best tacos reside, I was not expecting much since it was not your typical street taco joint. However I was pleasantly surprised! The tacos were delicious and flavorful. There are about 6 unique sauces they have to top your meal with, the beet crema was my personal favorite. The Brussels sprout nachos are a MUST. So delicious and cheesy, and considerably healthier than your typical loaded nachos. Margaritas were on point, not overly sweet. Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled shrimp and braised pineapple pork taco were both delicious
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Diego margarita and Prickly Pear margarita
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wduYRhuPoizFdvYtJO3EtA.text: { Dessert Review Only } We originally wanted to come for drinks but got sidetracked by another place down the street. Out of what we ordered I preferred the churro sundae (churro fries, vanilla soft serve, and dulce de leche) over the Mexican coffee (coconut soft serve, cold brew coffee, shaved Mexican chocolate, and dulce de leche). The soft serve itself isn't as creamy and more icy than most. Diego Pops has cute decor of pineapple wallpaper and sayings along the walls. For example Que Pasa on the door to the kitchen and Hola Bonita in the ladies room. I'm on a mission to come back and try the drink in the coconut.

rxsUtVKfdBcvFyCvLdkxtg.text: I went into Diego pops last weekend for happy hour with my boyfriend and we had such a great experience. Their house margaritas were so refreshing. Our server recommended the Brussels sprout nachos which they did not disappoint AND were half off (happy hour special). The manager came and checked on us and he was very friendly as well :)  We had our server Taylor surprise us with tacos and she brought out the pineapple pork, green chili chicken, and shrimp .... ALL were amazing. I recommend stopping by if you're in town! Great atmosphere and friendly staff!

v2wDtrmjKpDbaijvXleocw.text: My colleague and I wanted to get out of the office for lunch. She was in the mood for Mexican food so we decided on Diego Pops. It was a short walk from the office and had amazing reviews.   Before I go into my atrocious experience at DP I will give you a little background on myself. I've competed professionally in the IFBB for 9 years, and if you're familiar with the lifestyle, you know that in order to partake in social events you must be willing to pack your meals and bring them with you wherever you go. This was one of those days that I had to bring my meal with me.   Our waitress was extremely kind, and took my friends lunch order. As soon as my friend got her food I took out my Tupperware and began to eat with her. 5 minutes into our meal, the waitress approached our table and told me I could not have outside food. I politely told her I had food allergies and would gladly take my food outside. She said she didn't want me to have to do that, but, she did want to let me know that if her manager were to see me she would be extremely upset. After the waitress left our table I didn't think anything of it and continued on with my lunch.   The next thing I know I was blind sided by Rebecca (the upset manager) who started off the conversation by saying "What do you think you're doing?" She then continued to berate me in front of the entire restaurant. My eyes were wide with shock and my friend had her jaw to the floor because of the way I was being spoken to.   When she finally stopped talking to me as though I was her red headed stepchild, I told her I completely understood the policy of no outside food allowed, but, what I did not understand was why she was speaking to me so disrespectfully. She said I was the one who was disrespectful, and that I had made her waitress cry. Again, I was in shock because at no point during my conversation with the waitress did I feel like I said something that would warrant making her cry.   Regardless, I apologized to Rebecca for anything I may have said that would have made the waitress cry, however, she still did not have the right to speak to me that way. Rebecca continued to argue with me and at that point I just wanted to go. I asked her for her business card, which she said she would gladly provide and she left the table.   When she came back she provided me with her Managers card and verbatim said "This is my managers card. He will have my back because guess what? The customer isn't always right!"   My friend had had enough, and wanted to try to make Rebecca understand that what she was doing was not okay. However, Rebecca was just not willing to reason, and started to argue with her as well. My friend then asked for her bill. When Rebecca walked away to ring her up, my friend approached the waitress to apologize, to which the waitress responded, "I am so sorry. I'm embarrassed at how my manager spoke to you guys."  When Rebecca came back to our table to drop off the check, she slammed it down in front of my friend and walked away, but, not before giving her the dirtiest look possible.   I'm not sure if anyone else has visited DP and has dealt with Rebecca's horrendous customer service skills, but, this is by far the worst I've ever experienced.   I have been calling the number on the managers business card Rebecca provided me, and have had no success in reaching him. I'm asking for help, whether it be from a patron or employee, in trying to reach her manager and report this situation so that no one else will ever have to be treated this way.

CktWfrzfAet1FRybdmBlFg.text: I've eaten here multiple times and have never been super impressed with the food. I just keep going back for the atmosphere! I love the cute walls they have and it's just so cute it's hard to resist. The coconut spritzer was delicious and perfect for this alcohol free pregnant momma

oVSg3cbYbnQ-kf-96hYUtw.text: Such a fun restaurant. David was our server and he handled our party of 14 like a champ. He made the experience super enjoyable and was very helpful. Food is excellent and inexpensive. Highly recommend.

N-PsuTBJc-tPHcrT4VTpFg.text: Overpriced, crappy service. Nothing here made me want to come back or tell my friends about it. Simply "meh."

mfMAtSYN7szwUzMtNFgJPA.text: Diego pops has the most amazing food and drinks. The entire vibe of the restaurant is so fun. From their pineapple wall paper to cool decor. I had a snow cone watermelon  lime margarita, and a   coconut drink as well. To finish off my evening I had their Brussels sprout nachos and fell in love. I'm hooked......I will be coming here more often. Their staff was amazing, friendly, kind, and professional. I really had a blast here.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

EZslcSiLdtVvzOzt0vevGA.text: Loooovveed this place it's soooo pretty and love the elote came here for lunch with my mom and food was great they were nice and loved the culture! It's made me feel like I was at Mexico ok a trip! Definitely coming back!

WKbaQYZf9LgQxk3lxxxtgw.text: John is the best bartender ever. He's hilarious, attentive, great recommendations ex; street corn hot Cheetos you can't fuck w that. I love you John were stalking ya xoxo Georgie and Amy

LtiWIANZJ981w8ImsXlBIg.text: Went here Thursday, April 11th after seeing all the positive feedback on Yelp posts about this place. We were a party of four for dinner. The service was flaky at best as we waited at our table to be acknowledged by our server which seemed an extraordinary amount of time since it wasn't that busy. Just a few things that didn't give us the warm and fuzzies: having to ask for water for the table a few times with only one guest out of three getting a glass the rest were forgotten? Or ignored? Having our food come without napkins or cutlery? Just basic things like that. So we got up and started looking around for cutlery so we could start eating. Basically the vibe being given off was that we were an imposition to the place. The food was okay at best. I was hoping with 6 sauces up for offer it would be a flavour explosion. This was not the case. The tacos I had, beef, pork and one fish all tasted stodgy and lacked bright flavours. I couldn't tell the beef one from the pork apart based on flavour. Sincerely I was hoping this place would POP since I chose to take our in-laws here for dinner. I hope they at least improve the service as I don't see this place lasting long with all the competition in the taco market.

zeCZEghI2mbf_7Y0Os6vFA.text: A-M-A-Z-I-N-G ! ! !  I have been dining at Diego Pops in Old Town Scottsdale for a few years now, and they have never unsatisfied me!   The food is absolutely to die for; with all of the crazy concoctions they produce. I don't think there is one food item I have tried on their menu that did not satisfy.   The atmosphere of the restaurant is so amazing. As you walk in, there is a light up board that changes every so often. Throughout the restaurant there are various pieces of art, colorful walls, and neon signs. Music taste is AMAZING! We asked the server for the playlist, and haven't stopped listening to it since!   Prices are reasonable, for a dine-in restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale. Would highly recommend to friends and family.

v1C6aDj_P_bRx-v8YUuMBQ.text: Food was good, but the service was terrible. We waited for 10 minutes for a refill on water. Trying to pay for our meal took forever as well. Tried to pay by card, but was taking so long we dug out enough cash just to get the heck out of there.

hJnfCsT8hvteDtLwcNPF4A.text: This is just what we are looking for while visiting Scottsdale. Great friendly service and a wide selection of good tequila. The food is great too!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chili chicken taco in crispy shell and a fish taco. Amaze balls!!!

Tw0owCe9nYd5WgD0B7hx0Q.text: I was pleasantly surprised with their plantain tacos! Perfect balance of salty meets sweet! Great pop-in before taking the night on the town.

h9iQPuZCf7EN3G0AWIn-sQ.text: Amazing happy hour!!! A drink and two apps that left me very full was $13!!! I was worried that the food wouldn't be as good since it's such a trendy spot but I was pleasantly surprised as a tourist. Would highly recommend!

2wpO2AA9fBPpW7zBfppMhA.text: service was good, very efficient and fast the food was great, i got the shrimp tacos and they were amazing, not to mention their prickly pear margarita, Im making lunch plans with my mom here soon, so she'll definitely love it

BAY7AwXrb2SwRa3e1wma2g.text: Fantastic happy hour. The food was great, but much more tex-mex than authentic mexican food, but if you're just looking for some good tacos are margaritas then you have found a great spot!

Mt8vu7_uh0J5GG4AgXuYqA.text: Really solid spot for drinks and dinner on a Friday night in Scottsdale. We didn't make reservations so the wait for a table was a bit long (40minutes) but we were able to grab two seats at the bar right away. Drinks were well priced with pitchers of margaritas and beer for $17. The Brussel sprout nachos are a must try and the quesadillas are also very solid. Make sure to get the hot sauce rack - 6 different flavorful sauces - habero has a real kick.
