Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Stop in here for a quick taco. Got any box search me awesome bartender really knowledgeable great little place to stop in it

H-zzWMmqjcRihyD787oGbQ.text: I met S1 & S2 here for lunch. Diego Pops has a very cool vibe. The beautiful patio area on the south side of the restaurant is awesome.  Our host sat us right away with a smile and some pleasantries. The inside is clean with a slight midcentury groove. The exposed bricks on the interior does give the feeling of a retro fitted 80's Taco Bell (A good thing).   S had asked me where I wanted to eat. I checked out Yelp and it seemed that Diego Pops had so many 5 Star reviews I figured it must be amazing. Well, not so much. I was rushing so I didn't really read the reviews, I just scrolled down past the numerous 5 Stars. I should have read more. The issue is there are a lot of reviews that don't say anything about the food. Zip. Just "great service" so here's 5 stars. Wow. I guess if someone figures out a way to eat service I could understand it. But can you imagine someone writing a review for a movie and only saying the popcorn was great, the seats were comfortable and then say nothing about the movie but give it the top of the scale rating. Diego Pops is a restaurant. For me, good service is an expectation, not a luxury or "bonus" feature. I come for the food and if it's amazingly good and the service matches it, 5 stars for sure. But I've said it before, if the service is bad but the food is awesome, I'll come back and just make sure I get a different server but I certainly wouldn't toss out a 1 star with a lot of whining. In my opinion, it should be about the food.  Off the soapbox. All that being said, our service was great. Our server Taylor was very nice, kept our drinks filled, was not intrusive to our conversation and paced everything correctly. She answered our questions and generally made us feel welcome. She even handled ALL of the special requests S2 had with grace. Nice job Taylor.   We started our meal with an order of the Brussel Sprout Nachos ($10). Now this could possibly be one of the greatest food items of 2015. But, our order was just not done correctly. It's hard to tell how the Brussel sprouts are cooked because so many on our order weren't. Raw or almost raw Brussel sprouts can be a bit hard to chew and enjoy. I think these were supposed to be steamed and then sauteed but most weren't. Personally, I would just roast them but that's just me. The Brussel sprouts sit on a pile of really nice tortilla chips that are covered with street corn queso, queso Oaxaca, Fresno chili's, pickled onions and a roasted garlic beet crema. The whole pile is then topped with a fried egg. Ours was beautiful, perfectly cooked. Cutting into the egg and having it ooze over the nachos was just plain yummy. If the Brussel sprouts would have been cooked properly, this would have been an amazing dish.  S1 ordered the Skirt Steak Bowl ($11.) with coconut white rice and stewed beans. His bowl included the white rice and beans topped with a good portion of grilled skirt steak, house slaw, grilled onion slices and crispy leeks. The guacamole was mysteriously missing. S1 said this was a very tasty bowl. The skirt steak was cooked a bit on the well done side, but all in all a good effort.  S2 ordered a Braised Green chili chicken Taco ($3.50), a Crispy Cod taco ($4.) and a side of Cilantro Lime Rice ($2.) S2 said everything she ordered tasted fine but that it was nothing special. The green chili chicken was nicely spiced and the flavors well integrated. The crispy fish taco was also fine. She felt the fish could have had a bit more crisp to it but overall it was a good effort. She enjoyed the rice without much comment. It seemed to me like her whole meal was a good value.   I ordered the Crispy Cod bowl ($10.00) with brown rice and creamy beans. This was a miss ALL the way through. First and most important, the fish was not crispy. Nor would it ever be because it was sitting on top of the rice and creamy beans and then covered by the house slaw. So, it basically steamed and if there ever was a crispy coating, it was soggy before it reached our table. Why, if the main ingredient is the crispy cod, would you not put it on top to showcase it? This was a serious bush league mistake. The main ingredient should be the focus and standing out in all of its glory. The mistakes continued. There was no guacamole, I got pickled onion instead of grilled onion and there was no crispy leek anywhere. I think it bailed with the guacamole. So for ten bones I basically got what tasted like a tostada with soggy fish, without the tortilla. No Bueno.  We all ordered Iced Teas and at ($3) a piece, they're expensive even for Scottsdale. The tea was great and Taylor brought us all To-go teas to take with us so I guess in the end it's a wash.   I like Diego Pops. However I think the food could use some work if it's going to truly be a 5 Star, heck, even a 4 Star experience. Great service, Great vibe, fair prices, awesome Nachos in theory, average food at best delivered. 3 Stars

QUeHQEyJh0jI8SIySbP3KQ.text: I've been here many many times because of the fun vibe, tasty food and funky decor. I always hesitate coming due to the POOR service! They are never attentive or seem to happy to be serving us. Tonight we waited 15 minutes for our server to great us. It was during happy hour and we weren't given a Happy Hour menu until 30 minutes after we arrived. It was a disaster. What happened to earning your tip? Very disappointed in the service and most likely won't be returning after this experience tonight.

He was able to make sure we had an amazing experience by suggesting many different tacos which were delicious as well as their watermelon mint margaritas which come in pitchers! I highly recommend this place and ask for Anthony! He will make sure you have an amazing experience.

The tacos were mediocre at best and quite frankly for the whole "trendy street taco craze" there are so many better places. The actual servers were very on top it, polite and speedy. The food was kind of cold and way over priced. The margarita was strong, but not worth 10$. I probably wouldn't recommend this place...

kM2zq8xfaGOyI0fGnrNzmg.text: This was first restaurant stop during our AZ trip and  it was great start of our trip!  There was bit of wait but that just means it's that much loved by locals.  Amazing service; seriously we had so many people checking in with us throughout lol.  Food was awesome as well.  We ordered what seems to be their signature dish the nachos that did not disappoint.  And each of us ordered tacos and HH drinks which were quite tasty.

-8HU2ZiB2jvHtzXnQUn8mQ.text: I love this place! It's so cute and the patio is beautiful. We had Skyler as our bartender. She was friendly and engaging. She gave great recommendations too. I had the watermelon and mint margarita. It was taco Monday so I got 3 tacos for $3 each! I thought that was a great deal :)

loqjFCmo6S85IKgRihURjg.text: Mediocre margaritas, mediocre service. Worth stopping in if you are parched and it's not busy.

WjUCviavt0CxhOT7sSD4Vg.text: While the tacos are super tasty, I've been there 3 times now (every time we visit PHX) and the service is always terrible. While the food is really good, the service is bad enough that I won't go there again on my next visit to PHX.

jOWksCg8xIFsvuiu9oaaGw.text: The food was 10/10 would totally recommend! Sooo delicious! We ordered the corn queso & it was bomb! Also the pineapple pork taco was amazing. The green chicken Chile was kind of plain but still delicious.  Now on to the -2 Star. The service was one of the worse experiences I've ever had. I totally understand mistakes but I also feel customer service and satisfaction is very important. So first we ran out of chips and we had to ask twice to get more. Our waters weren't refilled until we asked. I ordered 2 tacos, 1 was wrong and the other had a chunk of plastic wrap in it which I bit into. When our server finally came to the table I informed her of the mistakes of my meal and she said well what do you want me to bring you. I just felt like the waitress should have taken initiative to fix my meal. Instead I ordered just one more taco to replace the wrong one. I was still charged for 2 tacos.

ayalzNKLKACBw4bur-I_zg.text: I came here after seeing the pink nachos on yelp. First of all, this place is so adorable and the food is delicious. If you check into yelp, you get a taco and huge glass of beer for five dollars. Basically, you get a free beer because one taco is around $4.50- $5.00.  I ordered a taco and we shared the artichoke nachos. The taco was good and I loved their selection of sauces. Some of my favorite sauces were the pink beet sauce and creamy cilantro sauce.  The artichoke nachos were delicious. They were crunchy and had a lot of cheese melted throughout. It had the delicious pink beet sauce drizzled on top of it.  I loved this place and I'm glad we stopped here to get lunch.

MM3DbPOYvv5m3hmibu9Rzw.text: Yum! Was in town and met up with a friend at this cute, colorful restaurant. The interior reminded me of a funky diner. We sat outside which was nice even in the early evening Sept weather. We each had a cucumber margarita, split a corn queso, and got a couple tacos. The margarita was nice and refreshing. I liked my tacos but I got two and only remember that I liked the shrimp. So the other one must have been "just ok."  But the Star was definitely the corn queso. I usually stay away from queso since it isn't the healthiest, but this was so good and wasn't heavy feeling. Plus it had corn in it...so that makes it healthy...right?   Great place to come for a drink and apps, meet up with friends, or bring a date.

8D2mgaEsWOKt9kJCpdu4dA.text: Possibly my favorite restaurant of all time. I've been here twice and both times were absolutely amazing. Cutest decor, it feels like a vacation.   And the food. Ugh, I could go on forever about how great it is. The chips and salsa are even amazing, and that's just the start. Try the brussel sprout nachos. I know it sounds strange, but trust me. They're to die for. All of the tacos are great, but my go to is the beef machaca. Try it with the green chili sauce. YUM. I would eat it every day.   Even the drinks are so fun! From a great classic marg, to the guava coconut drink, can't go wrong. (See the pictures for the guava coconut... it comes served in a real coconut and a little umbrella!!)   I wish this place was closer to me because I would actually be here all the time. DEFINITELY try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

NT0UGL6eLHEMn94knwK9bA.text: Came here last night for dinner. It was packed! Looked like the place to be.   SERVICE - The hostess was nice. Waiter was decent!   FOOD Brussel Sprout Nachos - Nachos w Brussels sprinkled on them. The pink beet cream was pretty good with it. Solid dish but I thought there would be more sprouts.   Grilled Shrimp Taco - Everyone raved about this so we had to try it. It was good but nothing spectacular. The corn salsa was good though. Probably best thing about the taco.   Plantain Taco - This was interesting. It wasn't bad, just different. Interesting flavors because the banana was sweet but then it sits on creamy beans. Not quite sure how I feel about it.   Coconut Rice - I really had high hopes for this but it wasn't that good. Didn't taste much like coconut and it was super mushy.   This spot is more so for the cool vibes and the social aspect. As for the food, I would choose to go somewhere else

uC815NLg-lPHXrE40Qkw2w.text: Two stars is generous and really only because they comped our entire dinner and our waitress was reasonable. We waited a very long time before anyone came to our table. When they finally did it was because I called her over. She was not assigned to our table but took care of us which was nice. We ordered appetizers, tacos, rice and beans. Our appetizer never made it. The tacos were very good which was a saving grace. The refried beans really had no flavor and to be honest looked like they came straight out of the can. The rice was basically white rice again without much flavor. The pork, chicken and shrimp tacos were excellent but the service and other items will likely keep us away from this restaurant.  The manager did come over and apologized but made an excuse about change of shift. Frankly that's not my problem....again they did, comp our dinner but there are so many restaurants around that area that we will try before going back.

ezGly-Jy6_J_RXzVIVqJMQ.text: Good food just takes a while to get seated. I only saw my waitress twice but i guess it was a busy night.

8Wy37m9PBNPqzuxfCmWk6Q.text: Diego Pops has an excellent happy hour!! The atmosphere is fun and chill. I recommend the brussel sprouts nachos, they are one of my favorites. The shrimp taco is also very delicious

2qkM5YOpwcugAf1z1hrQxg.text: Went to Diego Pops for happy hour on 4/2 and had a lovely time! Our server was amazing (I can't remember his name) and was so attentive which I find rare nowadays. Food was excellent (we had almost everything) and I highly recommend the prickly pear margarita!

vtU6Ufcl2rNEDFtbeu0k5g.text: The food is amazing!  Prices ok!  Attitude of some of the employees....EH!  A bit not so good!  Absolutely love their tequila selection!

Ye5w1Ss2kvX-qaykFMZr6A.text: Over-rated food, by a long shot. The atmosphere is very cool, and the staff were excellent - very friendly, attentive and fast...but our food sucked.   The chicken in my quesadilla was over-cooked and under-seasoned, my wife's $5 taco....meh, not impressed.  Good salsa and queso, so there's that.

uuqa8z4n3XvxRYvg9q6TKw.text: Pretty nice, but could be better. I like it just as much as most other restaurants- I just feel it isn't unique. the service is great and the food is okay.   I would say the sauce station is pretty nice but other than that the food is quite bland.    I don't know why I tend to come back.  Some dishes are exceptional while others are just so-so.  This gets a b- lol

Y-kmRLokMUcC9hDgXdNlwA.text: My fav taco tuesday spot in the Valley !

-LKL_uyUUoDeXBXLFacJGQ.text: Great food and service! Best time to come is Monday during happy hour for taco Monday specials on top of other HH drink and app specials.

nSEO8Lppdt-J1USmljaj9A.text: Diego Pops looks like it was designed to be instagrammed, so I didn't necessarily have high expectations for what the food would taste like but was pleasantly surprised. A coworker and I are in town for business and stopped in on a Monday night, and it was surprisingly pretty busy around 6:30pm but we were able to be seated right away.   We started with some guacamole and chips that came out immediately, but it was just slightly bitter and was browning in parts, so they obviously weren't using fresh avocados. I had 1 pineapple pulled pork taco on a corn tortilla and 1 crispy cod taco on a flour tortilla, and both were super flavorful with fresh toppings. The sauce caddy they put on the table really makes the experience though, you get 6 squeeze bottles to choose from with inventive flavors like serrano ranch, chipotle aoli, habanero oil, garlic beet crema, and 2 others. The beet sauce on the cod taco is next level.   We also split the sweet corn and avocado salad with caesar dressing and adobe chicken that was pretty large and one person easily could have had as a filling entree. For 2 ppl our bill was $55 including 2 margaritas, so the food was a fantastic deal, but the service left a bit to be desired. It took awhile to get our server's attention and when I asked another for an extra bowl she looked at me and then walked away. Yikes.

QPnBqlJxLHAtUEXVUW0Nag.text: The decor of the place is super cute. I enjoyed the neon lights, quirky decor and the night life atmosphere that it created. Came here with a coworker for drinks after a long day and the margaritas did not disappoint. We each got our own tacos but the True VIP of the meal was the True Corn + Avocado Caesar w/ Chicken salad. It was creamy deliciousness! Our own server seemed M.I.A. at times but it seemed like they worked as a team because there was always some one to help us get something.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

B2R2gff7s0FSSTncCpN8XA.text: There's some great reasons why DP's has over 2400 4-5 star reviews-it's on fire!! While staying in Scottsdale I strolled by this location several times and each time it was flooded with people and look like so much fun! After finally getting around to trying it I was able to put myself on the waiting list via Yelp while I was in my Uber on the way over. This saved me a ton of time! I also requested a patio seat as always. When I arrive the servers were very friendly and you could already tell the restaurant was popping, generally with the younger crowd of people 20-30's. When I sat down a girl Next to me had two dogs at their table. They said one of the best things about Diego Pops is that they have a dog friendly patio (bonus points on my end)! After several minutes the girl from the table next to me made some food recommendations and started asking me where I was from. Since she was friendly we began to talk and next thing I know they were scooting my table next to theirs so we could all eat together. I was so humbled by the fact that they were such sweet locals here. She recommended the street corn queso which was absolutely phenomenal! I ate every single bit!! Their house margarita was also incredibly delicious but if you can't handle that much sugar order like I did and get the skinny version it was still very tasty!  For my meal I ordered three street tacos including the shrimp taco, the brussels sprouts taco, and the plantain taco. The shrimp was my favorite but to be fair by the time I made it to the other two I was already full from the street corn queso (love)!! The service was impeccable here and the noise level was what you would expect from a very busy restaurant with two bars and a younger crowd. I love the dining set up with the open patio it made for such a fun meal with some fresh air. If I come back to Scottsdale I will definitely visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hostess stand
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Inside bar
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. New Menu items

VBEDP0EdGaAw05SBrO8Yxw.text: so here's the deal... I totally thought Diego Pops was another trendy restaurant where girls went to drink mediocre margaritas and take cute selfies... SO glad I was totally wrong. The tacos were actually mouth-watering and I will definitely be coming back - and not just for the cute backdrops and great lighting. They have a great lil happy hour and I would definitely suggest Diego pops to anyone in the area!!

rgTlgsI5AFkzgWfDtqMFuQ.text: Fun and frivolous tacos in Old Town Scottsdale.   Great for a date night or group dining.     All of the tacos we tried were great (skirt steak, shrimp, chicken, etc).   Also loved the street corn and the guacamole.   Taco's are plated on served on a small cookie sheet.  Chip COMA...!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

L0Rm6EvdupWQib-ioM1lPw.text: One of the best places in Scottsdale for happy hour. The outdoor patio of Diego pops is awesome. Food is great ( get the nachos ), soup is awesome too- there is so much chicken. It's location is awesome and is a great spot for drinks. I am at Diego pops a few times a month for happy hour 5/5 stars.   I highly recommend Having David as a server- super friendly and helpful.

9uub6LVSdPZPY0GgSqxhJQ.text: I've been before and this time decided to try the Poke and the Brussel Sprout Nachos. Both came out incredibly quick but the flavors were just meh. I think the sprouts weren't fully cooked which took away from the nachos for me, and the miso in the poke left a bit of a burnt flavor. The staff was particularly spacey this visit, and I'd suggest staying away from their house Diego Margarita if you're looking for anything close to an authentic marg. Probably will not be back for a long time.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussels Sprout Nachos
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Poke

3NEM7mxIjHjzjQ2X7owvRQ.text: First things first - I want to start with poor management skills and customer service.   I called the week before we flew into Scottsdale looking for a Mexican restaurant that was trendy and fun. I have coworkers that live in Scottsdale and (until recently) were recommending us to go there for dinner for a Bachelorette party. The restaurant doesn't take reservations but the person I spoke with on the phone told us to show up 45 minutes early and they wouldn't have a problem accommodating 13. Myself and one other girl from the group decided to show up 45 minute early to put our name on the list and go to a bar next door for a drink while we waited. We gave our name, number of people, and our phone number, we were told a 30-40 minute wait. After 45 minutes went by we missed a phone call and decided to walk back next door and get our reservation - we assumed they were calling to tell us we were ready as we only missed the call by 3 minutes. NOPE.  Once we got there they rudely told us it would be ANOTHER 45 minute wait after we had already waited for 45 minutes. We had canceled our other two reservations for dinner to go to Diego Pops after the phone call we had the previous week. The two girls working at the hostess table had nothing to say besides shrug their shoulders and say it would be another 45 minutes (when it was already 8:15 and we had already waited). Their terrible customer service and stuck up attitude pushed me to sign up for a yelp account and save other people looking for a dinner restaurant in Scottsdale. There are so many other options with great food and atmosphere that I'd recommend you'd go. If you have a fun group of ladies at a Bachelorette try - The Montauck. They saved us on a night they were super busy given our circumstance. Super fun and the manager treated us to complimentary champagne. Bless him.  Good Luck.

ZZzGV63SjsOgQhzJK4UzXQ.text: David...the best guy and server you could ever have. Fun and energetic and the exact guy you want for a fun Friday night happy hour!!

SazE4Cjjp6wfVL0wGBa1aQ.text: Super chill vibe, young crowd and the food is decent.  Our service was okay and I feel like this would be a great spot for Taco Tuesday.  The food and Drinks come out at a reasonably timing also.  Street corn is bland and the bean burritos are small.  The machaca Taco barely had any meat, that was extremely disappointing. There was literally only a bite of meat on a taco, what's the point?  The house Marg was surprisingly delicious and the watermelon lime snow cone was not good, don't bother!  Nothing special about this place but nothing wrong with a taco spot!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

kdta54TQsg5oT1lIhDSofA.text: I'm semi-regular at Pops. I love the outdoor patio bar seating (when one can sit outdoors, do so!). Pops has a diff vibe depending on the hour. Lunch,l and happy hour are much diff from pre-club hours.  The food is great. I always go for the Street Corn Queso, which is a creamy-chunky white cheese dip w corn for the chips. The tacos are also worthy. I eyeballed the neighbors brussel sprout nachos because they looked fantastic. Next time.  My one star deduction is for the hit or miss service during my many visits. Sometimes the bar is inattentive. Also, my pet peeve is when a bartender does not wipe bar between seatings. Today was not the case. Super bar service and the back was hustling.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

P1OgN-PxblOhALBd-ZL3YA.text: This is a really fun location and a good atmosphere to go to with friends. Even though they don't really do reservations, they did a great job accommodating my large group. I'd recommend keeping it to a medium-sized group, though. The happy hour was great, and everyone seemed to enjoy the food. I loved my berry mojito and the guava coconut drink! The guacamole with plantain chips and salmon rice bowl were really good. Make sure to check the size of the tacos to pick the right quantity and let them know if you don't want the food spicy. Thanks, Diego Pops, for a great time!

z5V5m9gBbFQNlz3eUgS5Mg.text: Those nachos didn't stand a chance. The cheese was yummy and the chips were toasted just right. The corn on the cob reminded me of when I lived in Fort Worth and would get corn in a cup from a vendor cart on the street corner. I wanted to try the snow cone margarita but our sever advised against it. (Said it was kind of difficult to drink) I settled for a sangria rojo and house margarita. Overall we enjoyed the food and experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Corn on the cob
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Nachos.

eAMJiGqIaGcuG6VIHjxjog.text: The CUTEST, most instagrammable restaurant in Old Town Scottsdale!! Great ambiance and adorable decor complete with pineapple wallpaper - the ultimate restaurant for foodie/blogger pics!  The food is even colorful (see Brussels sprout nachos!) BUT unfortunately it didn't quite live up to the visual appeal.   Case in point - We were told the nachos were the best item on the menu and they were super pretty but it honestly was not anything special. Not worth ordering. I was also excited to try the crispy cod taco (definitely crispy but the tiniest piece of fish) and the pineapple pork tacos but they were pretty standard. My friends got the poke and chicken taco bowl and said they were decent.   Fun spot for a group but they don't take reservations and the restaurant isn't too big so be prepared to wait!

sIurrIHvGF-TTKlMoxbStA.text: Visited this spot on a Sunday for lunch while visiting Scottsdale. The food and service were both spectacular! I ordered vegetarian items- brussel sprout taco & the bean and cheese burrito. My husband ordered civeche, wings and a pork taco. Everything was delicious! Our waiter was cool, calm and friendly. We sat on the patio with the misters and the vibe was good.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel sprout taco, bean &amp; cheese burrito

HvhrNAfpGXBtEOQeG_YpFw.text: One of my most favorite dining experiences was at Diego Pops in Old Town. The atmosphere is perfect for a quick and light dinner before going out! I would recommend trying their guava coconut served in a baby coconut. It reminded me of the Caribbean islands! We started with street corn queso and guacamole (both were amazing!). I was feeling veggie that night, so I opted for the bean and cheese burrito which was fantastic, and the other girls mentioned that their tacos were equally as yummy.  A definite must go-to if you're in Old Town for dinner & drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guava coconut! Yum!

bajPWUpxaUa4mxwCvYx7Sw.text: Extremely underwhelmed from my visit to Diego Pops. Given that Diego Pops has four stars on yelp I was expecting great food, drinks, and decor. I thought  the decor was going to be much cuter than it was but in reality it just a regular restaurant with a couple neon signs, nothing spectacular.    We ordered the watermelon snow cone margarita, mango habanero snow cone margarita, and the mini churros. Both snow cone margaritas were just a standard margarita in a shallow glass with a massive ball of frozen solid ice placed on top so that it resembled a snow cone but was not edible like snow cone ice. The snow cone ice had no flavoring like that of a regular snow cone and the ice ball honestly just took up space in the glass which was small to begin with. At 11 dollars a piece I found the snow cone margarita to be extremely over priced given the small amount you receive and the lack of flavor. The mini churros were also very mediocre, they came out in a paper cup with a chocolate sauce and icing sauce both which were cold making it hard to dip the churros in and the churros got hard shortly after they were brought out.   Our waiter was nice enough but overall I was very disappointed from my visit and will not return in the future.

X7gVpD6SUVg160DaLUABrg.text: Great atmosphere good food as far as bar food goes not the best thing in the world but I like it cauliflower nachos are interesting pretty good

Wplw4VGKRWTWczdKeEjnKQ.text: I seriously LOVE this place, from the well thought out decor to the astounding food and drinks, this is a taco Tuesday destination. I am a huge Mexican food buff and am known to enjoy a michelada here and there and let me tell you this place delivers in every possible way. Make sure you top off your entree with their heavenly pink beet crema, before you say that sounds weird you know the saying, don't knock it til you try it and you will be glad you did. If I lived anywhere close to Diego pops I would easily be here once a week.

hBFDQ_4rNPWYSs1RbZQ49A.text: First time to this restaurant as a party on a Saturday evening. We hadn't booked a table and just turned up. It was very busy and we had to wait about 40 minutes but the turn over of tables was quick. A great atmosphere and music. When we got our table and ordered the food arrived quickly. Lovely food and a good price. The waitress was very helpful. Would go again

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

30wcdNdoTtgFhWlsPbH2sw.text: Another fantastic happy hour at Diego Pops!   The Tortilla Soup is the best in town.  And tonight's server David may be one of the best servers we have ever had in any restaurant.  He was super friendly and took his job and responsibilities seriously. David made tonight even better than any other time here.

lGFwET7GY6d4jB-rzHye2w.text: Loved the food, the staff and the atmosphere! Healthy options + tacos... I'll definitely be back!

GQJ6VeX_O0PbEiMpzT3SWA.text: Snow cone margaritas were awesome. Queso was bland. Skirt steak tacos were the best thing I tried. Cilantro lime rice was ok but also bland. I loved the snow cone margaritas!

WuZfT--mMk7myomq57P2Ew.text: Great atmosphere and service. Some of the best original salsa and a good variety of original tacos.

V9TnrK18iNWY9kjbxcr5Cg.text: Don't waste your money. Stopped for an early dinner but won't ever go back. Very slow service. So loud you can't have a conversation. Our order was lost so we waited a long time. Beef tacos were ok but $4.50 per taco is pretty steep. Green chili chicken stew was very bland. No accommodation was offered for the problems we encountered. When we walked to our car in the valet area about 20 feet from the front door we were charged $6. No signs anywhere about the cost of valet. Most places in Old Town offer complimentary valet.  There are so many good restaurants in Old Town cross this one off your list.

q_mTgiKk4ZG-qve3tk6WoA.text: It is very nice. It has great food. Tacos are small. So if hunger 2 or 3 is best. The bowel are great. People are great that work there. It's in old town in scottsdale,az. Happy hour starts at 3pm.

fzNiuJJCL0ldnRHp99ClDg.text: Terrible service.  Getting drinks was a 30 minute ordeal each round.  Apparently the bar was "backed up" yet they had four people back there and it wasn't even full.  We're just talking about pouring beer too.  Nothing even remotely challenging.  The appetizers came out well before our first round.   Once we finally got going, the table was never pre-bussed and waters went unfilled.  The worst part is, the manager(s?) were running around and didn't check on us once or god forbid offer us an apology.  Either they are completely oblivious, lazy or just don't give a shit.  The Brussels sprout nachos were good.  The entrees were decent but cold.    A complete disaster.  My prediction; gone within 6 months given such untrained, poor service.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Apparently the four people tending this empty bar were too &#34;backed up&#34; to pour a beer in less than 30 minutes.
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Filthy, un-bussed tables everywhere.

Ku3-DTLojN7BL8PKm3XHdQ.text: We tried this place, we wanted to like it. My friends were all about it. But the service was so-so. The tacos were nothing worth writing home about and I wasn't impressed with any of the food we got. It was bigger than it looks outside. The space was nice and when it cools down, the patio looks like the place to be. I may give happy hour a shot. My friend got a girlie drink, can't remember which one and she liked it a lot, Some fruity mojito... so if that's your thing, give it a shot.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Taco
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Wings
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Patio seating

AstWkZGSkW5pnjylcO13HQ.text: Probably my favorite Tacos in All of Arizona. Cory and his crew serve up some of the best tacos i have tried.  Carne Asada and Pineapple Pork are my Faves.  Can't wait to try the Brussels Sprout Nachos

5TODjXjz89ods-w-i0rOiQ.text: Awesome place. Good food, good vibes. Phoebe was a great server. Had crispy cod bowl with coconut rice. Yum! Especially topped with some of their signature sauces. Will definitely come back again if in Scottsdale again.

3eXXLEGeRLaqyVV8iGRIlA.text: I come here a few times a month to meet my boyfriend for lunch hour. Food here is absolutely amazing! Very unique, we always get the brussels sprout nachos. I know it sounds weird, try it.   The service is pretty slow however, if you are on a timeline let the server know right away otherwise it's going to be one long lunch.   I never noticed the Treat Stand before my last visit. I ordered a $2 ice cream cone with fruity pebbles and received an amazing bucket of ice cream! Im absolutely coming back even if it's just for the treats. For $2 you'll need to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. For size comparison. $2 ice cream!!!!
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Don&#39;t walk past the treat stand.

Uhnsb_s-geH8_fZ1WYCJzw.text: Ugh, instagram did me wrong. This place gets 10/10 for being 'grammable but otherwise underwhelmed me. Tacos, guacs and margarita were all just okay.

j_wwmJXsidBklZQRX0dW7g.text: Second time stopping in here while traveling to the area for work. Ambiance is amazing, colorful, and as a Chicagoan I love eating dinner outdoors in December :)   Food wise you can't go wrong. The street corn queso is a must, the tacos are all excellent, the trail mix salad is also really really tasty. Oh and the drinks and sangria are not to be missed!

svPPTvpmRQm7414dLfMIuw.text: Really delicious and for a great price. I had the grilled shrimp bowl and the serving size was huge! Salsa has a kick and everything is fresh and not greasy. I left feeling satisfied. Also-they have a great happy hour and tacos are $2 on Mondays  --update-- Man I still love this place.   Happy hour is 3pm-6pm and they're cocktails are killer. There are two snow cone margaritas to choose from: watermelon lime or mango elderflower. Save room for dessert! Along with their cocktails they have a great dessert menu which includes ice cream you can have dipped in fruity pebbles.

0UdX47XgIzjijp7Yw6cTyQ.text: While in town on vacation, I walked here from my hotel on the search for awesome tacos, and Yelp didn't lie! I sat at the bar and met the bartender Jessica, who made me feel welcomed and was extremely nice. I ordered the cod taco and steak taco and oh man, I did the happy food dance while eating them...I was not disappointed! The watermelon mint margarita also put a smile on my face. The ambiance is open and welcoming with great upbeat music playing. Definitely would come here again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

F5uGfQr0skd1_BUoZS7JdA.text: If you took out the server's attitude it would have made for a better experience. It was not appreciated and did not go with the laid-back atmosphere. Our server made it seem like she was inconvenienced to take our orders...  Beyond that, the food was good. Definitely try the brussels sprout nachos-who would've thought?! I also had the braised pork taco, grilled shrimp taco, and plantain taco. Even though they are street tacos they do a good job of packing in the flavor and quantity of food in each tortilla. Highly recommend making resies.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussels sprouts nachos

b7_d-d0Sg-vRU-zWm_QOrw.text: Great drinks and great service. Anthony was awesome! Michalada bombs are the best drink

U-w4bCZMdRkTU7bTZPcuuA.text: Great service, super fresh food and Fabulous value for money.  Craving tacos we thought we'd give this restaurant a try.   Started off with chips, salsa and guacamole and I must say i was super impressed by it all. The plantain chips in particular were a big hit.  The tacos were good especially given the price point. The salad was incredibly fresh (rare to find) and tasty.  Left feeling very satisfied without breaking the bank.  Atmosphere was cool and the service was amazing. They are super friendly and eager to please!  While it wasn't the best tacos or Mexican I've had, the price point and service made up the 5th star

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Plantain tacos.. Good but a little sweet for me
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Free shrimp tacos (randomly given to us)
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Plantain chips and guacamole

I-wUPKnPaPprTynMIi4A1g.text: Fish tacos and Brussel sprout nachos are a MUST!!! I never would have though anyone in our family would be a fan of the Brussel sprout nachos but WOW are the delicious, I could literally eat those as my meal and get nothing else. They also have a pretty decent happy hour $5 margaritas and $4 beers. It's fun and trendy but on top of it all they actually have good food. I was really happy with this place and I will definitely be back.

3_dLDhElO75ZT8FWu8O9aQ.text: Prejudice?...Could have even been considered racist!!! We showed up with my family for dinner, a party of 13 on Saturday at 5:30pm, just ahead of us were also two large parties as well, one of 12 and the other of 9. When it was our turn to be seated, the seating hostess was incredibly rude, unaccommodating and basically told me that they were not the kind a restaurant that could seat large parties!  So I asked if we could split our party and sit in two groups, and the seating hostess aside from being rude was very reluctant to figure out how to get our party seated. The restaurant was as usual very busy at that time, but there were clearly a few open tables! Since she just stood there as she silently stared at me, I asked her if she was basically asking me to leave, and she proceeded to tell me that "if it were her, she would want to be seated with all her family." In other words, the answer was "yes"  We have lived in Arizona for thirty years now, and this is sadly the third time I've been treated in such a despicable manner. Perhaps, it was because we didn't fit the profile "look" in order to eat at Diego Pops, perhaps it was because I had brought my parents and my 94 year old aunt and cousin who were visiting from out of the country. Either way, this was a terrible experience and it's very unfortunate this restaurant gave off such an  unwelcoming, snobbish and even prejudice vibe (due to race, age, maturity?) The employee working as the seating hostess should NOT be your front of the house person! Although the food was good, I'm not sure it could ever make up for making someone feel so unwelcome and treated so unkindly!

PQtSp39V92Ra0B09LMwjRw.text: Great food and an amazing selection of unique drinks. They have a great selection of tequila and mezcal, up to and including a shot that's $80! I did not try it...but I will one day.   Ashlyn, our bartender, was the best! She is so friendly and accommodating! My friend and I were interested in the mezcal and thankfully she let us try it first. The best I can say is that it's an acquired taste!  I'm really into Diego Pop's. Great drinks and great service, especially at the  bar. It's also not too crowded so you can get your drinks and food quickly. Margaritas are on lock.  If you are in Scottsdale check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tequila!

XiDwhEQTBig8xbZ1hPBthQ.text: Pregnant women beware. Want to know if the cheese is pasteurized? Well, it all depends on who you ask. The waitstaff doesn't have any clue and isn't quick to check with the chef. Last week I was told my dish was made with pasteurized cheese only to find out today that it isn't (or so they say). I hope the chef can educate their staff (and perhaps include details on menu) so that future moms don't have to worry about miscarrying secondary to listeria. Listeria is deadly but also preventable. Future parents have enough to worry about without having to deal with inaccurate information from ill informed waitstaff. Shameful.

rqqInkPOO_CtfJuY8-uXKw.text: This place is awesome. We stopped in last week with my wife and in-laws and had a great time. The food was fantastic! Honestly, zero complaints. We ordered some chips and salsa for an appetizer to start. The salsa was very tasty and we LOVED the sauces they brought with them. The beet sauce was incredible. 3 of us ordered a few tacos and one ordered a bowl. We honestly enjoyed all our food thoroughly. We will definitely be back!

1IUVfAXRE68zghrp3uWclw.text: Casual dining, reasonable prices, friendly service, and great food!  If you don't fill up on the homemade salsa, guacamole and tortilla chips, try the Crusted Cod in a bowl with creamy beans and coconut rice!  As we say in Hawaii "broke da mouth!"  My friends also enjoyed the green chile chicken burrito and skirt steak tacos. Check it out!

OCE375QWf8sGBL-kP5717Q.text: Nachos are the best! Great environment and service also!

pmQ7sfNCpwwOOs7MHvnYoQ.text: I new age twist on authentic Mexican cuisine! This place is super good! Got there breakfast burrito super yummy fresh avocado yum! Great price awesome environment. One of the owns came out and gave us our food super nice guy!

2i-rY02fbxmTa4vvX2pDMg.text: Absolutely amazing!  Servers remember you! Always smiling. Perfect happy hour. The habanero mango wings yuuumm.

m_nKd0M97RbhTO-RXn8cyA.text: I just had the best experience of my life in Hispanic dining and it was at Diego pops. Who would have thought. If I may, the service was beyond anything I have ever received in my life. Emily was not only our waitress but what felt like, my friend. She was very sweet and had s subtle confidence about her that made every decision we made flawless. Emily made us feel like family and on Cinco de Mayo, I couldn't ask for more. Hats off to delicious food, upbeat attitude and above all else, Emily. I hope she gets a raise. Star player!

gGI1RdYmAFsp55pUTRC75w.text: Went here for cinco de mayo. Sat very quick for as busy as it was excellent service. Excellent food. Wonderful vibe. Will come back.

KA6cr4m1I_AOWP0v0B6Q9Q.text: This was a real find!  We came during happy hour and tried most of the appetizers.  The most fantastic, hands down, is the Tortilla soup.  The broth is so good, wishing I had the recipe.  Service was great, and you can't beat the flavors and the value.  This place is a must!

Eg2_jXBEPEKY889_-mLnNg.text: Diego Pops, is a modern tequila and taco lounge/ restaurant! I love it! It's not what you think it is coming from the outside but everything about the logo and what they are about is True! Neon, modern edgy and of course the decor inside is what made me love it more! The service was wonderful not too rushed and we probably came at the wrong time but that didn't stop me. I've been hearing about the Nachos, it's not just any nachos it's the Brussels sprout nachos! From the flavor to the cheese and to the ingredients everything is so outstanding in flavor! You see I never had a Brussels sprout but it's kinda like a more flavorful broccoli! I give it 2 thumbs up! They also have different sauces from chipotle mayo to a Serrano ranch! Tacos are outstanding but it's based on one, there's so much more j want to try! Cocktails and the specialty drinks are wonderful and different! Must try the coconut drink it comes in vodka and tequila! So if you are in the Scottsdale area give it a try stop by! By yourself or with you or friends!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. BRUSSELS SPROUT NACHOS (10) /5 on Happy hour 3pm-6pm M-F

4KgJ6Kgh2KnlOlL0zry1yg.text: Last night was my fourth visit to Diego Pops.  We just love the place.  The decor is so cool, the food is delicious and somewhat different than most Mexican restraints, and the service is outstanding.  Give it a try, I think you will agree!

AG6EwLN0qi5BvN2PRT-SAw.text: Just got back from there and my experience falls in line with what others have said.  Food was awesome, but don't go during peak time.  The service is pretty bad.  Our server completely forgot our appetizer and went back to put it in 20 minutes after we had ordered it.  The kitchen was backed up so of course it came out with the tacos.  It wouldn't have been a huge deal if we weren't starving.  It's too bad, because I really liked the food but it's gonna be hard to convince my fiance that we should go back.

nr3XFXz1bRp913AbDBxAjw.text: Great Tacos and beer selection. The carne asada was my favorite, the tortilla soup was delicious! Wonderful ambience as well, with the patio seating and music. Nice lively and casual place for dinner, just the way I like it!! We'll be back

F6Q4bZi_24Imkv8jiM1kSQ.text: There was a mistake with our reservation pushing it back one hour. Corey was extremely accommodating and very apologetic, giving us drinks at a sister restaurant and significantly discounting what turned out to be an excellent dinner. Very good food, very good customer service in light of the mix up.

Cy7idPGHqbsG9juuAGBlnw.text: We came in on Memorial Day and took advantage of the happy hour taco menu - the skirt steak and braised pork with pineapple tacos were super tasty and a decent size.  We started with the street corn queso and ate it all up...it was really good!  The patio is great and pretty large, the service was friendly and the food was good.  We had a few issues with our order, but they rebounded and made it right.

Y_VnolJYotnWcr-xmqWymA.text: Taylor made the best recommendations after hearing what I normally like (even making suggestions that weren't on the menu)! Delicious food with a fabulous patio dining experience.

2FcSGYzrRsOIFVInhiJ05g.text: Food & service was excellent. Salsa was fresh and spicy, guac was great. I only had 2 tacos but would have loved to eat more. The shrimp was fantastic, there were different levels of flavor. I added some chipotle mayo hot sauce on it. Steak taco was great as well. The atmosphere was very relaxed, great bar area & outdoor dining. Margaritas were good & great Mexican beer selection on tap!

OzqHtObEqDq_pl7sVCuA5w.text: LOVE this place! The decor is super cute, and I can spend all day & night on the patio. Their fried plantains are to die for, as well as their prickly pear margarita. The crispy cod is my favorite taco- but you can't go wrong with any of them. Great location & vibe

eKbKCESkWwflC4nM9H8FXw.text: Loved the outdoor patio. Margaritas, chips and Guacamole, $2 tacos on Monday. It was all good.

ifXf-FWkvYUALtwstPTTFw.text: I was not impressed. I came here based on the good ratings and it was just average at best. I ordered the Diego margarita, Brussels sprout nachos and the chicken and pork tacos. For a Mexican restaurant, I expected the margaritas to be better. It was only $4 though so the speciality ones are probably better. The Brussels sprout nachos were good. The tacos were very boring. The green chile chicken taco did not taste like green chile at all and was very plain. The server never brought us the sauces for the tacos so that is probably why they were so dry/boring. I did not realize until after the meal that every other table had the basket of sauces.   The service was fast and we did not wait long for our food, which was great. The prices were also very good.

YOjQ9GaKDQFLMeN4HkMCtQ.text: We frequently go to Diego Pops because it is walking distance from work. We have done group lunches there and I've also met non-work friends there to introduce them to the amazing food there. The service has always been amazing. The food is even better. I've only had one issue there (accidentally had pineapple on my salad which wasn't supposed to come with pineapple) and it was resolved very quickly. If you are vegetarian I recommend the House Salad and add avocado. The chips and guacamole are a must-have also. They have some unique options of iced tea as well as other drinks. The decor is adorable and the restaurant is always clean including the bathrooms.

UJCG3oWddbqaMb8TIcLhqw.text: I love the food and atmosphere! But one con was the way I saw the management treating the servers. The experience with the front of house employees was already excellent, but imagine it could be so much better without the manager Steve undermining their intelligence and ability to perform their daily tasks. Just some food for thought!

sBGUEUSOGDaTYTQ4J6nZAw.text: Fun, hip and trendy little Taco shop with a limited, yet unique menu. Enjoyed some later evening eats here as our first stop at another nearby restaurant was disappointing.   The crunchy green chile chicken taco was tasty - the crunch was perfection. Unfortunately our food wasn't hot and normally we'd send it back if that's the case, but we were quite hungry by the time we visited.   The Plantains are "Platanos" (the sweet fried kind to those who aren't familiar). We'd wished they were "Tostones" since we prefer the savory, crunchy unripened plantain.  The margaritas were good. I really enjoyed trying each of the 6 sauces they offer to customize your taco. They all were great and some unique (like the Beet Crema - mild yet flavorful - delish!). I'll admit the sauces were probably my favorite part of the experience. If our food was hot, the tacos would have been the star.  Pleasant, friendly staff. We dined at the bar.

HY7BN8MVBU-zoAOfNyOWeQ.text: Very cool restaurant! The decor is awesome, featuring stadium style seating in the waiting area, license plate drink menu holders, and vintage prices. It was very crowded on a Saturday night, which was to be expected, but my party of 2 was seated within 10-15 min. The guacamole was awesome! We each ordered various individual tacos (try the plantain one!) and had a side order of coconut rice (delicious!) & beans. All tacos are offered on flour, corn, or crunchy shells or in bowl form!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YGQsJmn7S6N1BZb58Ip7sQ.text: They were ok. Most food in old Town is over priced and bland. These guys aren't over priced but wasn't spectacular.

xLaz6fWIOFoI_omiDdARiA.text: Wow! Definitely a great place to eat! Definitely one of the best tacos (braised pineapple pork) I have ever had! Delicious drinks. Sit at the bar the bartenders will give you the inside scoop on the best ways to customize the food, like adding steak to the queso and which tortilla to choose for the tacos. Definitely recommend! Will be coming back next time we're in town.

rwq7Y8sjyqDU1UnHtQnT5A.text: Fun place to get a bite to eat!! We love it for girls night or date night. The Brussels sprout nachos are incredible and the service is great too. Margarita with tajin is a nice touch.

v-ukTnXTPBBHiibcvSRDpQ.text: One of my favorite places for tasty food and great prices on happy hour with even better service! Cory is always welcoming and so nice. I highly recommend this place.

RrurS2dDk9vFy7eaQVIAKw.text: This restaurnt is one of the best Mexican restaurants in Phoenix. I go so often and have the best time!

PUsB0_16DroqGj2BBGHTlA.text: I love Diego Pops! Always a great atmosphere and great prices! My only reason for the 4 stars in the consistency in the drinks, I feel as though whenever I order a margarita it's a flip of the coin of whether or not it will be good! It won't stop me from going, I am definitely a regular, just wish the margs were always good!

0q9RTXx5-zQ7gokvEAHTnA.text: Overall I really enjoyed myself. The wait staff was pleasant and totally fine with making changes to tacos or other dishes. The food itself came out piping hot (which I love) and was so tasty. My ONE complaint was that I would love some spicier salsa, but its already like 100 degrees so...

sTftPfOqzF5rcVmnDg2m4Q.text: This place is my go-to when friends are in town! The atmosphere is upbeat and the decor is very fun. I always always order the Brussels sprout nachos - they're a MUST! They also have really great drinks - prickly pear margarita and Paloma are both delicious.

AXcCRt-AHBDWrK7M1-TCUQ.text: My favorite restaurant - all the apps are amazing, BUT you must have the Brussels sprouts nachos! I know, I know, sounds weird...but everyone I have try them falls in love. Taco bowls are also super delicious! You will love it!

rg23weuAwxpt6BmvKUa3QQ.text: Nice decor and vibe. I loved the indoor/outdoor setting. It's a great place to watch a game, hang out with friends, or have a family outing.  Unfortunately, not very vegetarian friendly. Only one veggie taco available - Plantain Taco. It was definitely interesting, but personally not my taste in tacos. I did like the option to have a corn or flour tortilla with my taco. Really disappointed no one brought be the sauce tray, especially since I'm a big condiment person.   Guacamole and salsa was delicious! Too spicy for me, but the best I've had in town.   Three stars because I would definitely come back to hang out with friends and have some snacks, however, I wouldn't come back just for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Plantain Taco on Flour Tortilla
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guacamole and Salsa

5gVq4oOPblqtegzJnUyGPQ.text: I love this place. I travel a lot- eat a lot of places- I always come back here when I'm in town

Qu1380l0Y51VEdvxHpWl_A.text: What can I say. We showed up with a group of 15 and the service was exceptional. Too boot the food was delicious  and the servers were great I can't wait to visit again!

mwX92ZIPbB-2gGNnn_s7jQ.text: Nice Chill and relaxed spot. AWSOME food. Could of added a tad bit more Alcohol. But Manageable.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California Burrito!

ni01X3PtOceJyFetX3pD8w.text: The tacos were very tasty.  They're what would be described as "street taco" sized -- pretty small.  The rice and beans were in small cups.  We ordered chips and salsa and both were good, but not exceptional.  We liked the chickle they offered as a post meal breath enhancer.  Overall, it was a good experience and we'll likely return.

zWueugi0Wx5jDgzq7ildKg.text: This was a recommendation from the gentleman that checked me out at Ted Baker in the Fashion Square mail. An easy walk and immediately greeted with a menu and a smile. Having never been here, I needed a food recommendation. The waitress suggested 2 different tacos and I ordered both. They are delicious. Patio is lovely with music and shade. A nice change from the cold  back home in Louisiana.

MU3iAU1yaD-vcDFz6hMe4g.text: So Yummy!  A friend and I stopped in before a Spring Training game and this place did not disappoint! The atmosphere, staff and food were all 5 star.  I had the chicken tortilla soup and the house margarita...both were delicious....I highly recommend and will definitely be back!

5L4HMXqHd_Aziq1FxOiqeA.text: Interior Design:  Tacos:  Service:  Yelp Check-in deal  &  for $5:     I loved this place. So cheap compared to similar places near my home in Miami Beach!! Gr at style and great service. I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Avocado Caesar Salad with Cod
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salmon Taco

cxWHZPP7bERV-NzI2P3idQ.text: Great place for tacos and a chill environment. Staff are friendly. Love stopping by with girlfriends after a day of shopping. Parking lot is small, so allow extra time on a weekend night for street parking.

-LYwSXlvAp5pb_9CGIyklA.text: Brussel Sprouts Nachos - surprisingly delicious.  A must have.  Great service, interesting atmosphere, but a really unique and good menu.

bNOALZs9jRGnBL9YRMebMA.text: Tacos are good. They have a carousel of random sauces to choose from to enhance your taco/nacho experience. This place is very hip right now.

1Q6YkyEQsyWrt9HYERSM7g.text: I stopped in during happy hour on a Monday. The place has a nice location with a beautiful patio.  There was a decent amount of people for being a Monday.  We had the ceviche, and I had the plantain bowl.  Between the rice, beans, onion, bell pepper, and corn, it created a nice combination of texture and flavors.  The staff was friendly and nice to look at, which always helps...This would be a great place to stop in for a few margaritas or tequila flights on the weekend!

XZN3HnQtOHbSpt43cb6U1w.text: Great patio atmosphere and great margaritas!   Those two things make up for the very very slow service. The chips were awesome and we had the salsa, guacamole and street corn queso.  I would recommended them  all. To finish it off we had the cod and shrimp tacos.  They didn't disappoint. The place is charming and feels like you are sitting in Baja.  Just go with the same attitude.

DlBemUFCl5OvABGHWY_xVA.text: Service was great, food was served timely and was very tasteful.  A great atmosphere.  And my two daughters thought our waiter was super hot.

HGyOi2Wznc0MPubNrwgjHA.text: Had the pork taco. Go with the suggestion of the crispy shell. It was made fresh and hot.

lzVhUxaA9mpcgfxA4jR2Lw.text: This is my new favorite taco/ happy hour spot! Great patio and vibe with an awesome menu and cocktails!  I loved this spot from the second I walked in. The menu has a unique health conscious spin on it with little touches such as beet crema, chia seed lemonade, Greek yogurt salad dressing which makes it even more awesome!!! I like those healthy little twists that still taste oh soo good. The Brussels sprout nachos are a must and their beans are mmmm mmm yum! The only complaint I have is their bar tenders seem to be slacking- I once waited 30 min for a margarita with a little jalapeno spice! Which as I'm writing this sounds perfect right now... Even if I do have to wait half an hour for, still so worth it!

rocrssYVWEJK-ZVpBmrOEQ.text: Great tacos, cold beer, friendly staff. I came for lunch, but need to come back to have drinks on the patio some evening. Good selection of cocktails too

EnLe8wc5ImhqCYuE8sI4hQ.text: Tacos were absolutely incredible.  And the ceviche.  And very cool ambience & decor.  And great prices.  Highly recommend it.

RPKpVIBjEnepP4cXo7UK-g.text: I've been following this little taco shop on Instagram and couldn't believe how yummy the food looked, let alone the drinks!  My hubby and I ventured out and tried it yesterday.  We had the Mexican corn dip, cod taco, shrimp taco, and the skirt steak taco.  It was all absolutely amazing!  We will absolutely be frequent visitors!  Our waitress, Taylor, was a rockstar!

JDDYc2S8jW2MUpIpEDDgBQ.text: We had an assortment of tacos and the chips and guacamole. Each taco was better than the last! They had plantain chips mixed in, which were delicious. We also loved the atmosphere.  We had the pineapple pork, the skirt steak, the adobo BBQ chicken, and chile verde baked chicken.

Fv5m7smvSJcVEeqEe3FNDg.text: Stumbled upon this gem on accident, what a pleasant surprise! Very unique fun aesthetic with a mod 50s vibe. Great service, delicious food, and amazing cocktails. I ordered the crispy cod bowl and I would highly recommend!

r6ciNMuet1Iw5j0Apl6_Yg.text: Came in to watch the ASU game and sat at the bar. Jessica was our bartender and was awesome. Great chips and guacamole and drinks!

v_841blXOz0XWaVJ8ip0oA.text: Great creative menu and dessert!  Had shrimp and skirt steak tacos and they were very flavorful.  Taylor was our waitress and was awesome in suggesting food items and making sure our Special order arrived as instructed.  I will be back!

bapI2gI6JIr9OvSyxY0g1A.text: Awesome!! Stumbled upon this place while on a date and fell in love. The drinks and food were amazing. Plantain tacos were like heaven and the tequila tasting was great!

6cWbKC1IwZx17XKocRZyeQ.text: I go to Diego Pops all the time (the manager, Corey, said better to come here too much than to Taco Bell..truuu). I wouldn't come here that often if it wasn't amazing. The food is sooo good, they won a ton of awards at the Taco Festival so that's not just my opinion. I always get the street corn queso, it's basically liquid gold. They have a great choice of different tacos and bowls, they just added burritos to the menu too. Their drink menu is fantastic, and they just added pitchers of margaritas and beer (holler). They also have a really cool dessert menu, I tried the churro fries once and they're as good as they sound.  Everyone that works there is really nice and the service is always on point. The bartender with the bow tattoos is so nice (I suck for always forgetting her name) and Taylor is a great server, she's nice and really attentive. Any time I've ever had an issue they've always taken care of it right away! I had a weird reaction to a drink once so they brought me out a different one and comped it for me. Sooo nice of them. Basically, you should just try this place, it's really good and you won't regret it.

lTFi6FfCE-l-3ay3Ucg5_w.text: Good food and cool atmosphere but consistently bad service. All 3 occasions I've tried to overlook the service but tonight I can't accept this. Water refills are a chore. Absent minded servers (all 3 times). Over 45 minutes for our server to take the order. I had to get her at the server station. No exaggeration. Appetizers came in an orderly fashion but we never saw a manager on the floor or touching tables. Basically a cool concept with zero clue about service standards or delivering a guest experience. I figure this starts with lackadaisical leadership at an owner level because the lack of management is apparent here and in their other concepts. That's a shame.

0UxznlKSBuCzZHBMvXu7Xw.text: Always good service, amazing food and chill music. One of my favorite taco places- and that's saying a lot because I am a taco lover and I am constantly seeking out the best tacos in town. Also taco Monday's? Don't mind if I do! If you haven't tried this place-do. The bar is the best spot! Rebecca and Steven will take great care of you! Arizona is full of amazing food but friendly attentive customer service is hard to come by.

sT8_qA-N9vtxCos2q6WQsQ.text: Diego Pops is a great example of a smaller restaurant in Old Town that is worth the find! Definitely go for the corn queso for an appetizer, you can't go wrong with any of the tacos as well. The Poke was top notch. Lexie was great, definitely will be back!

b5kp8oegny-TqfAMIoTqbA.text: Been here a few times but in this visit I must say the combination of food and service was great.   I came here with two friends for lunch, our server was Claire and she was great. I ordered the California Burrito which was unlike any California Burrito I've ever eaten and in a good way. The burrito isn't huge and isn't small, really it's not even medium. I wanted more, hell I wanted another burrito it was so good. I would describe Diego Pops as a taco shop if you only described a taco shop menu to Michelin rated chefs. It's elevated but also good.   My meal was $10 and it was worth it. Love the combo of good food, great location and awesome service.

wAfeN-fFreJqY-TJNv4B4A.text: Good food, good drinks, but literally the worst service I've ever seen. 20 min to get chips and cheese dip. 20 min for beers. Food takes forever to come out. Fun vibe, but don't come here unless you have 3 hours for dinner.

Rrl6Qs6rmChbH0dXzCxfTQ.text: Good food, worst service. We came here for lunch on our girls weekend. We got a round of drinks, while we waited (10 mins) for our table. After the hostess sat us we waited 3-4 mins to order our food. Our chips & guac and our chips & queso took approx 20 mins (during which we didn't see our waitress). Our tacos came out about 5 mins after the appetizers but we still had not received our chips and salsa. When we asked the waitress for our check, it took her another 5-6 mins to bring our bill.  Over all, our meal should have taken 20 mins and after all was said and done (ordered, food, drinks, Bill) we were there for 2 hrs!  Good for a lively afternoon but expect to be there a while.

J2voYYdYhA6V8XY-LuezSg.text: Wow this place was great!   Quick service for how packed it was, absolutely delicious food, and a very fun atmosphere.   We got the street corn, grilled cod tacos, mango habanero wings, chips & salsa, and a shrimp quesadilla. All of it was AMAZING. They give you multiple different types of sauces to use on the tacos - all were delicious and so different than any other taco joint I've been to.  Monday's have $3 tacos, and I'm already planning my next trip back during happy hour (3-6pm daily). Cannot wait to go again, such a great spot.

XhLUXVaFqxMBm017A4rVRw.text: Awesome experience and easygoing vibes! I came here for happy hour after stumbling upon this place during a trip to Arizona. I must say that the food was delicious, especially the Street Corn Queso (I went back two days after just for this dish). The margaritas are easy to drink and they didn't skimp on the alcohol either. The service was friendly and prompt. The tacos are also decent. But if you're looking for something more fulfilling, the bowls are a good alternative. I recommend checking this place out for happy hour where the appetizers are half off and the margaritas are $5.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Street Corn Queso

ptZ7Fi-pP3isMwUDJMd_xA.text: Had a great time here on a busy Saturday night. We would've had roughly a 30 min wait but a spot opened up at the bar so we snagged. The bartender was efficient and friendly. The margaritas were solid. I highly recommend the Brussels sprout nachos. Very unique flavors but very tasty. After splitting that with my wife I ordered 2 tacos - grilled shrimp and the charred streak. The grilled shrimp was ok - a lot of corn, too much corn. The steak was phenomenal.

nzMaTexLA35PY5Z79BT7BA.text: Not a big selection of food and what I got which was the house burrito really didn't have much flavor. I like the sauces you can dip your chips in. Doubt I will go back not for me

jFvHr3-YWVapZMarXrIrug.text: Best margarita in town. One of the best happy hours in town. John the bartender is awesome ! Great vibe.

SLyVGMhqKRDVZ3Na4t05MQ.text: If it wasn't for the manager Priscilla making everything better, I would give this place a lower review. The food is delicious so that obviously calls for a decent rating right there, but the service is absolutely atrocious. I've been there an hour before closing and the bar staff tells me the kitchen is already closed. Upon asking why they respond with "they kind of just decide to do whatever they feel like"...uhh you're a business with clearly listed hours, you should be functioning during said hours.  The experience I had yesterday was by far one of the worst. I went there around the end of happy hour hoping to sneak in a last drink before it ended. It took over fifteen minutes of no one saying hello, no water, not even a single acknowledgement from any staff members before I spoke to the incredible manager named Priscilla. She immediately sent over the server by the name of Isaac/Isaiah who was not only beyond rude but one of the absolute worst servers I have experienced EVER. I had seen him during my fifteen minutes of sitting there talking to the staff, texting on his phone, and doing anything but his actual job. When he finally served us he was rude, inattentive, and clearly didn't care at all. He never checked back on food quality. Priscilla basically became our server since Isaac didn't care enough since our bill was being comped anyway. I'm so beyond disappointed with this establishment and wouldn't recommend going there unless you have time to waste and please for the love of everything in this world hope you never get Isaac.

N5JykU6fc4V-nICi6QanwA.text: Food was okay, cute atmosphere though. The fried fish taco was dry but the adobo chicken taco  was okay.  Brussels sprout nachos were okay didn't really eat too much.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fried Fish Taco and Grilled Adobo Chicken
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sign inside
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel Sprout Nachos

YYXErTkASnuNW5kVhiEcqw.text: Love love love the Happy Hour and Margaritas! A very fun atmosphere and delicious foods! The tortilla soup is one of my favorites and we always think of this place on the weekends.

ec3ojeqynctJP5vUNqgmNA.text: Had a really great experience today at Diego's! Always love taco Monday's. I love all the sauces you can choose from. Skylar was our bartender today and she's the best!! Always gives great service and is always smiling:) I tried the watermelon mint margarita today and it was so delicious and refreshing. Definitely recommend it! Can't wait to go back next Monday!

xCXgkdJPyXDoYUe6__v0eQ.text: Before ever getting food I knew I loved this place. The manager on duty, Priscilla, was so sweet and genuine about wanting us to have a good night. Even though she wasn't our server, we felt like she was there for us as well. The food was served in a timely manner and was exactly what we hoped for. Will be back!!

8jkzlJ4q6tr3ZMWu8gNTWw.text: Do yourself a favor and get the Street Corn Queso!   It's supposed to be an "appetizer" but let's be honest, it's too dang good to share!

Dx4dChm5zUOY_8kv83EYbA.text: I love this place so much. The tacos are phenomenal, and the cocktails are on point. Every time I go in I know Sierra is going to take great care of me.

NIkBidm3syT1jxyMKc0UvQ.text: Let me start by saying that this place is so cute! Perfect decor, cute bar, indoor/outdoor dining...all great!  I am super picky with my Mexican food, and in Providence where I call home we have really delicious spots.  The food here was good, it just didn't push into great for me.  I tried their burrito bowl, and my friends got the Brussels app which they said was awesome.  The drinks were good, and the wait staff were great.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

gU2sUwXBA6XbaCzRYnETEQ.text: Pretty underwhelming from the moment we walked in.  Heard a lot of terrific things about Diego Pops over the past year.  However, when we came in the vine seemed way off.  There must have been 15 people standing at the door to be seated, a half empty restaurant, and no hostesses.  I almost walked over to the 5 employees rolling silverware to ask if there was a host.  Then one slowly wandered over and without any urgency began to sit the crowd of people forming at the front door.    Service was slow.  We sat on the patio.  It took a while to be greeted, and our drinks took awhile to arrive as well.    The tacos were pretty tasty and I love the different sauces that they put on the table.  However the mango habenero wings that they say "take awhile" because they are fried, then grilled were definitely not grilled.  I've had amazing twice cooked wings from JTs before and these had just been deep fried and tossed in a slightly sweet and hot sauce.  But they lacked any crispy or charred notes you get from grilling them.  We asked about them to our server, who took them off our bill, but we never saw a manager and they didn't over to remake them right.  We didn't eat them.  My girlfriends House salad was underwhelming.  The dressing was super watery and lacked any flavor.    Overall,  just a lame experience from start to finish.  No real hospitality. No attempt at recovery.  Don't waste your time with this place.  There's way too many better options in Scottsdale.

SKZNxaoYDGXSfbEhaxNnYQ.text: Probably my favorite taco shop in the area, heck, the valley! Great atmosphere, food, and drinks. The brussel sprout nachos have no comparison and are a must! All of the tacos are tasty and have a good amount of protein on them. You can dress them up with any of the zesty taco sauces they have at the table. My favorite is the beet crema!

zX3SupfjJ0K6SiiDobwlYw.text: Cool vibes and fusion style tacos. It's a pretty happening place, waited about an hour a table on a Monday night. We ordered a drink at the bar while we waited. I had the prickly pear margarita and although it looks pretty and fun in pics, the flavor was lacking. Seemed like a cheaper tequila and had no pear or even sweet agave flavor to it. Don't get me wrong though, I did finish it. Unfortunately I keep feel that tequila in the pit of my stomach for the rest of my meal. We were sorted. Chips are considered an appetizer and cost $2. Which is typical for a trendier place like this. Chips and salsa were good and worth the $2. Waitress was super sweet and allowed both my husband and I to use the $5 yelp check in deal for a taco and beer!! We had 3 tacos shrimp, plantain, and steak. My son had a chicken burrito. The flavor of all tacos was pretty good. Unique blends of items. And they bring over a caddy of 6 different sauces to pair. The beet cream was on par!  If we are in the area again; I would come back for the vibe, good tacos, reasonable pricing, and something else at the bar.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp taco and plantain taco. A lot of corn on the shrimp taco. The plantain was my favorite, I like the u inquest blend of flavors
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu

1JqcAhIlUNp09_KX4fcNcA.text: So Montauk is next door and had a great time having drinks but my next stop Diego pops was the best ever the food was amazing and the barback Wyatt was recommending awesome drinks Best time ever seriously though why is it the barbacks that should be bartenders are not actual bartenders and Scottsdale why it should be a fucking bartender I'm not kidding. Diego give Wyatt a bartender position is amazing he will make this place great again

tB3G4lhYj1gRPSHomhKg0Q.text: I'm in Scottsdale for vacation and decided to try this place based on the reviews.  I ordered the grilled salmon bowl and as I was eating I saw a roach crawling in the bowl.  My drink and chips were comped (of course) but this was very disappointing as I was really looking forward to trying this place.

JuMYOqPMIcGlZvBde7W9SA.text: This place started bad in book. I went to order a drink from the bar, and in a very Scottsdale tone he told me "it will be a few minutes" and completely walked away. The dude wasn't doing anything that would require him to delay making a simple drink. The food was decent, but at the end the waitress completely screwed up the tabs. I'm literally still sitting here 45 minutes after this started and we are waiting for her to come back. Needless to say this will be the last time I bring friends here. Highly don't recommend this place unless you have the patience of a Buddhist monk.   Update- she just came back and everything is still wrong and we have waited forever for nothing.

nZzPeM96maMhr5ajiViMgg.text: It's family friendly, lively atmosphere, COMFORTABLE seating, and very yummy food!  Service was quick and attentive!  We will be back!

u2mIxbcXpX0TxFBYIwBr7A.text: I only ever go here for the Brussel sprout nachos which as phenomenal! One of my top 3 favorite nachos I've ever had!

MYXEsaKnJrtlII9PkkhQjw.text: Fun, fresh food, and great service.  Love sitting outside on the patio with the lights, the firepit and awesome music.  Tacos are awesome, guacamole and ceviche are yummy, although chips and salsa are underwhelming.  Great place to bring out of town guests to eat outside in January, and gloat about life in the desert.

5ccPFhdkHwZm92Ma218ErA.text: Have been here numerous times and love this place! I always get the brussel sprout nachos because they are TO DIE FOR! The crispy cod tacos are really good and so is the Sonoran hot dog! You can't really go wrong with anything on this menu! The prices are pretty average, and the service is great! Definitely a place to stop by if you're in Old Town Scottsdale

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel Sprout Nachos!!

KkhXXVI4a4haea2GAq_HuA.text: There is no better Scottsdale Happy Hour than Diego Pops'! From their funky--and delicious--Brussels Sprouts Nachos (trust me...try them) to their colorful Mexican Street Corn, the food is fabulous and generously portioned. Love their margaritas! Service is always great. My friends and I love to meet here because it always feels like we are having a party. Even met the co-owner on our last visit who excitedly shared the Diego Pops story with us admiring patrons. Already planning on going again next week. Don't miss this gem!

53O4qNOlNN6eyqHScSSTQw.text: I checked into Diego's on yelp and got a beer & taco for $5! Can't go wrong with that, I got a Adobe BBQ Chicken Taco, I like the texture of the flour taco shell it's a lighter flaky texture I've never had before. Bartender made a good Michelada I get those whenever I see them on a menu, in Brooklyn we call them bloody beers I'm always making bartenders make me those here. The Brussels Sprout Nachos were fun same flaky texture to their chips, it's a nice atmosphere outside at the bar area, kind of trendy area of Scottsdale I won't be back but it was still good.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussels Sprouts Nachos

MDR4507KeKSu8PAucxKBeA.text: I have been here numerous times and the food and experience has been stellar. I came here last Sunday 6/10/18 and it was awful. Our waitress Michaela was nice and everything started off good. She recommends the elote off the cob and we were excited to try it. She said everything is the same it's just in a bowl. Well it comes and it is pretty much corn from a can not roasted nothing, it was disgusting. We don't complain we just kniw next time not to order it again. So I order my 2 tacos and wanted to try the coconut rice and pinto beans. My food comes and I can already see my crunchy shells are pretty dark which I over look. Being excited to try the rice I dig in... The rice is cold! Mind you Im at lunch from work so no time to send things back. I push it and the beans to the side cause I'm not eating cold rice and warm beans. I eat my tacos you can taste They are burnt... Still ate them. After I ate I went to go wash my hands. When the waitress comes to the table my friend says the sides are cold. Then the waitress picks up the sides and says rudely the beans are not cold, my friend says ok maybe not the beans but the rice is cold.
