My gfs order the brussel sprout nachos pretty much every time we go (even though no one eats the egg...) and I have fallen in lust with the plantain taco!  Om nom nom ... Still a great house margarita, a good and spicy salsa, yummy guac and thick chips!

cBewEfqCgq12RFgjLQKshw.text: Diego Pops is the cutest place ever. Food was amazing. Drinks were good EXCEPT for the Michelada. It was too tart.   I ordered the Brussels Sprouts Nachos which were fantastic! Brussels sprouts made to perfection. The egg was a lovely addition as well. I then had the California burrito which was very tasty. The sweet corn came through to my surprise and liking. The French fries in the burrito were fun as well. Probably not necessary but fun.   For drinks I got the Guava Coconut. It wasn't out of this world but tasty for sure. Though it was overpriced.   Going back to the Michelada. It's a spicy tomato juice and dos Equis drink (with other ingredients). It was BAD. They should really remove this item off the menu. The drink was sour and tasted of liquid vomit.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yuck. Do not order!

rEVGbmhJWZ5Msse2uH-H9Q.text: Alright. I know it's Sunday, but how patient do I need to be? If you're looking to hang out, this is your spot. But if you're an impatient type or have places to be, this is not for you. We waited SO long for drinks and food. Too long. The food and drinks are phenomenal but my god, I had to really shut my mouth and try and be calm - everything took forrrreevvvveerrrrrr to be served. I would go back for the food, but not my first choice. Way too slow of service. Kitchen, waitresses, and bar - all of those need some sense of urgency. I even heard another couple say, "well, at least the food is worth the wait" - extremely slow for a reputable old town restaurant

UW3NqtqzTx0sOUY_k0SIdA.text: so delicious and a very cute environment! we got the sweet corn caesar salad and a shrimp bowl (pescatarian style). very good and delicious margaritas!

68yg5wcNGWd2f6B_ZyFT8Q.text: Loved the vibe....chips, salsa, guac worth the trip alone.  Great tacos & super efficient service.

9vy0659jj-9O8qqm2B1D1g.text: Diego's is triggering. I change when I am here. It's the year 2017, but when I'm at Diego's, my mind mentally time travels inside a DeLorean to the 1960s. I transform into someone else. I transform into Don Draper Lite. For the uninformed, this is basically without the sexism and other reprehensible behavior, but I am down for that alcohol. What I mean is, substitute the Whiskey for their Margaritas, and I am asking for them to bring me a fresh one in the shortest, yet socially respectable intervals possible.   Diego's bring this out in a person. Situated next door to a Big & Tall Shop, Diego's is a microcosm of the positvity that exudes from the residents of Scottsdale. The staff is gregarious. They are innately in tune with the universe to not only know when to bring you that next drink, but what you want next on the menu. Hint - get the nachos, it's like they had the idea to mix the traditional dish of nachos & cheese with everything that made you love birthday parties as a kid.  Most importantly, I never break the bank going to Diego's. I could go there with $20 and make a night that could fill an entire scrapbook. Let me make sure I am getting this point across sufficiently. Ever seen Shameless (US version, the UK version wasn't relatable for some reason)? The entire Gallagher family, including Frank, could eat and drink here.   The only befuddling thing about this place - it's actually really strange - is that it is never completely packed. Personally, I believe this a sin akin to the destruction of the great library at Alexandria because this place is too good not to be packed. It's really odd. If you do you go next time though and it is packed, sorry for the jinx fam.  Needless to say, this place is lit and you need to get down there to eat and drink. When you do go though, please find this out for me. I have always been curious. Does Diego Pops sell lollipops? Make sure to report back fam.

X56d1u3a5SSW8jixNRaB4Q.text: No matter how many times I come here, I'm just so unimpressed with the flavours of the food. I wish I could like this place more; it has a great patio, and the service was decent. The taste of the food is important, and in this restaurant's case, the food was underwhelming.  We came as a group and they were able to accommodate the 6 of us easily. The misters were on, and the sun was shining. A good start to our dinner.   Service: Service was fine. The waitress came around regularly to make sure our drinks and food were okay.  Food: I ordered a California burrito with rice instead of french fries. Maybe I should've kept the fries? I don't think it would have made an improvement. The food itself was pretty gray and boring looking. They have a decent happy hour where the appetizers are half-priced. Chips and salsa aren't free, but are only $1 during HH. The guac and chips+plantain chips came out to slightly over $4. They were pretty good, not the best, but enjoyable in a group setting. We also ordered some habanero mango hot wings. Those were pretty good and came with some jicama and cucumber sticks. The veggies looked liked they'd been cut much earlier in the day and were just sitting there.  One thing that makes the restaurant unique is the array of sauces available. There are six different bottles of condiments for you to put on your food. I honestly prefer to have the chef season the meal as he deems best, but if it is kind of fun to have the option to have all these sauces. Nevertheless, the sauces I used were unable to make my meal enjoyable.   With the staggering number of other Mexican restaurants in the area, Diego Pops will not be the first one I choose when going out.

nx14KLbGb2cGViz-eND4mg.text: I love it so much!! I can't stop eating the nachos.  Always the birthday must go to spot.

lP3yniE-gL5-0yxkwtg6xw.text: AMAZING food and drink atmosphere!!! we had Sierra as our server and she made sure our night was the best. i ordered the prickly pear margarita and would have 20 more if i could. best service in the world and i will 1000% be back here!!! thank you Sierra!!!

7enELtOOnjvBAzkD6raKIQ.text: The house margaritas are delicious (give the skinny version a shot). The nachos are a must try. So are the braised pineapple pork tacos. With all this said, your experience is likely to change depending on the time of year you stop by. You're sure to enjoy it more once the weather turns nice.

bbEhQp_540crFeH1JfdUhg.text: This is an amazing place so much so that we went for dinner and then went back for lunch!  The atmosphere is fun and the space is beautiful!  Everything we ate and drank was fresh and delicious.  Of course the brussel sprout nachos are a must!  We had a party of 5 and tried tacos, bowls and burritos and everyone loved their dishes.  For lunch, my daughter and I went back for the salmon bowls after hiking Pinnacle Peak.  Service both trips was super friendly and helpful.  I can't wait to go back when we visit Scottsdale again!

eeF7sLEakoEWV6VI7D_WVA.text: Being Hispanic makes you weary of any restaurant that serves Mexican food, but Diego Pops served up a plate full of deliciousness!  I ordered the green chili taco, steak taco, bacon poblano street corn and a pitcher of sangria (to share with a friend). Everything was good except I wish the corn had more cheese and mayo throughout the entire corn.   The restaurant is super cute and I am a little obsessed with all of the decor. They even brought the cuteness to the bathroom with quotes that read "Hola Bonita" I will be going back again to try more options on the menu. Brownie point or should I say Pan Dulce points for staying open late!

Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Two things that always go together!
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu...happy hour on mondays!!!! $3 tacos

ym7d7q3b80sbu3sBbclMaA.text: The service was quick and the happy hour has great deals. The chips and salsa were the best part, the rest of the food we had (street corn & chicken tortilla soup) was mediocre.

EG05XD55LLRkfCDBlGaP6g.text: Prickly pear margaritas are really good with a great pour, you can even get a pitcher! Food is good and outdoor seating is outstanding. Definitely, a great destination while in Old Town.

D8QY_AQ0SJ4PlLBXhT3t7g.text: Did not eat here, just had drinks, but better than expected!! The bartender made the BEST drinks, on and off the menu. She was so nice and attentive, wish I remembered her name. Tequila on tap is awesome and love the atmosphere. The bartender made me the jalapeno margarita & I crave it from time to time. I will be back!

gJSOHrCLHEhl3f_Ay9lwdg.text: David (the red head) was the best server! Best service I have had since in Arizona.  Great good and love all the sauces.

4987SiEvGX-rokH7jsnZ6w.text: Love this place. Me and my girlfriend come here atleast once a week for happy hour. We love the food and drink specials so much and our favorite server Sierra!

ZTVhNHzY8thQ5hvytHjN7w.text: Was here last night. The service was god awful. My waitress was not friendly and dismissive. Reading through these comments and seeing others feel the same way is very comforting. Whoever runs this establishment should hold their wait staff accountable and set a higher standard because it's such a cool place with great food (hard working cooks! I wish my tip went to them instead) it's a shame that the people who's sole job is to just be nice can't even do that.

_FOO7H4kQxGqbwLO1wSy1g.text: Killer service, great food, with reasonable prices! Would recommend if you're in the downtown Scottsdale area.

HGbrMHosfsmyf5nrvFEgyg.text: We love Diego Pops tacos but previously we had been unimpressed with the service, today however we were blown away. Amanda was extremely attentive and friendly. She always there anytime we needed anything. Corey the manager even came by to ask how everything was. Great attention to service!   We were here for happy hour and the $4 margaritas and half priced apps are such a great deal. We also love their crispy cod taco. AMAZE. Definitely make a trip to Diego Pops on your next trip to Old Town.

pfgUTwEloHFE0oT5m73uUw.text: We had such a poor experience. I have have been here previously with co workers and it was wonderful. I was so excited to come here with friends because I raved about it but unfortunately did not live up to what I said. First, the bartender assumed we were with the folks next to us and charged me for two margaritas instead of one. Then seemed annoyed our check was wrong. He basically blamed us for his mistake. We had to wait for a table which is not a big deal, they were busy, we understand. We were seated and then waited another 20 minutes for a drink and it was wrong. Finally we asked for our check to be split and the waitress said "well it's already all on one check"  she would not split the check, just very weird. I have never in my life had an issue with splitting a check.  I understand this is a busy time in Scottsdale with spring training and everything but my friends and I were super disappointed.

0J_cD_V6XiowiQDHh4OxDw.text: Thank you, The Mission, for having electrical problems this morning. This forced us to have to find another Mexican restaurant and we found this spectacular place.   I had the Brussel Sprout Nachos, and my mind was blown! I love me some brussel sprouts, but would have ever thought of putting them in nachos. These are so good, you won't want to share...but will because it's a huge portion. It's got pickled onions, brussel sprouts, and two types of cheese.   I want to come back to this place today, and I was there for lunch today. It's hipsterish, but the food was good enough for me to ignore that element.

dvPZYQJdG13vKp8oXddwnQ.text: Cutest place in Scottsdale!! Great atmosphere and extremely friendly staff. Highly recommend if you love tacos, tequila and a good time.

BpuMSM8QSjEmSd-23d22vA.text: Great atmosphere! Great staff! Came here after hiking Camel Back with 20 girls on a Bachelorette Party! Yummy drinks and delicious tacos! Mackenzie was great!!

PwCqKgyUYGkE-WISIRzc7Q.text: Perfect location, great service, nice ambience, the cocktails and the Brussel Sprout Nachos are my fav!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

O3-1AvjLFqcd9SYTYeF0_g.text: First of all this is my Fiance and I's favorite place of all time and Rebecca one of the managers is seriously the best which compliments the food to a "T"!!! The food is absolutely amazing and their drinks aren't ones to over look!   We got out engagement party catered by Diego Pops due to loving their food and becoming regulars there. Rebecca was amazing at organizing and preparing all of our food for the party and let's just say that there wasn't ANY FOOD LEFT!!! Everyone loved the food and kept asking where it was from! Highly recommended for your next event!  Our favorite items there are the: Coconut lemongrass ceviche  Corn queso  The wings Grilled Shrimp tacos or shrimp bowl Braised green chili chicken tacos Braised pineapple pork Then all margaritas! The fresh one is amazing!  If you're looking for just a casual lunch out or a date night or your next event catered definitely give them a look!!   Thank you, Tj

FChPav-PVTGpf5TGIXjDnA.text: Super cute place, the plantain taco was delicious. I was there on lunch and the service was poor but maybe on dinner it would be better.  Super cute place.

MN3hsKwaHvkJuEAD131Ieg.text: We stopped in on a Sunday afternoon and grabbed a seat at the outdoor bar.  It wasn't a crazy hot day and with the fan they had going outside, it was very pleasant.  Turned out Sunday is all day Happy Hour.  Woohoo!  Had some house margs, street corn queso, and the brussel sprout nachos (after the bartender said they were the best nachos he's ever had).  OMG...they were soooo good!  Incredibly rich, but so good.  Great food, great service.  Can't ask for more than that.  We'll definitely be back.

TRvLfPzQWnmbTf-IZydbzg.text: Beyond tasty!  Fresh flavors and healthy options, how can this be Mexican food?  Trust me just go. Have the Brussels sprout nachos and die at how good the mix of flavors are. What a creative chef. I also loved the jicama radish and cu umber side with chipotle greek yogurt dip. Had a green chili chicken taco and hubby had skirt steak platter. Tons of leftovers. Margaritas were perfect. Service five star. Adorable inside and out but we sat outside. Just go, go now!!!

CTkQuQpqiEpHZ9MalRQCtA.text: I like this spot for a variety of reasons, including the great service I always receive and the delicious food. It's actually a menu that enables you to create healthy options without giving up too much. They play good tunes and have a nice patio bar. Good for a date or with friends.

7XO5R6OEPgJT5HL7zB7DFA.text: Terrible, this place is a joke the service is terrible the food is not fresh.. The food takes forever, they brought out our entree first and our appetizers last and we had to wait for our drinks for 20 mins.. If this tell the owners anything, I hope it's helps and is taken only constructively!

JZdDRPu9hHXSDNO4alCE4A.text: Normally the service is a little slow, but the food is good.  At our last outing, service was terrible.  Worse, when I talked with the owner, I didn't get the sense he cared.  What should have been a good experience for our out of town company turned into a bad one with no wanting to apologize by the restaurant.   I would avoid going here. If they don't care, things are going to continue to go downhill.

DNnwAxwbixEYew_QdK71BQ.text: Visiting from Illinois with my wife. Hands down best tacos of my life. Also Monday's just so happen to be half off the tacos. I recommend to everyone! I had the charred steak, braised green chile chicken, and braised pineapple pork. My wife had the poke tuna and said it was very fresh, light, and delicious. Wish they had this restaurant in Chicago!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

eSlbkjMJquVmmkmGsDGL3w.text: Our server Anthony was the man, super personable and had great recommendations. Made our experience at Diego Pops very relaxed!

pJEQg65DliNPSahlripAIg.text: Kaylie (our server) gave amazing recommendations!  The guacamole, poke, fried plantains, and sweet corn & avocado Caesar were phenomenal recommendations. The watermelon mint margarita was also a refreshing treat for a late lunch on vacation.

hPhyL1Ou3s7hBjdxSwYYdQ.text: Favorite place in all of Phoenix/Scottsdale! Dare to order the brussel sprouts nachos -- insane combo with a fried egg on top! Creative food and great service. Love it!

Hwo33AVptPCpT7-VputNkQ.text: I was really excited to try.  The hostess told us they were dog friendly, so we grabbed the pups and came back.  Turns out she lied.  Hopefully the staff learns what they are and aren't so guests can plan accordingly.

nJgv5CYDGUXJ01Lpbu2eMQ.text: Stopped by briefly for HH around 4:30 on Friday, and because we had a large party there was unfortunately no room outside and we were seated inside. I was not a fan of the atmosphere in there at that time, felt like being punished for the large party by being shoved in a dark corner. There was maybe only one or two other parties in there at that time, and it just wasn't "fun". (Note to self, ditch the friends next time. No True friend would come between you and tacos anyway). Otherwise the decor is cute! I have a mild obsession with pineapples so of course I immediately fell in love with the wallpaper. Service/Food: One of our party knew the waiter, so we had good service. I only stayed long enough for chips and salsa and an order of the Brussel sprout nachos, which in my opinion were mediocre - I have no idea what everyone is raving about.  Drinks: We were lucky enough to be greeted by a brand rep for Don Julio and we received two weak pitchers of margaritas for free. Beggars cant be choosers, right? So, I will not say anything more about how watered down they were and how she just gave us a stack of not-very-clean cups for us to pass around/pour ourselves. One of our party did order the sangria from the bar and it was awful. She finished it but said it tasted like soap? Parking: even at 4:30 the parking lot was already packed and the valet was starting to block off opened spots. I had to circle around and park across the street behind the restaurant. Not a huge deal but a slight frustration. But I guess that's Old Town for you. I would like to come back again, maybe sit outside, try more of the menu and drinks. I've heard really good things and had much higher hopes. It did seem to have potential, so I will chock this up to a one-off occurrence. Looking forward to being able to update my review next time.

gU-01TrituLCwfdHTz7jew.text: Holy god!! Everything is so so good!! Let's just start off with service... So immediate, so friendly, so helpful!! Food came out almost instantaneously!!  We ordered salsa (very spicy), guacamole (worth every penny), and their corn queso to start (out of this world)!!  The pineapple pork taco was sweet and delicious! The green chili chicken bowl was literally cooked to perfection! Needless to say we were stuffed after all this! The "fresh one margarita" was very fresh. Oh, and if you come Monday for happy hour (3-6) you get 1/2 price apps, and discounted drinks... And all day Monday is Taco Monday... So $2 and $3 tacos!!  This is seriously AMAZING and needs to be checked out by all!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour menu! Definitely try his place out!

yzYOVFfxR1uGBIycgnUJag.text: Food was delicious and the service was awesome. I will definitely be back! Oh, and I recommend the shrimp tacos! Yummmmm.

XAuhBiDpz0ZjOyRchvCI_A.text: I found this place on Instagram and wanted to check it out. It is a very cool place! The decor is Mexico meets SoCal and I loved the vibe there. I got a toasted coconut margarita served in a baby coconut and it was delicious. I also got the pineapple pork toco and the chicken quesadilla... both were great too. The churro sundae was my favorite though. You have to get desert if you go! I gave them 4 stars because the service took a long time hand they messed up our order. However the waitress was very nice and gave us a free shot for the service errors. I'll be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Churro Sundae

fuJ5wX8nGnYf2LH_BDnqdw.text: Came in for Taco Monday and had adobo chicken tacos and my boyfriend had the skirt steak tacos.  These were both to die for!! Our server, Anthony, was also pleasant and attentive.  Made us feel comfortable and well taken care of.  Also, the fresh one jalapeno margarita is a drink everyone needs to try!

_709VmbqbA_fCcBGXJQxKg.text: I'm shocked by all the good reviews that I have seen for Diego Pops.  My first visit did not meet what others have experienced.  I visited this place on a beautiful Sunday afternoon and I have to say the patio bar is awesome....  The food and drinks however, are not!  Weak drinks, soup came out cold, tacos were average and service at the bar was poor.  Definitely would not go back to this place.

rqBBLYNIRrQW5ssewrrnVg.text: Seriously the best taco place in AZ!! Every single time I go in, I always get the best service. Staff is always accommodating. Great specials on food and drinks. Cannot say enough good things about this place. This is the place for you if you are wanting to get A+ treatment!

d2jHX_UWKh4o73Zhwe4fFQ.text: Has the best vibe, great fresh food with flavor and quick drinks! Love the atmosphere and the friendliness of the servers. In the perfect location to meet up with people all over the valley

JZubMO58B85flGwBaTwVGA.text: What else can I say? The tacos are great! And the staff is super friendly. We always come and ask for Brittany; she is honestly the most personable waitress. She is always attentive and always makes sure we have everything we need. We love coming to get tacos here, mainly because of her! Tacos are great, especially with the deals on Monday! Margs are equally as great as their tacos and burrito bowls :)

STGLsrGlauETWgau8cdqwQ.text: Came here on Saturday for lunch for the first time because we wanted tacos & we were not disappointed. We both wanted a margarita & the waitress suggested a pitcher of the house marg which we later calculated to be the better deal (one glass = $7 ; we got 2.5 glasses EACH out of the pitcher and it was only $24 -- saved $11!!). The margarita was delicious! Then my boyfriend got 2 charred skirt steak tacos & I got one skirt steak & one crispy cod. They were SO good. I would DEFINITLY come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken quesadilla

bT1GU6yHwSZZudSWhmykYw.text: Customer service is awful! The two bar Tenders were horrible. I'm not sure they are aware customer service is part of there job. They acted irritated that they had to talk to people. We actually had to get there attention. There was 2 bartenders and a total of 4 people (including 2 of us) at the bar. The other guest had to grab a dish towel off of the bar to wipe his hands. I definitely expected much more considering all of the competition around.

u2YqCyix1Ua7l8jdbY5HKw.text: Honestly, not my favorite place. Service is crap. Drinks are mediocre at best. Better places in the valley to get tacos and margaritas.

rP2CNJH4TZvl5948ygcxgQ.text: Came here after another restaurant in the area had terrible service. This place is great! The decor is so cool, a mixture of a 50's diner and a Mexican restaurant. I had the Adobo BBQ Chicken taco bowl. It was delicious! I'll totally come back to try the other items.

1ys9_2F1Gd0QPGV_tAcr0A.text: Enjoyed happy hour: Diego Pop Margarito was awesome, guacamole and chips, and coconut lemongrass cervical. Cervical was incredible. The tacos were incredible has several BBQ chicken and skirt steak. service was awesome. Relaxing atmosphere. Highly recommend.

e0CSN21j5uCQke2PmM8IPQ.text: Nice selection of tequila/mezcal. Tacos are good, the fresh jalapenos are a welcome touch, but overpriced. Go on Taco Monday.

lqe6t5SLs5ika0kkpGqqGw.text: I must say that it's my first time at this place and I was impressed. My friend said the tacos were great. I was hesitant at first but then I tried the shrimp, bbq chicken and steak tacos. They were good sized and really good. Their chips and salsa with guacamole was also good and their happy hour was excellent. Who can beat half off apps when they're already priced well along with $3 beers?! Outstanding atmosphere, good background music and modern furnishings. Great customer service as well.  Definitely coming here again! Not your average spot.

ab_hT9Gc8H_MvLZ-Owg82w.text: Here is all you need to know; GREAT food, subpar-terrible service. We sat for almost over 15 minutes before someone even came to us. During that time servers walked past us multiple times. Ambiance is okay. Good place to catch up with friends but don't put much stock in the waiters.

TyieKtN_I-AJdyUrpdZMuQ.text: So far we've been here for almost an hour & a half and it is taking forever just to get drinks and our food. Service is not great. 1st drink was too heavy on the syrup. Hopefully the food will be better whenever we finally get it.

eDy2WMR9w0HHUhsf6k0iuQ.text: I recently went back to Diego pops and have to say that the food, service, and menu were excellent. All their tacos are amazing, but I loved the al pastor.

YJz6Oc_72UnrFFF0OQzhwQ.text: Excellent service and fantastic drinks. The wait staff was prompt with our order and the Prickly Pear is the beat Margarita I have ever had.

mxBSbF8ujWt4D9JjzWozPA.text: Great ambiance and feel good people. The food is also quality and unique. Definitely a must try place in Scottsdale

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chips and salsa and guac

gXG1pKkAL8ut3XiyvYEyjQ.text: I know that lots of people have said they like going here but I have to admit, compared to all the other amazing food places in Old Town, this is just not worth the trip. The salsa was terrible and very hot. When we asked for less spicy they brought over some tubes filled with different colored mayo products...it was so gross. Then the tacos came out and all the meat was burned and tasted old. The drinks were okay but not anything special. The snowcone had very little alcohol in it and even the waitress was surprised at how little effort they put into it. The de ore was old and the walls echoed terribly so we had to scream to hear one another. This may be a fun hang out bar but definitely do not come here for the food. Service was great which is why I gave it two stars instead of one.

74EeOVfLQ0Y7B8deUquFZQ.text: Had lunch there and the Skirt Steak Tacos were 5 star!  The steak was tender and flavorful.  I also can oddly say that the Brussel Sprout Nachos were outrageously good. Great selection of beer and great mixed drinks.

8j-s_WgoPkknn8438-FqlA.text: Best burritos with steak and the bowls  :) The place has great location and cool design. Parking is a little small, but in old town its the major problem everywhere

V0l-RDR2ubQFK19AEPUnhw.text: DP is a really fun, good food kind of place for a rang of foodies from singles to families with kids-a rare dual environment. The brussel sprouts nachos may be one of the best items on the menu. Desserts are just okay, but most tacos deliver on good taste with a handy a la carte offering. Although the kitchen may be slow, ask for TAYLOR to wait on your table. She is one of a few who rises above good food so as to turn 4 stars into a 5, even to be at service to help the kitchen prepare desserts to us.   Try this place for good food and good fun.

1aZRIUq1cDz1QoiYIiFizw.text: It was good, but we liked Joyride Tacos better. We didn't even finish the salmon taco. It just wasn't very good.

vsmbxBfEzKcsCiS9d1Dp_A.text: I'm not sure I'd waste my time here. The food would have been ok, but the service was horrendous. I've never seen such laziness and idiocy in my life.  By the time our food arrived, it was cold to the touch.  The place wasn't even busy!  How does that happen?? How bout a little teamwork people?!?!?!  Too many people standing around doing nothing. Take a little initiative and wake up!!  15 minutes later.....still waiting on our check. Unbelievable.......  Another 10 minutes.....check requested (again)....deer in the headlights look from the waitress.  Stay away!!!!!!

IjYfhDiNTcsno8Xaha3GsA.text: Extremely slow service, and the food wasn't great. The Brussels sprouts nachos that everyone mentions were clearly made hours before , they were cold and soggy and not that good. Granted it was a Saturday night but three hours for some tacos and soggy apps was not worth it.

oiZwakurKjwZaQoLWRc8bw.text: Cool little place with great ambiance and even better food.  You have to try the nachos!  $5 at happy hour and it's full size.    Everything on the menu is awesome.  This is my second visit - in 3 days. Was here over the weekend and they were packed on Saturday night - we still got seated quickly and Cory the owner came and chatted with us.  Recommend highly!

PrOIxYdmwsXR4ph31DDmCg.text: When I go out to restaurants, I don't only think of food when it comes to rating my overall experience, service and atmosphere are both very important as well. Diego Pops takes my mind straight to Palm Springs, they have a very colorful, mid-century and modern decor with spunky signs. My favorite part is their outdoor bar area. It is beautiful and it let's you enjoy their ambience while also spending time outdoor in the warm Scottsdale sunshine.   FOOD: Let's talk about what we are really here for!  Unlike most Mexican restaurants, they have TACO MONDAY! Wooho. $3 tacos. Even salmon, shrimp and steak.   We ordered almost every flavor and they were all delicious.   I also ordered the Steak Skirt Bowl, very good but a little bland. However, they do offer a variety of 6 house specialty sauces that are AMAZING. Amongs them they have cilantro, chipotle, beets, and habanero sauce. I definetly recomend trying them all.   DRINKS: YUMM!  We ordered the watermelon margaritas, I really enjoy the settled taste of watermelon and the fact that it was not very sweet. Very refreshing . 10/10 recommend

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. $3 Tacos and Steak bowl  yumm
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Watermelon Margaritas
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

PdJMLWJx4BSqtBE9k8Pikg.text: This place has Sunday Funday written all over it. All day happy hour on Sundays. Good appetizers, margs, tacos, salads and a fun lively environment made me a fan.   Word on the street is that the ceviche and brussel sprouts nachos are good choices.  We had salads and we all enjoyed our meals. Green chile chicken was tasty and I love how my ceasar wasnt drowning in dressing, like some other places serve it. I was also intrigued as I saw poke on the menu. Trying that next time because I'll be back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. green chile pork ceasar salad
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. bbq chicken salad

1hIGeQaG9FRAamMwYqbT4g.text: Amazing tacos and amazing margaritas! Traveling through Scottsdale and found this place. Great atmosphere with cute outdoor seating. Friendly staff! California burrito was amazing. The pork tacos were also a favorite!! Original margarita was perfect! Would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork, shrimp, chicken tacos!

VMms5KBiuuOFzMfn0S_FfQ.text: In Phoenix/Scottsdale, there is NO shortage of taco shops and mexican food establishments.  So when a friend and I were walking around old town and deciding on a place for lunch, I was excited to come across Diego Pops.  We walked in and my first impression was great.  There's a "last supper" picture behind the front desk with Jesus in the center but this particular Jesus is a DJ with his turntable setup on the table.  I'm smiling cause I always suspected that "Jesus is a DJ" and tell the host I'd like a table for two.  That's it.  From that point forward, we were a nuisance as customers--or at least that's how we felt.    I was told it would take just a bit but they would find us a table.  I saw the host talking with a server and they're apparently strategizing on a place to seat us as the place was filling up quickly.  They hemmed and hawed with each other and I suppose they decided on a plan to get us seated.  The hostess tells us she's working on it and that they'll be able to seat us shorty.  I get it.  When it gets busy, you have to improvise seating to maximize space to serve all customers.  So we waited.  Finally, they set up the table and they sat us down. I was seated with my back to a glassed door and my friend was in front of me with the sun in her eyes.  We decided that no matter if I switched places with her, one of us would end up with the sun in our eyes.  So we took it upon ourselves to move our seats on this small square table so that the sun was on the sides of both our faces and we were still able to face each other and more importantly, see each other.   The waitress came to take our drink order and left.  Shortly after she left, another employee came to our table to tell us we could not sit in the position we had chosen.  We explained the 'sun in the face' issue but she said he needed us to move back to the other seating arrangement they had set up for us.  When I asked how it made a difference, she said to us that our sitting in the position/setup we had chosen was encroaching on the people seated behind us.  Now mind you, had that been True, I would have acquiesced and asked to be reseated once something else became available.  But that wasn't the case.   I explained that there was plenty of space for the next table's patrons to easily get in and out but she argued with me and said there was not.  I told her she was being unreasonable and she said, "I dont know what you want me to do.  I'm trying to accommodate all our customers."  Nice try but, in my opinion, she was more concerned about exerting her need to be right and have things her way.  IF she were really concerned about all patrons, she would have asked if she could reseat us somewhere else where the sun wouldnt be in our eyes.  But she couldn't because as she re-fed me the line about 'only trying to accommodate all customers,' she said that...as she was walking away!  Needless to say, we left.    Like I said, there are so many taco shops in the city that it's not worth arguing with an obstinate server.  When we left, she saw us walking out and she shook her head.  She didnt come over and say she was sorry we weren't comfortable there and maybe she could reseat us.  Nothing.  She proved her concern about accommodating all customers was only lip service.    Save yourself the time and walk over to Barrio Queen just down the street.  That's what we did.  And we had a great lunch!

j788outqwk_8SuxME7EtjA.text: Quality restaurant, incredible food, amazing atmosphere and they do take out, made us very happy and incredibly delicious!

GMEAm8civfkI2sXzRh9n0w.text: Delicious tacos ! The yelp deal is Great as well! My favorite taco is the  shrimp. I also enjoy the guacamole , it's very interesting with the orange in it !

CiIycZyH3MLzS4F-KxFU5g.text: I went to Diego Pops last week and it was amazing! I got the Brussel  sprout nachos and they were amazing! I also got the breakfast burrito and it was very good. The atmosphere of the place is also really cool. I would definitely recommend eating here if you are in Scottsdale.

CB_ilZbP4i8zjoJr6avElg.text: Everything was great, especially our server Teagan, quick, attentive, sweet and very friendly and welcoming.  Food was delicious, drinks were perfect.

T-BEsnITBtAL4JpcBfUBpQ.text: We loved our experience at Diego Pops! Our waitress was amazing at keeping our waters full. We got the Brussel Sprout Nachos, Chicken quesadilla, mango habenero wings, and sangria! I really recommend going during happy hour because it's such an amazing deal! You really get huge portions and get it for a great price. The wings were VERY spicy but I kept eating more. Everyone was super friendly and it's very lively there.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

MBhX5Pamg9MRblbOwUgLfQ.text: First time in Scottsdale and was recommend here by a friend. Came in on a Tuesday and was immediately seated. Made it just on time for happy hour. ($5 Diego Margaritas are both strong and delicious!) Let me just say the Brussels sprout nachos and salmon bowl are definitely worth coming back for! Our server Lexi was so nice and always checked in on us!

EbThfML1n-wxMkYG-VPboA.text: First time here. Great music and outdoor seating area is nice. The wire chairs and table not comfortable. Over priced for the food not being anything special at all. Ordered the coconut rice and the only coconut taste was the little tiny flakes they placed on top. The rice was over cooked (soggy). It was so loud at 11am that could barely here the server. The menus had dried up sugar or alcohol on it. It was sticky. I also ordered the skirt steak and shrimp taco and I wanted it to be amazing and it wasn't. The shrimp taco lacked so much flavor and you get so little amount in the street taco, for $5 - $7 a taco, I would absolutely love to expect more. Our server was slow, didn't get utensils until I went up to the bar to grab some bar napkins. Didnt get our chips and salads until 20 mins after ordering. After I watched 3 guys sit down immediately at the bar and within 5 mins of them sitting down they were handed chips and salsa. Took another 30 mins for 4 tacos (between I and my husband) to get. Had to ask for a refill on water. It's those little things that customers should not have to worry about. It's serving 101.  So disappointed as I have been wanting to make a trip here for so long. Now I have and not really worth coming back. Have had way better service and tacos at other places.

yo1b106FQ6nGlibQU86kUQ.text: Had dinner here last night. The food was good, but didn't exceed expectations. Taste of the food was good, salsa was overly spiced, and service was slow. To be honest, I'm not sure I'd come back... not because it was that bad, but because there are much better Mexican joints nearby that I prefer.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quesadilla w/ chicken added
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. California burrito

pIa9cbNodyQsY0VXFhjIYg.text: Cute and trendy place. Overpriced in my opinion but not too bad and it is in Scottsdale. Not surprising though cause these places are usually a bit overpriced. $5 for a small fish taco but flavor was good! Also got the Brussel sprout nachos to share. Sounds weird but again flavors were great. Awesome drink menu too! Super fun flavored margaritas and cocktails.

prE_TN8k5OBCDJq3LYrdRw.text: Great atmosphere and decor.  Fun cocktails and healthier options than most Mexican cantinas!

2FaujbOFM_AHI-Sx-1T0RQ.text: The service and the bartenders are incredible!!!Not only are they personable their drinks are fantastic. Also hello new taco Monday spot 3 bucks heck yes! I would definitely recommend this spot to anyone looking for a very happy vibe!!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fresh one margarita pitcher bomb!!! Don&#39;t forget the sauces!

WsSi5bwWooA0BYvl7Kb_pg.text: Decent options on the lunch menu, presented in an easy-to-decifer menu.  Taco or bowl? Chicken, beef, pork or veggie? You'll find great mexican-style options whichever direction you choose.  I have to say I was pleasantly surprised to see some plantain slices in the chips when we ordered the Chips/Salsa/Quac appetizer. Nice touch.  I rolled the dice on the Horchata and was equally satisfied.    Got the bowl w/pastor and pineapple.  Picked the cilantro rice w/black beans.  It was like a Gourmet Chipotle bowl I would have paid $5 more than the $10 menu price.  Except it was served by people who you would want to go out drinking with.    We'll be back.

bvNmjsQhavJYaf9-2mHCxA.text: Absolutely wonderful tacos, prickly pear margaritas, guacamole and salsa! Our waiter Collin was super attentive even though it was a busy evening. Would very much recommend for locals and tourists alike :-)

Pd0vGjla3DE4nYmDQZ7-UQ.text: A group of 8 of us came here today for Cinco de Mayo and it was a blast! We were immediately seated and orders were taken. Our drinks were tasty. I got the guava coconut margarita that comes in a coconut and it was so refreshing. The Brussels sprout nachos were DELICIOUS because of the roasted beet garlic crema which I recommend getting. It was a great vibe with great food. If I'm in Scottsdale, I would definitely come here again!

hgKAm6jNuii3n2DZbWBk_w.text: We were quoted 30 minutes for a party of 6. An hour and a half went by before we went up to the host stand and we were told that there was only one table at which a 6 top can be sat. We were there for a birthday and would have went to another restaurant if the quote of time was any longer than 30 min, however, they insisted that 30 min was the maximum. Without going into grand detail the staff and owner were extremely unprofessional.

pb6Nw6L8QHRU2QYAt3-R3A.text: The brussels sprout nachos are really as good as the other reviewers have mentioned! I've had them more then a few times and everyone always loves them, be careful because they can easily fill you up! Individual tacos and the burritos are great too. I've also had a few of their salads and love them, big a portion sizes. Great classic margarita as well, love this place for groups esp on Sunday when is all day happy hour!!

ofNywmt5fu7ZuaY2ospjuQ.text: Bad customer service recovery. My husband and I came in on a Monday when it wasn't too busy at all, maybe half full. We sat in the patio, ordered two tacos each and the shrimp ceviche. We asked for the ceviche to come out first. We waited 25 mins for the ceviche and I asked our server to check on it and she promised she was on top of it. Another while goes by and finally we get all our food at once which apparently the manager ran out. We asked the manager for sauce so we could eat. She never came back with our sauce so we sat another while and I had to get up to ask a different server for some sauce. At this point, I asked to speak with the manager again. When she came back, she did apologize and blamed the kitchen saying she yelled at them many times. Then I asked her to please take the ceviche away, that at this point we would just eat our tacos. Her response? "Sorry, can I buy you tequila shots?" I understand this is Scottsdale and this is a nice gesture but after turning them down, I dunno, I feel that if she offered to buy us shots, the least she could have done was comp my lemonade and my husbands horchata. The only thing that was fixed was the ceviche that we didn't even eat was taken off the bill. Wow! Thanks!  The manager was nice enough but young and I think uninformed.

dhyiGR9RL9jowv7E0i0zeQ.text: Yummiest tacos in Phoenix! This place is the perfect spot for happy hour or large groups! They've got a great patio and a ton of indoor seating with the cutest decor! The patio is also dog friendly!  I ordered the grilled salmon tacos, but ALL of their tacos looked delicious! I need to go back and try a margarita, I've heard great things about them!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

CTs_pqhVRPd0oGUuv4opiQ.text: I've been here two or three times now and every time I come here I always order the tacos because I'm a big taco lover.   The drinks are awfully great too and the service has always been excellent. I could sit here for hours just having drinks with friends and having chips and salsa.  One of the best spots to hang out and I'll keep coming back.

CiIgVZi6bzJAjdlawsQCcA.text: #fatjared say...hands down best experience at a Mexican restaurant I have ever had!   I didn't get any photos, but the menu has a wide array of choices, and they are super accommodating to special orders! Our waitress was being trained and was absolutely awesome! So in total we had 3 people looking after us. We had a group of about 10 guys, and Emily, Taylor, and the manager who also came over ALEXYS, were PHENOMENAL!!  The tacos came out quickly, were super juicy with great sauce and cooked to perfection. The margaritas were tasty and we had ALOT! They had a check in special so I got a special taco and a beer as well!   Bottom line with this place, you will have a GREAT time! When the manager ends up befriending the entire group and she takes extra care of your group just because that's her nature, you know the place is run well! I have 0 complaints so 5 stars ALL DAY!!  Thank you Alexys for being the best ever!

AV7-gaYWiZROgN1LgA7NEA.text: This place is awesome. We went for happy hour and had margs and the Brussels sprouts nachos. SO good!!

SX-MxhKscR2o5t5HBnil9w.text: Great place to eat Mexican food.  They have tons of good deals and fresh Mexican food.  The street tacos were super tasty and many of the other patrons were ordering nachos, burritos and more.  Can't wait to come back to this casual joint to go and eat more!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Taco Monday&#39;s, all tacos are $3

eP4nV1Eg511EYN5SCm1wnQ.text: This place has a fun atmosphere and great patio/bar. They have AC on the patio so it's not bad to sit outside when it's hot.  We got the corn queso and it's was good, different. We ordered 5 different types of tacos and non of them blew us away.  They all had way too little meat and way too much lettuce/slaw on top. I felt like I was eating a taco salad to be honest.  The real reason we came here was to try the hyped up sundaes for dessert.  Unfortunately when it was time to order dessert we were informed that the ice cream machine has been broken for a month.  SERIOUSLY?!  The food and drinks were ok but not worth returning for.  It was the dessert we really wanted to try and they didn't even have a working ice cream machine. Super disappointed.  With all the other amazing restaurants in the downtown Scottsdale area don't waste your time coming here.

pPGqp57MRnyWDNmZINzgoQ.text: One of my daughters friends who grew up here and is now in Denver told us 'to get a marg at Diego Pops, that's the first thing I am missing'.  So we did, took some pics of our prickly pear margs and my coconut marg and she texted back things that even I don't feel I should divulge.  Half price apps during happy hour. Great guacamole, salsa and street corn quest. The drinks were absolutely dynamite and the patio is a swell place to day drink.  You have much choice in Scottsdale and even so get your ass down to Diego Pops!!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guava coconut margarita

auCrz-skIKOEtXNHfYASCA.text: The tacos were good. Just good. Not really worth the price or the WAIT. The service and wait time was not great. The chicken burrito also had very little chicken actually in it. BUT the bar doesn't card.  More of a college vibe.   *the wait time when we first put our name down was 25-37 mins. I added 1 person to the group so the wait time went up to 45 mins. We waited 1hr and 15 mins.

irFfK-so3GlQ4-yyn9ewNQ.text: I was a little disappointed with this place. I went for Happy Hour and got the chicken and shrimp taco which were only $3. It was a bit cold and not the greatest taste. I also order the street corn queso and the prickly pear margarita which were both good. I think this place is just hype but taste wise it's nothing special or anything to get excited about. I do think they have very cute decor which I believe is what attracts most people. Overall I wouldn't recommend the food and the drinks are pretty average.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Prickly Pear Margarita

_Gl4QF1URjkI1q7AQkgWMQ.text: My husband and I have been here twice now and we LOVE coming here. The first time, we ordered the Brussels sprouts nachos and OMG are they amazing. The pickled onions and the cojita with the crispy Brussels sprouts are excellent. The drinks are very good too, and they can make you a "skinny" version of a house marg. I tried the tacos the second time I came and was not disappointed. The snow cone margaritas are super yummy but the tiny spoon it comes with is laughable. We love coming here and bringing friends here because it's casual but trendy and reasonably priced for a fun dinner in OTS.

ivzjC_ruKkT6EJ0WqI835A.text: Came to Scottsdale to visit my GF and she recommends this place a lot, Very nice area, a place that you will not regret. It is worth every penny.   Atmosphere- nice out door seating and indoor seating. Lively and hip kinda vibe a must place eatery in scottsdale.   Servers are super quick and they will get to you as soon as possible with drinks and food.   Food- There plantain bowl which is absolutely delicious and you must add there pink sauce on top of it to kick up the flavor. They have 6 different kinds of sauces which you can choose from. They have veggie options, black beans are great, they have coconut rice which is a little sweater which also has a nice different taste.  There guac is very tasty freshly made, and get fresh jalapeno's on the side.  There plantain's are very tasty super flavorful I recommend the bowl for sure.   Drinks- they have margaritas, beer to your choice and there margaritas are greatly made and add it with a sugar rim.   Happy hour- Monday-friday 3pm-6pm. Sunday happy hour is all day. Half of appetizers three dollar beers, four  margs, and five dollar wine and sangria.   Taco Monday- not  Tuesday two  tacos and three  tacos.   Sauce- They have 6 flavors habanero, chipotle mayo, Serrano ranch, roasted garlic  beet cream , salsa verde, and Guajillo Chile.   Check in offer they have which is 5 dollars for a taco and a beer.   Overall- A nice place to come to, check the atmosphere of this place get your drink on, have some chips and salsa bring a date here or your family and check out a unique different eatery.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Plantain bowl.
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken taco, black beans, coconut rice.

VahHuhZeZ5s4as1jSaI01A.text: My bf and I love Diego Pops!  First of all, it's so cute inside and is such an inviting place to walk into. Love restaurants with a patio!  We've been here multiple times and the food is always very good. We love getting tacos, chips and salsa and the corn appetizer. Tip: Ask for the corn in a bowl off of the cob so that way you can dip your chips on it. It's soooo good with the hot cheetos dusted on top.   Go for happy hour during the week or on Mondays when they have super good deals.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Corn appetizer served in a bowl.. SO GOOD.

ufoJ-fN3F0E_5SVJnhiTDw.text: My friend and I had just arrived in to town and were looking for some good tacos, we had heard Arizona knows how to make them well! Thankfully for us we had caught diego pops at a happy hour and taco Monday. My first problem was the elote. Our waitress had said that the corn would be a minute to cook which we had no problem with waiting, but to me that means when it arrives it should be hot, but it was not it was lukewarm. Then when we got our tacos, one of my crunchy shells was a bit burnt. The soft taco shells were also not very warm at all and every taco needed loads of salsa because it was lacking in flavor. I was so happy that we did not have to pay full price because these tacos were not worth $5. I have had so many tacos they are my favorite food, so I know a good taco when I have it.  I just wouldn't really come back here to eat again. The staff was friendly, the ambiance was cute, but the heart of any restaurant (the food) was lacking.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pork, carne asada, chicken

IqI-1CES3UqUtCQuGZZdgw.text: This place kills on originality of Mexican food.  Brussel sprout nachos with a fried egg?! Yes please!  Beet hot sauce?! Yes please.  With a cool atmosphere for you college types;)

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel sprout nacho

Z1KPjvDIt5fqtxn3C115mg.text: This is a gem in oldtown. I choose this spot after work for happy hour and has never steered me wrong, their margaritas are fun also. Good food and its close to everything.

Lmt7TSFMffIUmQIE09Kbyg.text: This review is a long time coming. Been coming here for a while now and it's becoming a habit because the tacos are so addictive. I've taken several friends here and they're all loving this great Mexican place. It's cool and it's a good hang and the tacos are the best tacos in Scottsdale bar none.  The service is great and the people who work here are all really friendly and they're always nice and they always do a great job. I wish I could come here every day for the tacos but I'd end up being 500 pounds ha ha ha ha ha.  Anyway I definitely recommend this awesome Mexican spot.

tZkYLxNi_X2-XO1aDYxZxQ.text: Great spot   Our server David was knowledgeable and quick. We would definitely go back. Only thing keeping this from 5 stars is the wings were a big large and a little fatty.   Great tacos and atmosphere!

Hx1h-rbASaiR6cvAETTNtA.text: I would describe Diego Pops as tasty, healthy Mexican food! Plus their atmosphere is very cute, super instagramable! I love the patio but the inside decor is adorable as well, with it's funky pink pineapple wall paper and bright neon signs!  I came in recently with some coworkers for a team happy hour! We started with some drinks and apps. They had happy hour specials going on so I enjoyed a $4 house margarita and all of our apps were half off! It was a pretty great deal! We order the chips and salsa, guacamole, street corn queso, the quesadilla, and the brussel sprout nachos. The stand out was definitely the nachos! Who would ever think to put brussel sprouts on nachos?! I also loved the pickled onions and jalapenos that were on the nachos! I have to say though, I'm not much of a fan of their beet crema sauce that was on both the nachos and the quesadilla.   Be warned, when it comes to Diego Pops' cocktails, some of them are just for the looks. They are adorable in photos but do not tasty very good. I tried the guava coconut cocktail, which is beautiful. It's in a baby coconut with an umbrella, but the flavor of the drink was way too sweet. And the snow cone margaritas are also not worth ordering. Luckily, the servers are very up front about this and steer guest towards better choices, like the prickly pear or watermelon mint margaritas! Both are unique and refreshing!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Watermelon mint margarita

Z2F0nMWe_tIXzfHlFm7gJA.text: Solid taco restaurant with a trendy vibe. They have a nice patio and indoor/outdoor bar. We came in January and sat on the patio when it was 72 and beautiful. Their patio is dog friendly which was great for us. Their tacos are all gluten-free if you get them on a soft corn tortilla. I have to stay away from their chips because of fryer cross-contamination as I'm Celiac.  We got guacamole to start and was just so-so.  I got pineapple pork tacos and green chili pork tacos. They were both good but the pineapple pork tacos I definitely recommend. My wife got the chicken adobo taco and the watermelon salad. She like both but the taco was only good after dr'ing it up with pickled onions and Serrano sauce.  She was very happy with the watermelon salad.  This is one of our favorite local taco places and we'll definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chicken adobo taco - gluten free and good
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Pineapple Pork Tacos &amp; Green Chili Pork Tacos - gluten free and good!

yxGar4RcpRuLeBNHpejsQg.text: Such a great establishment. The staff is amazing, especially the GM Storm. He went above and beyond to make sure I had a great experience. Becca is my go to at that place. The bartender Markell makes greats cocktails. The food is amazing. 10/10 recommend

6g473ixMFy9GycyT518JPQ.text: Stopped by Diego Pops one day for lunch (while on vacation) with my sister. It was completely dead at 2pm on a Friday. Only one other table. The inside of the restaurant is very cute with kind of a retro vibe. We started off with the chips & guac and started to dig in...until about 10 flies started swarming our table. It was actually very gross. We felt like we were shooing off a fly every 10 seconds. The guac was served with tortilla chips and plantain chips (which I did not care for). We each had a fish taco and a pulled pork taco. Both of the tacos were flavorful, but we were so grossed out by the flies swarming around us and our food that we left quicker than expected and not finishing everything before we left. They need to get that fly situation under control.

_hLJ8No9HIB9wrRaebCPoQ.text: Food Poisoning - here is a review from someone else who had a similar experience. "Being that I wrote a very fair email regarding myself and 4 other people getting bad food poisoning at my birthday dinner on September 2 and never got a response is very disappointing....I love coming here and I just really wanted to bring it to their attention.   Then I come on here to see if anyone else may have gotten sick and someone posted a review just 2 days after our experience stating they also got food poisoning."

qADC1AFi22vxUMvgZ20M4A.text: Brought some friends to Taco Monday/ Happy hour. The first timers will be long timers after their experience. We made it easy for Emily, but she did great. $4 Don Julio margs and $3 Diego Tacos, what more do you need?

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Xnl1TnYp0KGth6gYmbU0KQ.text: Walking around looking for a place to eat lunch Sunday and stumbled to this spot and I'm glad I did. Started off with the guacamole and house salsa. The guac was standard and the salsa had some kick to it.   Ordered three tacos and I will start with my favorite and end with my least favorite. The braised pineapple pork is tremendous. So much flavor in it and it all balances out well. The second one I tried was the charred skirt steak. The steak was great but everything else was bland. The third one was the grilled shrimp. It wasn't very good I wouldn't recommend ordering it.  Even though I only really liked 1 of the 3 tacos I ordered I really enjoyed my experience here. The atmosphere was great and the staff was extremely friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. braised pineapple pork (front), charred skirt steak (center), grilled shrimp (back)
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. guac and salsa

3ZYWDZWhtLRV0fOcDTJMeA.text: I'm in love, every restaurant I've been to in Scottsdale has been spectacular and this was no exception. It's for the food options alone that I'd love to live here but I can visit so that's a plus!  We enjoyed the chip appetizer and boy it was lovely to enjoy especially with the unique sauces offered.  I ordered the Caesar salad with shrimp add on and used about half the dressing along with some of the other sauces for a scrumptious meal! BE SURE to note the check in offer of taco and beer!  Oh and the Mexican mule was really something, the margarita was good as well but must be enjoyed slowly to avoid brain freeze

-V8bAUPg8Rx1TfmtYXKySQ.text: Great patio and flavorful food. We went on a Monday for happy hour and $3 tacos on Monday's. $4 margaritas and 1/2 off appetizers. Great deal if you go on Mondays. Tacos are small but flavorful, worth $3 but definitely not worth full price. I had the Crispy Cod (left) Beef Machaca (middle) and Green Chili Chicken (right). They have a ton of great sauces on the table as well, those were fun to try. We also had the Brussels Sprout nachos which were a fun twist on traditional nachos. The egg on top was great

ovA5mYw56Q5Dds5JTm-Dtg.text: This is a great place to go for happy hour; Best deal on the menu at that time are the Brussel Sprout Nachos and they do not disappoint.

xS_AI0WZTLaiGke5Y-ChhA.text: Diego Pops has the best street tacos I've had in a restaurant so far! Yes, tacos are the thing right now and everybody is doing them, but Diego Pops is doing them the best. I've tried various types here and all of them have been delicious.  The atmosphere is great and you can sit inside or outside. Service was fast and attentive and our food was out in no time! I can definitely see this being a regular place to go and it would also be a great place to start, or end, and evening out in Scottsdale.

a64GGCCaT-vpEQtFZ8M9-w.text: We went here for taco Tuesday!! Although they don't do taco Tuesday they actually do taco MONDAY... we still had an amazing time!! Skyler was our server and she was new but the best one there! She was absolutely amazing and we enjoyed her company. Diego pops has a variety of Mexican food and delicious drinks. Everything we had was delicious and also a good environment. It was our first time there and we will definitely be back!

6U32nhfVjPi3Lqv_BPn1zQ.text: First time coming here and wanted to try it out because it always look poping.The atmosphere was awesome! Food was way over priced the tacos were $3+ for tiny tiny taco. With that high priced I expect a flavorful dish. Excited to get the grilled salmon taco. The salmon tasted like it came from a can . ordered pitcher of margarita . it was 60% water 35% juice 5% alcohol for $35. Prolly never coming back. Maybe it it was like $2 a taco. Service was good nothing outstanding .I like how they have a variety of sauces on the table.

cwTSWVpzCE3KpV-FJytKJg.text: A personal favorite! Fresh margaritas and friendly service. The Brussel sprout nachos with beet cream sauce are fabulous! I have no idea what else is on the menu...will make a point to find out!!

V5c-ql28-idCCesXo1h1Ww.text: Very good service. we sat inside because it was chilly outside but they do have heaters. inside was a little loud. the food was amazing. classic mexican food but with a little twist. highly reccomend

DmRy5UOla63RMCT51Cp8zw.text: Was looking for a great place for tacos and decided to try Diego's since the reviews were really good.  It was exactly what I was looking for.  Reminded me of La Lupitas in Old Town San Jose.  Open air.  Good service and amazing flavors.  We had the green chili chicken, grilled shrimp, skirt steak and grilled salmon tacos.  Yum.  Heading back soon for the Poke......you won't be disappointed.

rEBir7n0cXVNvyx_q3tEaw.text: Ordered to go, this place lacks flavor. Will try inside next time. At least I didn't go hungry they have decent size portions.

WNJAQeTDekaj_eGpk0ebkQ.text: Came here for happy hour and was severely disappointed. The service was the worst service I've received in the last year. Our server forgot to put our orders in twice. I never got a water refill in 1.5 hours! I ordered chips/guac (received 25 minutes after the 1st time we ordered). We received crumbled chips after the long wait. I had to get up and ask for napkins?!other tables didn't have napkins while they were eating their meals? They had servers rolling silverware in the main dining room, right next/above a guest's table?! They ended up complaining and requesting to move. It was noisy and distracting even for sitting near by. In almost 1.5 hours I was only able to order 3 drinks between 2 ppl, which I waited nearly 20 minutes for my last drink (after following up) to be told they didn't have the coconut to put my drink in. I was offered the drink in a regular glass, which would have been fine...if I was offered when I first put the order in. I dine out a lot and this was by far the worst experience I've had in a long time. We walked to a near by establishment and received 2 speciality cocktails and a hot appetizer within the first 10 minutes!!!

vPb2EKZQvi_81bN39lSoJg.text: We took our daughter here for her 6th Birthday, she  asked for a fun Mexican type restaurant. Glad we picked Diego Pops, our server Skyler made our birthday girl feel special and provided great service. The food was great, variety of tacos, best chips and Brussel sprout nachos are a must try. Great energy, design and the patio was perfect even in the heat. Thank you for a great family night, we will return as our girls are now in love with Choco Tacos!

ymCSP0nd-9IZVs4vCXOfxg.text: This is the only place in Scottsdale that has fried plantains on their menu. As a Colombian, that means the world to me. Whether you go on Mondays for cheaper tacos or any other night, the food is amazing and they also have a full bar. Steak tacos, fried plantains and a Dos XX is my go to every time.  Parking is a little small so if you're planning on drinking, just Uber there so you don't have to worry about parking. If you do drive, there's a big parking stricture about 1-2 blocks away, so it's not too bad anyways.

wd4SPHydQMoErab0vWPeMA.text: This is an awesome place to go for happy hour! They have unique takes on tex mex cuisine. Be sure to get their nachos. They look like they would be an odd combo but they are absolutely delicious and I have to get them when I am in town! Yummy!

QyHjmn9PbrBYv960QS1rWw.text: Diego Pops is super cute on the inside, but very cramped. They were really busy and the line for the bathroom was outside the door. The tacos were good, I wouldn't come back for them specifically. The quest corn dip, however, was amazing. It was a little cottage-cheesey and chunky, but so delicious! Our waitress was super helpful and had great menu recommendations.

wJZJfLPDQjMMPZf-74SJnw.text: My only complaint is that the food was so good that I  couldn't stop eating...  Great food, super friendly server (Brittany), and awesome ambiance. I got a BBQ Chicken taco (spicy!), Braised Green Chili Chicken taco and a braised pineapple pork taco. All were amazing and the home made salsa was over the top! The GM stopped by who also could not be any more friendly.   After stuffing my face full I couldn't say no to dessert... "camp fire sundae" changed my life... Ice cream, chocolate sauce, graham cracker and toasted marshmallow cream over top... they literally toast it with a torch!! Highly recommend.   Hands down my new taco Tuesday (and everyday) Mexican food spot.

4rGFE_SljhrZuTcGU_kLqA.text: Great HH!  The food was all really good!   The unique vibe of the place is perfect of an after work get together. Lots of space with a nice patio.

_9BzIIoqXIH7x6YzspElFQ.text: I cannot believe I came here and did not get the brussels sprout nachos!!! I totally spaced it (possibly due to the copious amount of drinks that were imbibed on this particular night). Anyway, I guess that's a reason to return sooner rather than later. Diego Pops was a fun little restaurant with excellent service. A friend and I went around 9:30 at night, and they were semi busy, but not crazy. We ordered the chips and salsas.... the salsas were all delish. It was fun to eat the chips with the 4 or 5 different salsas. We also tried 4 different tacos, and all were tasty with the fried fish being the most  underwhelming and the pineapple pork and machaca being the tastiest. All were fairly good and large! The one drink we tried was the guava coconut because....well... it's served in a coconut!!! The drink itself was just ok, but it added to the experience. I would LOVE to come back for happy hour the next time I find myself in Scottsdale.

82h8vfuEqkUDZqZvHsBjrw.text: My Fiance and I absolutely LOVE this joint! Some of the best food in Scottsdale! The chicken tortilla soup and brussel sprout nachos are to die for, must have! Jeneva was our server most recently and she rocks that place! She made us the best drinks and shots I think I've ever had!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel Sprout Nachos
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Guava Coconut

taWzzGQHz9AzpWwhMr-0HA.text: Fantastic food, great atmosphere, stylish interior, great service and make sure you try the churro Sunday!

t4gYWCBLirXU2QfepFQ-yQ.text: What a great place!! We're were walking around looking for some food and stumbled across Diego Pops and decided to stop in.  So glad we did!!  Bartenders were awesome and so friendly and the apps were awesome!! They recommended the nachos as they are not your normal nachos and a said were a customer fave.  Omg!! They were delish!!  Egg and brussell spouts on nachos.??  So good!!!  Will definitely come by again next time we're in town!!

M2R01Q04ZX8XX0nLK9Jvhw.text: This is top notch Mexican through and through. If you're in Scottsdale and craving Mexican this is your spot. The homemade sauces are unreal!!!

L8MXuZpGMscduPbOhgLX4A.text: Went here for the $2 tacos on Monday. Meat was bland and service was poor. Only reason for three stars is the salsa which was really good

_IjpmEge98ZnD3N4kwyLzA.text: Go to spot for bringing out of towners! Perfect location. Great spot to grab dinner before the bars or to sit on the patio on a Saturday for lunch.

OyDzBT4WmmWegBb_EEi4RQ.text: We had a group of 12 of us who attempted to Barrio Queens first at 2:00pm on a Tuesday in December but they were too full so we went to Diego Pops. We were glad we did! They were pretty empty so we got seated right away. Our waiter was wonderful, the food was delicious, the prices were pretty low and the ambience was cute. There's also great kid options. Would go back!

hidtm2zgpn2VeWasPxToOQ.text: Not a bad little place.  The inside has a weird 50s diner-ish look to it.  I did not like it, and next time will choose the patio area which seemed much nicer.  Our service was very good when we went.  We started with the corn queso dip.  I liked it a lot and would recommend it.  We tried a selection of the tacos.  They were good, but nothing stands out as great.

Cf-roa5TdFJItZd0vSQkRA.text: Great prices, great service,(Lexie was very helpful and friendly and prompt) fun atmosphere and VERY reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

N4gD6S3Eis9n5ycby_4aVA.text: I love this place. It's right in between the fine dining of Mission and Loco Patron.   We ordered the guacamole, bbq tacos, chicken lime bowl and salmon bowl. Each had its own unique flavorful taste. We were satisfied with every one. I don't think you go wrong with ordering food from here!  It paired nicely with a michilada, which was made well and not poorly like most bar. There was crushed salt on the rim, real tomato juice and a big juicy lime.   Everything came out fast, the waitress was prompt with refilling our waters and taking good care of us. We even got a deal for checking in on yelp! A taco and beer combo for $5!  We will be back because it's a great little lunch spot.
