L63kdj9HxJfNpv2t0v2VGA.text: Amazing food, great drink specials and when the Red headed bartender goes bra-less it's even better!

sOTk6HW9KrPGK3ftuh-ANw.text: We kinda found this place by accident but a great hotspot with Brussel sprouts nachos and delicious tacos. You must have the snow cone margarita! Yummy . Great Serice too the people are very friendly. Taylor our waitress was amazing!! Great attitude so nice and helpful! Service was great thanks Taylor!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mango elderflower snow cone margarita

Kj_FQrdGoLcR3hPatH-uBg.text: Visited this restaurant a couple of times.  First couple of times the food and service were great and i couldn't say enough about the place.  The last time (this past spring) we sat outside at the bar and the staff seemed more interested in socializing with each other than taking care of customers.  I had taken someone new there and was a little embarrassed that I recommended it for dinner that night.

jaehHHAJBHpb0WqWRhHKqg.text: I came here yesterday for my first time after wanting to try it out for months. The decor is too die for, so adorable!   We got seated right away, I would of preferred the patio, but since it was Valentines Day I was happy we got seated at all without a wait. Our cute and bubbly comes in to greet us and we immediately ask to order the guacamole and she apologizes and says they are out and she should mention they're also out of flour tortillas?! Um, what? Mexican restaurant that doesn't have guac... you would think that would be simple to remake. But, of course maybe they didn't think they'd as busy this weekend being Valentines day and all.   The great thing is they have happy hour all day on Sundays and the drinks were amazing and delicious and pretty and anything else you can think of. The food on the other hand was nothing spectacular. I will definitely be back to give them another try when they might be more prepared and not so busy. The place was too cute and I've heard too many great things to not try them out again.

UN6oM-5QDe5DVq1pzFS5Hw.text: Never again - I live in Scottsdale and have been to Diego Pops 6 times now. The first 3 times made us want to come back. Good service, good tacos, and a unique take on a mexican staple in a metro area that offers a wide variety of them. However, the 4th time was different. The servers did there job but the host was a dick and the pork and machaca meat in the tacos as well as the crispy shells were way over cooked.  Ditto the 5th time except instead of the host it was the butch bartender that seemed to hate every minute she was there and took it out on the customers.  This last Wednesday night was our 6th and last time at Diego Pops. We were celebrating a birthday with a party of 6. After a healthy bar tab we were ready to find a table and eat but the hostess seemed to be completely confused and incapable of figuring out how to seat 6 people together and she just lost it. We didn't care where we sat we just wanted to sit down and celebrate. When were were finally seated and the food came we were disappointed again. Burnt meat stuffed in burnt crispy taco shells.  I can get better tacos at Filibertos drive thru for 1/3 the price with a lot less bitchy attitude. Diego Pops has forgotten who pays the bills and that its the food that is key to repeat business from locals not the "Old Town" location so we are done with Diego Pops. I would recommend you try Blanco Taco, Bario Queen, Joy Ride, or Fuzzys, or Juan Jaimes for good tacos and proper hospitality. Thanks Yelp.

5QT-g8DDjBLfxv1CQACN6A.text: Such an adorable lunch spot. We had the award winning guacamole, salsa, Tulum bowl, and the adobo BBQ chicken tacos. My husband no i loved everything about it. I'm only bummed that I can only find these cute restaurants in Scottsdale and not in the west valley.

8owr7G4nU16yMZgoWuPWcA.text: Was hoping for a nice lunch with my daughter. Not sure what has happened with the service industry. In my option it sucks. You pay $50 for lunch and get shit service. I'm better off eating at home. The food was okay. My water, drinks, appetizer, entre show up at the same time. As everything  is being served at once my waiter spills my margarita on my pants and sandal. Says sorry, runs away never to be seen again. Luckily anther server was near by to get a napkin to wipe myself off. Seriously. I complained maybe thinking the manager would come by, but only to hear the server is busy. Never going back, that's for sure. If my waiter was so busy the manager should be helping making sure everything runs smoothly. I'm sure the manager was standing there with his thumb up his ass.

pJhyhRSP-3AsZD8mOsErpA.text: Great patio, Mondays are a great day to go, but even if not a Monday their Happy Hour is a great deal. Actually overall their prices, considering its Old Town are fair and their food is fresh and flavorful. Defiantly will be a return customer! They lost a star due to the flying bugs on their patio.

BtiP04EhrOmS2DMDqVNGfg.text: Whoever thought of Taco Monday is my hero! I love tacos everyday really. This is my favorite place to take out of towners. Great atmosphere and even better food.

iZAHT0SWZtnFkm1CzHqbjg.text: This place is amazing!!!! Brussels sprout nachos!!!! Fabulous!!!!! The staff is great! The owner fabulous!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

C8uPE6n9L3vZ-wnOsBFSIA.text: My wife and I love Diego Pops! Great food, cool atmosphere, and the manager Rebecca is awesome ! Shes sharp, makes great drinks and suggestions! A unique spot I highly recommend!

Uf_qlmZ75soGvhEVCSDcoA.text: Can I say fantastic? Cus it is. Visiting from out of town. From the open air vibe to the awesomeness of our server (Chantill) this place is a 5 star solid. Have a couple of days left in town and will definitely return. Yum!!

AfaLR493wqrX0D91rxms_w.text: Such an amazing experience !! The restaurant is really cute ! Prime atmosphere good for a date night ! The food is great, the nACHOs are to die for really tasty strongly recommend this place if you are in town

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

u0rhU4UWD0Ki6xIQoo78aQ.text: Love this place for lunch. I recommend the crispy cod tacos. I come here all the time for lunch and sitting out on the patio is the best. Service is always great and the drinks are COLD!!!!!

ISAmlFZARkdgSy4tadmutQ.text: Diego pops is honestly the bomb. I've been coming here ever since I moved to Scottsdale and I have never been disappointed. Danny and Fox were the greatest bartenders and treated my friend and I with the most exceptional service. Go to Diego Pops if you want great food and great service!

5lXJv5SjPpOJwGUDsgYf6w.text: Good service. Good tacos. Danny and Fox were prompt and attentive. Will be coming back!!!

HdiEaphmhU8w2PdufFpsJA.text: Literally my favorite taco place ever. If you have never been here you are missing out! The corn queso dip is a must and the braised green chili chicken taco is just as amazing!! Every time I go there the service is awesome and I love that the owner is very personable! Give it a try or ten, you wont be disappointed. :)

AVUhzO4ph2qHoWxNmptNHQ.text: Decent tacos.  Not authentic mexican food, but worth a stop in for Happy Hour or "Taco Monday"....damn that's original!  I'm just waiting for somebody to have "Taco Wednesday" so I can pig out 3 nights in a row for $10/night.  Make it happen.  Work it out.

iYYoJIJNekhdxVWH0x82_Q.text: This is my go to lunch spot... I frequent it almost every week and sometimes multiple times in a week (don't judge me).  If it's your first time, you have to try the brussels sprout nachos.  If you don't like brussels sprouts... get them anyways.  The brussels sprouts are really buttery and compliment the cheese and egg.  It has some great flavors and textures... it's very unique to Diego Pops!  The cocktails are all pretty decent but if you're looking for a nonalcoholic beverage, I love the limeade aqua fresca.  It's really refreshing especially during the scorching hot summer days (and nights).  I usually either get the grilled shrimp tacos (delicious) or I go for the mango habanero wings.  The wings take a bit so definitely plan accordingly but I think that they're worth the extra time.  No matter what I'm eating, I always have the beet crema (the pink sauce) on hand.  I don't know exactly what's in it but if they sold it, I would buy gallons at a time.  The service is definitely spotty but that doesn't necessarily bother me because I really enjoy the food.

Y-6EIfp5tLJGASOjTV8ADg.text: I was visiting some friends in town. Now I come from Chicago where we are known for some seriously good food. The wait staff was prompt, pleasant, and efficient. The decor was super cool. The menu had just enough things to choose from. The brussel sprout nachos were amazing and plated very nicely! I had a coconut flavored margarita that was so good I had to order another. The music was fun and they have a cool bar area that extends to the outside portion of the space. Overall I would go here again. It was a great place to go on a Friday night with some local friends.

_ePIaW3K5183WbetmkZU7w.text: This is the most terrible Mexican restaurant I have ever been to. I mean how can you ruin Mexican?, it's Mexican. If I hate this restaurant so much then why did I rate it 2 stars? Well first of all, they gave us food so that is a 1 star,  then they have a decorated restaurant so there goes 1 more. It wasn't bad experience though it was just bad food. It had music it had people just not enough staff. Now let's talk about the food. First things first. The appetizer which was chips and salsa. Can't go wrong with that right? Well this is what I learned, you can go wrong with that. Salsa was bland and chips had no flavor whatsoever. Then the food , only thing that my family liked about that was the cholula. Terrible. No flavor. I recommend that you do not go to this restaurant if you don't like things with no flavor!

UvzVdnu3E7jO6M8DedXfXQ.text: I love this place... the atmosphere, the outdoor seating, the interesting cocktails and good food, it's all so great! I try to come here whenever I'm near old town and craving some good Mexican food! I love their sauce tray as well, it has very unique blends of different spices and flavors! Their drink menu is super cute and I especially love their margaritas. Also their chips and salsa are yum. I would suggest getting the tacos without the slaw because the flavor is over the top and I like the simplicity of the taco when it doesn't have the slaw. I've never had issues with their service as they always get the food drinks out quickly.

_Zt6DUIB9HYHh-dzOWJDCQ.text: Food was amazing. Loved the atmosphere. Sat outside and loved it. Service was a little quirky and on the slow side however we were In no rush so it didn't matter. Excellent fresh margaritas too!!

n6M1bEkgPdZ49JZSD1pR_A.text: As we were waiting for a table to open up (an hour wait) at The Breakfast Club we happened to walk down the road looking at the other restaurants menus... As we walked up to Diego Pops a guy was going in and told us that is was a great place and he comes here all the time, so we decided to give it a try.  The decor is trendy but comfortable and the staff was immediately inviting and welcoming.  The menu all looked amazing so the owner gave us some good pointers... Some of which were their award winners! We tried the guacamole which was great, the chips were really good too and the salsa was fresh and homemade. The wings were Deeelish! The grill was a great touch.  They were a little bit sweet with heat at the back which was perfect. The shrimp tacos were the BOMB! Going back just for those for sure!  They also have some amazing sauces that you could literally drink. Great place to go and it didn't seem like the crowd was too young :)

dow_0OK0qeWKgh4Ff92SyA.text: Love their California burrito and margaritas! Delicious food and friendly staff. Overall great experience.

UMioo7k6EwDUWtbT14I1Hw.text: I've been here twice now. Here is my recommendation: If you're feeling tacos, get the tacos- delicious. But get the BOWL!!!   So tasty and filling! Plus you have leftovers for lunch!  Drinks are delicious too, I liked the Mexican mule! But then again I am Mexican and anything Mexican is always great ;)

w_0PoGpgQb4HHJMzS_r9TA.text: I can't believe this place. My sister and I ordered food for carry out: one taco, one burrito, and the brussels sprout nachos. After sharing the nachos, I was full, so I saved my burrito for the next day. I ordered the breakfast burrito without bacon because I am a vegetarian. They didn't put bacon in the burrito, but the did add giant pieces of chicken in it and now I can't eat it. This was my first time trying Diego Pops and now I don't know if I can trust this restaurant.

yUIhiDEdEGQUmpxtRMUtKA.text: Great tacos!  Love coming here for tacos Monday! Lots of unique dishes and cool taco sauce to choose from. Check it out you will love this place

sNQdbZpNVo25TiMJ5AleyA.text: I really like this place. The food is good but I wish they had some vegan options. There's a couple things you can tweak to make vegan but not much of a variety for plant-based diets. Besides that it's clean, staff are friendly and they are quick about getting the food out. It's a nice place to stop for lunch break due to their quick serving time.

5t0l8Niaq2qpTKFxYJQXaQ.text: Decor is on fire. Location is perfection. Plus who doesn't love margs and tacos. Perfect place for happy hour, loved sitting outside with a delicious marg with friends.

HLq5y1fomfhBdwuxKDv0yg.text: EMILY is the BEST server there. She was so kind and awesome with my party of people!! Next time I come in I will always ask to be in Emily's section!

WMxTVZ1qq6Oarb6nfdWU4Q.text: I like their house margarita and they have a pretty good happy hour. Staff is always super friendly.   Only thing I don't like here is their bar stools are really uncomfortable. It won't stop me from being a regular but I hope they look into that because there's no way anybody disagrees lol

P1plxPRvmoxkuZLNyYuy_A.text: BRUSSEL SPROUT NACHOS. Seriously though... it's this perfect balance between carbs, vegetables, and cheese WITH a egg on top. Happy hour they are $5 and if you do plan on finishing the whole thing (which you definitely should) make sure you wear a stretchier pant!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sweet corn and avocado cesar

e5AwlwAGLpBaJMzQ3mEJfw.text: Really friendly service at the bar where we had drinks and ate dinner. Bartender was aware, welcoming, and on top of it. Atmosphere was fantastic!

aPZ8uGDjUzotFgcK9p1XPg.text: So I'm in town from California and wandered into Diego Pops, from the moment we walked in  the vibe was so chill the host was relaxed and funny and although there was a bit of a wait we were kept entertained. Once we sat our server Sierra was attentive without being over Bering and her suggested dink's were amazing we order the salmon bowl, California burrito, guacamole and salsa. The kitchen did there thing all the food was flavorful, hot and plated very well the next time I'm in AZ I will definitely be back

QmZszDDveKY-RtdRhCE2uw.text: i love this place. the plantains and the brussels sprout nachos are the most amazing.

lLenCIFOHu3e1qF2tVgOMg.text: Atmosphere was lively but food was tasteless. Service was spotty. More like a tourist trap which was fun and upbeat but not gastronomically satisfying in any sense of the imagination. Margarita was too sweet and too light on the tequila. All the food more or less tasted the same.

t-BRC8bLROZeAHnVMC2p6w.text: Great vibes in the heart of Scottsdale! Very colorful set up with plenty of neon signs to take group photos in front of. Venue has a old school Miami color feel coupled with tasty tacos and margaritas. Plenty of shopping in the immediate surrounding area or places to start late night festivities

0-dxxmsdZ2X92qOsKoN9cA.text: OMG! These tacos are the epitome: Food is Love! Such flavor in every bite only comes from a labour of love. We ordered different dishes and everyone in our party was ecstatic with the quality of their meal.   We. Will. Happily. Return...again and again!

tktdHFvlgCIFc9hFQrewMQ.text: I had one day in Scottsdale and from almost everyone I asked, they recommended Diego Pops, I had to go. First off, the decor was very cute! I had two tacos, cod and skirt steak, with rice and beans. The tacos were soooo good. Everything from the meat, the toppings, and the sauces were amazing. My only complaint would be that the rice tasted like the precooked frozen rice from Trader Joes, I would have preferred spanish rice, but that is very minor. They have a great happy hour and great drinks as well. I would highly recommend, and undoubtedly next time I am in Scottsdale I will be coming back!

zE10HgjIiljCwESw5SwD3g.text: Do not come to Scottsdale without trying Diego Pops Brussels Sprout Nachos with Green Chili!!! The fried egg and beet sauce topping this mound of deliciousness is worth the stop!

VDoowWEn-1CcE0vNYMZvhA.text: You can't give this place enough stars, I'm going to save the best for last! The food is amazing! Best margaritas in town and to top it off the service is 200% on goal! David our waiter not only offered but elevated our experience to a new level! Thanks David love Diego Pops!!!!

aQeOIj_dlvFz5trjbjDn7g.text: I am never disappointed here! I went for their taco Monday this week where all tacos are 3 dollars! I also got the corn queso which is one of the best queso dips I've ever had! The service was wonderful! We had a spirited young lady who made sure we had everything we needed, she split the bill appropriately and even gave us to go waters! I couldn't have been happier! I get the plantain tacos which are vegetarian and a phenomenal twist to a taco!!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

1fBvzNw81B9rSnWvefHh-Q.text: Wonderful new place. Food was very good . Great menu and excellent service. We will definitely be back

LuTTaq0Wpx7ORqDp_T_B8w.text: A Miami vibe in Old Town Scottsdale.   Brussels Sprout nachos could be a meal for 1 OR sharing between 2; definitely not for a party more than that.    Chia lemonade could use more chia seeds.   Watermelon + Cotija salad is refreshing, and can be easily paired with any of their tacos. Tho their Braised Pineapple Pork indicates crispy tortilla, I preferred it on flour; unless you're eating it as soon as it comes out, it gets much too hard. Then you can drown it in sauce.   Take advantage of their 6-pack of sauces- Roasted Garlic Beat Crema was my fave.   Minus a star because their dessert was a bust.  Choco taco was store bought but priced as if  handmade. I can get this from the ice cream man and at half the price.  Hand dipped cone isn't dipped at all. The hardening chocolate sauce is drizzled over the ice cream. Churro sundae was more ice cream than churro; and the churro spears were more like pretzels after you dug it out.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

0YPfY83euCqDaef9a94tFw.text: Such a lovely place! Service was friendly, the food was just delicious, and it came WAY faster than we expected. The aesthetic of the whole place is so beautiful and well thought out. When we come back to visit Arizona, this will be the first place we come for dinner. They have great options for different tacos and burritos and so much more! The Mexican sodas are also so yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Lime Jarritos and Paloma

X5UtECNw6EVJXnH-M0Rogg.text: Stopped in solo at 4:30pm on a Saturday. From start to finish, the staff was terrific. Three separate  people offered to help/seat me. Fairly busy but was quickly seated at a small table on the patio. Had a couple of beers ($4 during happy hour) chips and salsa, and a beef machaca bowl with rice, beans, etc. Very tasty, and while I was tempted by the menu to have more, that was plenty. Out the door for $20 plus tip. Food was very good, but again, the staff was truly exceptional. Friendly and helpful without being overbearing. Can definitely recommend, and I'll be back next time I'm in town.

dMG3ekFaeQah9tFszlNLyg.text: Located in old town Scottsdale. This place was way better than expected. I went for the Brussel sprouts nachos and I was not disappointed. From start to finish, everything was good. They open at 11 and on a weekday, the restaurant filled up quick.   I had:  Brussels sprouts nachos: with red chili, eggs, pickled onions. Huge. Enough for four. Very tasty. We did remove most of the red Chile slices since they were spicy.   Chips and salsa $2. The salsa was spicy. It was a good serving   6 different salsas. Either mild or not spicy at all, but Delicious.  My favorite was the roasted garlic beet cream. It really evened out anything super spicy.   Plantains: yummy and big. I don't think anyone can mess up plantains   Best of all, you get a $5 taco and beer with your  yelp check In.   We all also enjoyed the complimentary gum

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Salsas. None too spicy
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu 8-2019
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Menu 8-2019

XBCDmwz3as5MmacjqYM10w.text: We were visiting Arizona for a sports event and decided to try our Diego Pops.  The place is very modern and hip, the hostesses are nice and so are the servers; they did their best with a large group of nearly 20.  I know I can't expect all 20'of us to eat at the same time but waiting nearly 25mins between the first round of people served to the next was a little ridiculous.  But it was the kindness of our server (I didn't catch his name) that saved this review from being a 1-star review.  The food itself was good if you're looking for mexican food a step above Chipotle, but just ehh if you want actual Mexican food.  I order the chicken bowl and others ordered burritos, ceviche, and tacos.  The bowl was rook temp when it was served to me and basically soupy with all the liquid from the black beans that was not drained.    Here's the part that killed the whole experience: They have a semi-open kitchen and my friend was facing said kitchen.  We had already been waiting awhile for our food so naturally we looking toward the kitchen to see what was coming out next.  She saw her husbands ceviche in the pick up window with a tray of chips...then she saw a server take a chip off of the tray and eat it before coming to drop it off to the table. As to not cause a scene, she kindly asked for a new tray of chips and the servers response was "they're all the same."  Since the server did not want to get new chips, she called her out on eating the chip off the tray.  Turns out this server was the floor manager! She took the chips and had someone else bring us the new ones. She then proceeded to not run food to our tables even when half of the party was done eating and the others hadn't gotten their food yet.  It's a nice place for drinks but I cannot say that I will be back or that I will recommend Diego Pops to anyone

3XbusxKSE1OfAzH1Ap-ZYw.text: Ok if your wanting exotic or different flavoring (that's more on the sweet side) in your tacos this place could be for you but for the most part the tacos were:  1) small, think street tacos 2) the beef and chicken were dry (fish tacos were great though).  If your a hardcore taco purist who likes more authentic tacos this place might not be for you.  Good for a late night run for tacos (they are fairly cheap) and they offer a great Tequila flight special (lots to choose from).

rKSPZCysUiYF2q6FjrWi9A.text: Used to love this place but won't be back after my husband and I found a cockroach walking in our chips. We ate outside at the bar and told the bartender. She did comp our meal but obviously I don't trust this place anymore. We had already starting eating some of the chips before we discovered the roach walking in and out of the chips.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. guava coconut, tortilla soup, pineapple marg-ojito, grilled salmon taco, green chili chicken taco and a  prickly pear margarita

Ae2FouqaNsx3WN0m_imWuw.text: Super popular spot! if you're visiting from out of town I recommend coming early or you'll have to wait a bit.   They have a great happy hour. All apps are half off. We got the STREET CORN. You can get it on or off the cob if you ask (default is on the cob). It was good. I actually liked the texture and flavor that the Hot Cheetos added. Corn was solid.   We also got the Watermelon Margarita SHAVED ICE. I was expecting to be able to eat the ice, but it literally serves as a giant ice cube. Although the drink tasted great, you're probably better off getting a frozen marg or something.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Street Corn
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Watermelon Margaritas Shaved Ice

SmCCap8aRZ1YqxC0alfDSQ.text: Came here with a friend and we came just in time for happy hour. Happy hour is everyday!!! 3pm-6pm. 1/2 off appetizers. Monday's they have $3 tacos.   So I got the chips & salsa. Just $1 cause it's half off! The salsa was very thin but it was good. Also I got the queso. Omg it was delicious! Like a corn chowder type. So good. Also I got wings. Boy these where spicy! My nose was runny. They had cucumbers served next to the wings. I also got a taco the steak one and it came with salsa and boy it was delicious. I got corn tortilla. You can get flour tortilla if you want.   This place is small but cute. We sat outside. There's a bar.   My friend got the brussels sprouts nachos. She didn't really like it. Also she got ice cream vanilla flavor & it tasted weird.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Patio

Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak taco

4n0n75V3coGULEdOg1Nwtg.text: OK this is slightly under detailed review but it hits the nail on the head. Brussel sprout nachos -Amazing  coconut rice -Amazing  Plantain Taco -Amazing  Brussel sprout Tacos phenomenal  Fresh cracked coconut water Amazing   Jon the bartender was Amazing! Thanks for the laughs and great service!  I asked for all of my items dairy free since I am vegetarian and lactose intolerant. Vegans and vegetarians you can definitely find something wonderful to eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mah noms

XfE06BWpLV8XElrb1f6WcQ.text: This place was a major let down from the bland food to the dull service and atmosphere. The menu items were over priced and the wait was not worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Xk7Vtwg5AmRhc8UtZcshyg.text: Once Upon a Time I went to a Taco Festival and had the most amazing taco ever while wearing a sombrero and posing for a picture for Instagram, I never forgot that Taco or the name Diego Pops even through a long arduous international move to the Netherlands for 2 years and then back again to Arizona where I finally made it to the restaurant and I must say it was totally worth the wait much better then any Prince Charming's kiss.  I love how the menu is set up and that they suggest the best tortilla for each meat.  My favorite is the the Charred Skirt Steak taco with the Braised Pineapple Pork being a close second. I love that you get a selection of sauces brought to your table so you can customize each taco if you'd like. The coconut rice is also very nice, light and creamy, great way to break up spicy if you ordered spicy.  Chips and Salsa are always a must have!  I can't wait to go back to try some of the cocktails and possibly the soft serve, I'm a sucker for unique soft serve flavors!

qZ_ztpMDCc1ZP9G-c0MTqw.text: Since there was a wait due to the popularity of Diego Pops, we killed some time by ordering a drink at the bar. I really liked the variety of drinks on their drink menu. The "Mexican Mule" caught my attention because I would normally drink a closely tasting incarnation such as either a Kentucky or Moscow Mule. The Mexican Mule has 1800 reposado, muddled cucumber, agave, ginger beer, and their house made sweet and sour. It was pretty good and refreshing, especially on a hot Arizona night.   Speaking of hot Arizona nights, the cute waitresses were noticeably wearing short shorts which is appropriate for the outdoor weather as the restaurant was essentially outdoors with its open patio doors.  My friend recommended that I try some of their tacos and the varying salsas. The variety of tacos reminded me of good taco places in Mexico. I ordered the charred skirt steak, the grilled cod, and the brussels sprouts taco. The steak and the brussels sprouts were pretty good, but the grilled cod wasn't my favorite. It tasted as though someone boiled the cod and forgot to season it. I also gravitated towards the green salsa, one of the many choices of salsas at my table.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Tortilla and banana chips with salsa and guacamole
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. An assortment of tacos including grilled cod, charred skirt steak, and brussels sprout

bF5Slel41t2mjrt4bx_Ehg.text: I stayed at the Hyatt house. The front desk recommended Diego Pops. The recommendation was on point!  The margaritas (spicy) was absolutely the best I had in a long time. Warning the margaritas in Arizona is dangerous and delicious   I had a fish taco and ate that quickly. Really delicious!  Coconut shrimp ceviche was delicious as well.  I will be back!

h5Jl86rbbiXwbdZJe8Gx4g.text: Went in for happy hour with one of my girl friends!! Had their classic marg which is 5$ for happy hour which was so refreshing and delicious during this hot summer!! The server was very friendly & food came out so fast! I had one pineapple pork taco and one shrimp taco!! I loved the pineapple pork combo. It was sweet with the delicious flavor of the pork and the shrimp had peppers and corn!  The shrimp was grilled perfectly and mixed with the corn so well!! You can pick which tortilla you get too and I had flour for both! So yum!! Attached pics of my tacos an my the ones my friend got!! Will definitely be back to try more!

lRWJIStBA6KtQxtVVrBLXw.text: If you are looking for traditional Mexican this is not the place. If you are wanting to try a contemporary version check this okay out. My two corn records were plantains and shirt steak. The crispy slaw blended nicely with the plantains giving a fresh, crunchy taste. Really liked the skirt steak taco. Did not enjoy the green tea. The taste was subtle, more like a flavored water. Loved the new churro dessert with three dipping sauces. Being an out of towner I enjoyed the vibe and people watching. Steve the general manager stopped over when I was leaving. Was interested to hear about my dining experience. Super nice guy.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. New dessert, churro with dipping sauces

X98fIkzTzylIhh_1o7AzRQ.text: Tasty.  Mexican food time, is all the time! couldn't wait for taco Tuesday lol. Best part is when we got there, they actually had taco special on Monday where all tacos are $3.00!   I ordered a beer and my partner order a very tasty guava coconut cocktail that came in an actual coconut! Great suggestion from the waitress btw.  We ordered the aguachile shrimp ceviche and a few of the different taco options (shrimp,skirt steaks and cod) which were really good...just seemed to lack that "oomf"   Overall the place had a great environment and the staff was more then helpful and friendly. Could see myself coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

91fS6WeV0XI9U8HDCrw8Hg.text: I ate at a ton of restaurants during my long weekend in Scottsdale, but am scrambling to review Diego Pops first because of how amazing it was!!  I could keep this review short and sweet and really just say: Brussels sprouts nachos. Yup, Brussels Sprouts nachos exist and you can find them at Diego pops. The nachos are smothered in a creamy cheese sauce and topped with corn, lots of fresh Brussels, pickled onions and peppers, beet crema and a fried egg. By far the best nachos I've ever had. Is it weird to travel cross country again for nachos? I'd do it. Don't judge me.   The portion is pretty large. Two of us split and we honestly could have called it quits after. But there were also tacos to be had. They offer single tacos for 4-5 dollars, and they aren't too large. It's the perfect addition to a meal if you want to try just one. I went with the carne asada taco which had juicy steak and was topped with cabbage and pico. There is a caddy of 6 dipping sauces at each table, and the avocado ranch was absolute perfection on the taco.  Service was stellar, cocktails were strong and refreshing and the patio seating was plentiful. If you can't get a patio seat do not be upset. The interior is chic and trendy. Think pineapple wall paper, neon signage and lots of hanging string lights + plants. You could take a new profile picture here.   Pro-tip: check in on Yelp for a 5 dollar taco + beer combo. Most tacos are 5 anyway, so this basically means a free beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Mojito and margarita
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussels sprouts nachos
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak taco

6nrXcgH2Ou5E_XHJWSj1bQ.text: Yikes... save yourself your time and your money. This place is sloppy and the food is awful. Our waitress was slow and when we ordered the chips and gauc there was an old piece of avocado mixed into the mess of plantains and chips. The tacos came out 2 mins after we ordered them which I would normally be thrilled about.. but it showed in the presentation and ultimately the taste.   The shrimp taco was basically just that, shrimp and a spoonful of what they call "corn salsa" which is pretty much sweet white corn out of a tin-can. The machaca beef taco came out with one chunk of beef that I shredded myself with my fork(annoying) and that corn mess again.   This all might be excusable if this meal had been cheap- It is not. Would never return.. this place has a lot of work to do.

mRtX-61aLlLnGfHyxt2i7Q.text: First timer, super disappointed. Got a great recommendation from a coworker to come check this place out to celebrate my best friends 21st. Food is awesome don't get me wrong, but first impressions coming into the door were very upsetting. I came in wanting to get a table for a party of 5 being the first to arrive, and the host said I couldn't sit down until the rest of my party arrived. Not sure if it had to do with the fact that they don't take reservations or not...  Our server is why I'm writing this review. I told her it was a birthday celebration. She didn't smile very much and kind of had a attitude, felt like we were being rushed to eat our meal and finish our drinks. Dropped the check without asking if we want split checks or not while we weren't half way finished with our drinks. Like I said, come here if you want a awesome meal, but the service is hit or miss apparently.

c5Iz6biMvHNlDuaCZ4--Bw.text: The only place to go for Taco Monday! Amazing food!

0yBK_xGbMxE7I7Df2TTJbQ.text: I've been many times. The tacos are great. The street corn (have it cut off the husk) is to die for!! I've had alot of great bartenders. Not tonight. I dont know if it was the coke or the meth.. but she sucked...I dont know how she is keeping her job. We were completely ignored when we sat at the bar. ( a man and woman couple). At one point I said 'excuse me'..she glanced back and went to the other side of the bar to help other people. They had drinks. We hadn't even got served anything.  I'll come back.. but not have her serve me. The bar is generally understaffed...then when u cant get served it's even worse!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QGR-HcmfGJaAJXoajnobxA.text: Diego Pops is the bees knees! Went for the daily happy hour and treated myself to a couple appateasers. Let me tell you what they got this Mexican street corn, that on its own is a banger.. but hold up now! They've gone and crushed up RED HOT CHEETOS and sprinkled them on top of these bad boys. 5/5 Must grab. Ask for Sierra, super sweet and on point with the recommendations.

BaJEPpbANDsThL09Iiw4sQ.text: this is the best place to get tacos! The atmosphere is great and the service is even better! my waitress kaylie was awesome and she had a great attitude! Me and my daughter come in all the time and now we won't sit anywhere besides kaylies section :)

ZVM9PRIEHCFZIYmnc7d52g.text: I never like to give a low star review, but my experience at Diego Pops was pretty worthy of it. I came late, around 9:30 on a weekend night, and sat down with a friend who was already there. I didn't even see our waitress for fifteen minutes, but luckily the manager came by to drop off my friends drink and took my order. I also had to order my food with the drink runner because the waitress was MIA. But that's not what annoyed me, what really got me was that after we got our food, our waitress came literally every 5 to 10 minutes asking "you ladies doing alright?". Yes, yes we are. Just like we were 5 minutes ago. She came about ten times in a 45 minute period, and it made me mad honestly. I am having a conversation with my friend and am constantly being interrupted by this girl. It was rude and it made us feel rushed, even though the restaurant wasn't full and plenty of people had come in after us to eat so it's not like we were the last ones. I will say the only reason that I didn't give this place one stars was because I thought the manager (female, brunette) was being attentive and involved just the right amount with all the tables. The food was mediocre, the Brussel sprout nachos were good but the guac had way, way too much lime in it, it was inedible. Good luck diego pops, but I won't be back.

lH9XHkw4sqTKxX0seKfejg.text: We ordered the Brussels sprout nachos, several tacos, chips and salsa (spicy!) and some margaritas. Everything was amazing and a great deal during Taco Monday/happy hour. The atmosphere is very laid back and fun with an awesome patio. I don't usually write many reviews, but we haven't even left this place and I had to hop on here. Our waiter is probably the best we've ever had-he is very attentive, helpful, and friendly without being overbearing. Beyond impressed with the service we received tonight. Ask for Steve next time you are here!

g8fbAYHBrQnJRUtx1r7jcg.text: Fantastic, fresh tacos. The brussels sprout nachos are a must! Highly recommend the shrimp and pork tacos as well. If we weren't so stuffed, we'd have gotten some dessert.

lVApLX98BM0Xx39roGVrHg.text: If you haven't checked this place out yet, you DEFINITELY NEED TO! This is by far one of my favorite restaurants in Old Town. Not only is the food amazing, but Cory and his staff are awesome. They are always friendly and professional and make you feel right at home. I recommend trying any of their tacos, they are all delicious! My favorites are the skirt steak and the salmon.

NqDavBEkzsYAazR1aELK0w.text: the tacos were good. house marg was ok as to be expected. mint lime marg was amazing. over all the service was good. but i feel bad for the employees here the dark long hair manager behind the bar is super awful to her bartenders and bar backs

I5vRWidJT1mAHgaWB2Rdvg.text: [Never finished this review from Feb, so here goes] Oh dear... This place needs help.  A group of 14 hungry girls came here for dinner last Feb.  We were so excited for all things Mexican and this is (honestly) a very cute restaurant in a great location.  We sat down and immediately tried to order pitchers of margaritas and guacamole (duh!).  The waiter decided that this might be a good time to inform us that they were out of guacamole.  Strike one.  He also informed us that they were out of flour tortillas - how is that even possible?? Strike two.  After blank stares and conversation among our group we decided that we could salvage our Mexican night with queso and brussel sprout nachos.  5 minutes later the waiter came back (noticeably without our margaritas) and we asked for several orders of the above mentioned cheesy deliciousness.  He then told us that they ran out of cheese, so both the nachos and queso were not in our future.  This may be a good time to mention that the menu here is pretty limited (tacos, ceviche, avocado-y greatness and cheesy items), so this was very upsetting news.  Our waiter didn't seemed too fazed with the fact that they had run out of 90% of the menu, which maybe means it happens often (unclear)? After some back and forth with our waiter friend, we landed at the following: four pitchers of margaritas (but... surprise, they were out of some of them) and vouchers for free tacos to use at a later date and time (unfortunately, 13 of the 14 were visiting from out of town and had no plans to return...).  All in all, our dining experience here was not filling (literally), but the restaurant has a cool vibe, so perhaps they have been able to figure out that they need to actually have food to serve.

wQ02eSZuHclKUtei0DSDYQ.text: Best nachos we've ever had! Amazing service, food, drinks, atmosphere, and cant beat prices! Steve was the best! If youre looking for a place to eat & get a good drink in Scottsdale, this is a must.

rKmPcyfo6saRuy5YkRibzQ.text: Been here a few times and they never disappoint. Tried the sweet corn and avocado Caesar salad with shrimp this time and it was delicious. We sat up at the bar with a street view and had exceptional service from Steve the bartender.  I definitely recommend coming here for lunch or late night just before heading out to the bars in downtown.

HgE5A3Mf-ykbXvlQiTWAhg.text: This was my first time here, and I'm planning to come back again tomorrow! Everything I tried was delicious. They have about 6 different sauces you can add to your tacos, but the tacos are so flavorful that I didn't need any sauces. I think the steak taco is the best. It was tender and they put avocado in it. Yum! The green chili chicken and adobo chicken were also wonderful. I asked the very friendly bartender if I should get corn or flour tortillas, and she suggested the flour. I'm so glad I listened. They were the best flour tortillas I've had. Chips and salsa were amazing too! I can't wait to come back here and try their other stuff.

RfkER-2bN-_4OF0aQmHNag.text: Brussels sprout nachos were really good.  Margaritas were decent.  There were 3 of us for dinner and we each had a different rice bowl and all agreed, they were just ok. Really thought they could of had more flavor.  They forgot to bring the little tray of sauces.  Once we had that and tried some, that helped to add flavor. I would go back again for happy hour. Nice patio.

gtOhA-o3FQTlQbr0ONB-zg.text: Great staff, always friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. A go-to spot for tacos and nachos in old town Scottsdale!

otBEwGBSaLJT8Mgkd0PDjA.text: Ashlyn is a great server. The food is life changing from the guac to the margs. You won't regret eating here.

91h02e6SfMVerun_WKAE4A.text: Loved this place, amazing atmosphere, great food. Perfect girls night out place in Old Town. Stephen was such a great server (stephen sparks? :-)) !

k45b5xhz7IFAicbZM73wBA.text: This spot was recommended to us by one of the ubiquitous golf cart drivers (she was young and cool...we were once cool too..but I digress). We sat at the bar and each had a margarita with housemade guac and salsa. Very nice the restaurant played great music, and it was nice to relax in the patio area with our drinks.

cQL6BSwqPZlNgaFE4gwP2Q.text: Steve was awesome! Super personable and attentive to our table. The service and the food were both on point, and I'd definitely recommend the guacamole to anyone (watch out if you're in a group, or it'll be gone before you know it)!

br92g02Re6lhq-XIK4D6zQ.text: Amazing tacos. Get 5 and especially try the green chili chicken! Alec gave incredible service. Cool dude. Definitely coming back. Sooooo good.

cpNBfkFUcN9JMmdopr3jbA.text: Love this restaurant! Chill vibe, bright colors, and great food. Go for the all day happy hour on Sunday! Received great service our first time, second time we had to ask the waiter for chips 4 times and waited a ridiculously long time for our food and it wasn't busy, but maybe he was just having an off day. Still loved the tacos and the diego margarita is great. Will be back!

MwT07tTR8ViD4DevI4DAMw.text: Been to Diego Pops a handful of times when it first opened, always had a great experience. Loved the food and the decor. But like every other place in Old Town the quality of the food and service falls off. Our waitress got every single one of our orders wrong, forget two of our orders, the sangria was bland and warm, we had charged skirt steak bowl and plate, both weren't really edible. The meat was overcooked and dry, the brown rice was burnt and hard. Our other friend ordered the green chili chicken plate, he barely had two bites. The tuna poke was lacking tuna, think about a bowl of poorly prepared stale coconut rice and some greens, with the tuna playing hide and seek. The waitress told us they only had hot sauce available, which is False having dined there before I knew for a fact there is a bunch of homemade sauces, but towards the end of our meal she showed up with all the sauces. An overall terrible experience for all of for of us and a waste of $150. Maybe the waitresses should write down orders so they don't have to be reminded everyone is missing something and from the taste of the food they either need a new chef or someone who can cook for humans because my dogs wouldn't eat what was served to us. Thank god for AMEX, a simple call to them will make this dining experience disappear cost wise. Taco Bell is a 5 star restaurant versus this place, service and food quality wise.

XjTw6SX9_XJmuSpZW5ekpw.text: Love Diego Pops!!  The atmosphere, food and service were all fantastic! Our whole family enjoyed dinner here.

qBPAeiNskGONmQHSQLsXqA.text: I'm really happy that Diego Pops opened recently. I live in the area and have been looking for a Mexican restaurant that is nicer than fast food drive-thrus, but not as upscale as The Mission. Diego Pops is in a great location in Old Town and I'm really impressed with the way they've designed the restaurant. The decor is fresh and fun - everything is colorful and the place feels tropical. Parking out front is very limited, so save yourself the trouble of their tiny lot and go park behind the building.   The food deserves five stars, without a doubt. I usually order two or three tacos depending how hungry I am, and whether or not we get guacamole. (Order the guac!) They serve you chips and salsa, which aren't terrible but nothing spectacular. I like that they give you a basket with a variety of sauces (chipotle, avocado puree, salsa verde, spicy red salsa, and others), but everytime I've gone the bottles have been low. How often are they refilled... and are the sauces fresh?  My favorite tacos are the steak, pineapple pork, and grilled shrimp. Go with the recommended tortilla on each one. Maybe order two pineapple pork tacos, because they really are delicious! Sometimes I'll get fried plantains as dessert. If you've never tried them, I would suggest ordering them next time you go!  The only downside to this restaurant is the service. I've been five or six times in the last few months and some days are worse than others. The staff is nice but not very attentive... sometimes I will literally have to flag someone down to get a water refill, a napkin, or even silverware! It's frustrating because all of those things are components of good, even mediocre, restaurant service. I hope the management decides to put more emphasis on good service - it's really the only thing lacking from a great restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Prickly pear marg! Delicious and I just loooove the color!
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Say YES to tacos!!!!

dv2YV_1SuFYcPsKe8wkj-w.text: I always go back to this place and always take friends and dates here! So consistent with their food. Beef machaca tacos and chicken green chili are bomb! They will also recommend a soft or crunchy shell depending on which one you order.   Drink wise: margarita one with muddled jalapenos was fantastic. Also the coconut guava drink comes in a coconut! So delicious.   Ask for Anthony the waiter. He's so sweet and charming, I asked my date if we could take him with us lol

LMX3oz4gQhBIPgZPTnl7Mg.text: Amazing tacos! Pineapple Pork is amazing! Atmosphere is vibrant! Great staff. Being from out of town they are helpful looking for things to do.

jfqXe2bUufuyihUmlI59eA.text: We came in for happy hour today (3-6pm) and appetizers were half off.    We ordered the Brussels sprouts nachos with steak and street corn queso and both were so good.   What I liked most about here is that they have a rack of different sauces and it's amazing -- I mixed the garlic beet crema, salsa verse and Serrano ranch and eat it with my chips or with my tacos!   Love the vibe, the way it's decorated -- just everything about it makes me feel like I'm in Miami by the beach!

Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the garlic beet crema, Serrano ranch and salsa verde together!!! Amazing!

kox_84EgxmUVY3RT84CZUg.text: Went to Diego Pops for happy hour. Really good offering for food and drinks, there was even free tasting for 1800 Tequila Food: was good, it was tasty, but the portions are small Facility: Very nice outdoor seating, it was midMay and parking is plenty Service: was very attentive Overall: very good experience

_3z8IZ6PBxt7Nn--0B3NLA.text: Came in on a Monday night with my boyfriend because they do $3 tacos on Monday's rather than Tuesdays like most places (awesome). We were seated right away at a table on the patio. Our server was quick and helpful through the whole dining experience. We each got an assortment of tacos, a house margarita, and the corn and queso dip - everything was amazing!! Hey even bring a container of 7 different sauces for you to put on everything. We'll be back soon!!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. So many sauces!

d31_xFlJ2OeW-tqivC7RRw.text: Always great food!  Love the ambiance too!  I like that you can select a few different tacos and have a sampler.  Full bar with excellent margaritas.  Also the option of a Mexican Coke in a bottle!

SEMqi2krVVlhFFUyHJaxwA.text: This place is super cool. We had a large group with children and opted for the couch tables indoors. It's a great set up and the staff was wonderfully accommodating for our kiddos. We shared a pitcher of the Diego margarita which was a great deal. The Brussel sprout nachos are a must do for any future visits. Delicious! And I enjoyed the watermelon salad although I found that I couldn't make a dent after all the tasty appetizers - I saved the rest for the next day. My only complaint might be that the fun selection of sauces at our table were all very bland. I'll come back every trip to Scottsdale for sure!

yw_fM7TccrbxclgYaIifjQ.text: Love love love this place! Great atmosphere and their brussel sprout nachos are to die for!! Sooo good!!

1Os5SD5B7IZMAZs88wvunA.text: Didn't eat here but the  guava coconut drink is amazing.  It comes in an actual coconut and you can scrape it off the sides. If your coconut is on the small size they give you the rest in a side cart!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Eh-DIvQK9cB6Pcq2nAEp-g.text: This is the perfect spot for a happy hour or casual dinner with friends! The outdoor area was cute, the happy hour deals were great and the Brussels sprout nachos were to DIE for! Such a unique and healthy spin on the classic appetizer--I highly recommend even the biggest skeptics to just give it a try!

QpxTGtDukl2GouqllSZRPg.text: I love Diego Pops; it's one of my favorite places in Old Town but I was sadly disappointed with my last visit. We ordered the habanero mango wings, excited for the spice and flavor (like the foodies we are) but was so painfully disappointed when the wings had little to no flavor and absolutely ZERO habanero or mango. The wings were good from a standpoint of meaty and juicy but they had absolutely no flavor. Obviously, we eat there for the tacos but I was expecting this to be a good speciality from Diego Pops but felt I could have received the same wings from Zips.

eZXRmmFvQdvNyFn-3maJ1A.text: It's a good thing Diego Pops isn't in my hometown. If it was, I'd be there every day stuffing my face with tacos and margaritas, and I'd be 20 pounds heavier.  I came here for lunch on a recent business trip to Scottsdale. It came highly recommended by locals and Yelpers alike. After sitting down in their sunny, inviting patio, I could immediately see why. This place looks like an all-day fiesta. Hoppin' bar; friendly servers; cold beers; fresh guacamole; young, attractive patrons. Who could ask for anything more?!  Our table feasted on their famous Brussels Sprouts nachos; Street Corn Queso; and guacamole and chips. For our entree, you can choose from a variety of tacos featuring fresh ingredients and meat/chicken/fish hot off the grill. This place ain't no Taco Bell. It's the real deal. I wound up ordering the Braised Green Chili Chicken Taco which comes with crema, cotija, house slaw on a crispy corn tortilla. I could've eaten 10 of them!  BTW, if you check in on Yelp you can take advantage of a $5 taco/beer special.   If you're in the Scottsdale area, I'd highly recommend this spot for an outdoor lunch or happy hour!

UJLjwnGga9zItrrRrAK1og.text: I enjoyed the atmosphere at Diego Pops more than I enjoyed my lackluster corn & avocado salad for lunch. But that sunny, vacation-like ambiance truly did make up for everything. It's like a hipster beach hut in the middle of Scottsdale - so chill  and festive with neon colors and desert plants. I wish this were my backyard.   So, now that you know how cool the vibe is, be careful with your food order. Salads over-promised and under-delivered. But the tacos looked solid, and the ice tea options were exotic. Those "famous" brussel sprout nachos though? Also False advertisement. They were basically normal nachos with a few brussel sprout leaves sprinkled on top. Not very exciting.   They do have a sweet Yelp check-in offer: $5 for a taco & a beer. And service was fabulous, fast & friendly. Order wisely and you'll have a lovely time at Diego Pops.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dranks in the sun
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel sprout nachos - really just nachos with some brussel leaves on them. Womp Womp.
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Corn &amp; avocado salad with salmon added. Not nearly as exciting as the description - where&#39;s the corn, guys?

cAK5BT7MmMyARKy61rtAnA.text: extremely loud. small and bad shrimp and steak tacos, bad margaritas. mediocre service- had to ask for cutlery and napkins after receiving our food. will not be going back.

GOZFpG4eT0DbqtWE867GsQ.text: I liked the funky modern atmosphere.  I sat outside, it was humid without misters but wasn't too bad. Only negative was the lighting - there wasn't enough. Other than that the patio was legit.  Service was good. Food was even better. Taco Monday?! Who knew this was a thing. Diego Pops originators of the taco Monday kick though! We ordered 1 of each their 7 tacos featured (plenty more to select from) these were the $2 or $3 deal. Favorite was the cod, salmon, green chili chicken.   They have a killer selection of sauces/salsas they bring out too which only adds to your dish! Chips and salsa were on point, salsa was chunky and had a good kick.  Best part... CHOCO TACO!  definitely a spot to go check out.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the artistic/contemporary take on the last supper.
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fun entrance, music, nice open patio. First time hear looking forward to #tacomonday

eTxOBBaGonEfV2WHza7iaw.text: When it comes to Mexican food I can be somewhat of a brat after having spent 10 years in the desert, close to the border. It's hard when you walk into Mexican restaurants in Old Town Scottsdale because immediately you think you're going to get some "touristy" food and experience. Let's just say I was somewhat surprised when Diego Pops exceeded my expectations.   The actual "space"of the place is amazing. A huge patio with plenty of Arizona sun, and a bar stocked full of great tequila. Well done. Our server was a super nice guy (probably an ASU student), and gave us great recommendations on the tacos. I ended up ordering the braised chicken, steak and pork (one of each) and I was very impressed. The best part...the tortilla. It was a flour tortilla done proper, so big ups.   The check in offer was a taco and a beer for $5, so I naturally ordered that and tacked on the other two tacos. What a great deal, so don't skip on the check in. The others I dined with that day said the salad was a little bland but, fine none the less. Moral of the story, get the tacos.

QOFiuF4_Jg3-OGI5gcCsKA.text: Great Sunday Funday! Happy hour all day. Half off all appetizers as well as drink specials. Food was very good! Awesome red sangria, chips were crispy, guacamole was seasoned well, coconut ceviche was refreshing, etc etc. I will be back here for sure! Delish!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Hanging with the most interesting man in the world!
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Great indoor outdoor bar seating.

VDK7WNFHWeeX4Pk5O-yx5g.text: Honestly the food sucks. I'm full Mexican and the only good thing I ordered was the chips and salsa. The margarita was good and the service was awesome but truly the food wow I can't believe how disappointed I was. Brown or coconut rice? Why is red rice not an option. This is totally white washed "Mexican" street tacos. I was so disappointed for the beans and rice coming in one ounce plastic containers. Not even street tacos on the food trucks do that. Won't come back. Total rip off. The bartender was killing it though! She rocked but my food totally sucked. 4 dollars for a vegetarian taco of "plantain" but just contained beans, corn, gross onion and cabbage. The food had no flavor and the taco was bland and not worth $4. I would rather hit up the dollar store and buy a can of beans for a dollar lol. Sad to say but so True. Disappointed in the food because it looked so poppin at this place. I had even pulled over. This isn't what real tacos are. Just get a drink and be about your day. This place sucks I won't come back. The servers looked unhappy and when the guy dropped off my food he looked annoyed when I said thank you I appreciate you. I had to ask for a straw after 15 mins of tryin to get anyone's attention. That's uncalled for. Don't be cheap or try to save the animals. If you wanna Save the animals than just do not consume animal product. Real animal lovers don't eat animals, period. Just give the damn straws out. It's Scottsdale why would you not give straws to the people automatically. The recipes are horrible. I've never been so disappointed in a taco. I went to La Fonda on Shea Blvd and had a way better food and experience. I just like can't believe how much the food sucked. My mind is blown at how terrible it was. I hardly ate or finished it cause it sucked so bad. Not made with love at all. You can taste it: everyone there hates their job. You can see it. I've been in the restaurant industry for 10 years. I would know. This was a very disappointing place to eat. The food sucked so bad I wish I could give this zero reviews. The bartender was very sweet though. She was very busy and slaying the bartender game. She deserves a better place to work.

SN9VrKbtWxdNwwUkkTlibQ.text: Tacos were delicious! I got the skirt steak and they were so good. Place is super cute ... every spot is "Instagram Worthy" lol, but seriously! Service was great! Can't wait to go back!

5qq8XPfOvl71MvwBNTB0yA.text: This is the place to go if you want great Mexican food that isn't like all the rest with an atmosphere that keeps you coming back.  From the moment you walk in you want to stay and not just for the amazing drinks and food but the open eating area, cool decor and friendly staff.  This is one place where you certainly can't go wrong with endless, tasty options on the menu that will appeal to everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Iz9pxFs2U6uj3IM-Og8PSA.text: Food was great. Service leaves a little to be desired. The ambiance is great, super cute. :)

n9bsye1ABUYtKfT-bIbC6g.text: Hey Diego Pops!!! I noticed y'all use paper straws for your snowcone margaritas  - do the planet a favor and make an effort to minimize your waste by switching all your plastic products to paper

iwSyzODA0PykOmIT2wezqw.text: The only good thing about this place is the tacos. Service is slow, but good, when you get it. The inside is hot and stuffy; I get arizona is hot but there should be ac inside. I think it was just one part of the restaurant. The queso was terrible and cold. Tacos, Sonoran dog, amazing. I think this would have been better had it not been sweltering inside.

QQ6kqI7Rn8d4GrRi5llhRA.text: Super disappointed. Went here for lunch and the food was terrible. The tacos were cold, not even room temperature let alone warm. The shrimp was super fishy. The corn on the tacos was clearly canned corn and watery. The tortillas were either warm at one point or just stale because they were cold and unappetizingly crusty. It was as if the tacos were pre-made and left to sit out until they were ordered. What is going on here? The atmosphere was nice and the service was average, nothing to write home about that's for sure. If you want some real tacos that are warm, FRESH, and delicious with a great atmosphere and excellent service, I suggest Barrio Queen or my personal favorite, Crujiente.

gNfpQG_6vDCvcs9NJGX4-g.text: Meh. They were out of most dishes (on a Saturday night) that were interesting, even some of the drinks we ordered were unavailable.

xVOrpl7OBJ7qBysYd54XFg.text: The food was absolutely delicious and the drinks are strong! Jon the bartender took care of me very well.

aegEJh-o9DzbTup_BW0q2g.text: Checked this place out with a friend of mind after all the hype our friends had about this place.  Service was average at best. Our table didn't have any utensils and our waitress rarely checked on us so we had to get up and take utensils from another table. We saw our waitress 3 times while we were there for an hour so we'd be sitting forever to ask for something.  Our mango habanero wings came out with NO sauce on it, they were just fried wings. And the dressing that was supposed to come with it didn't. The waitress brought the food back but it still wasn't great and we were still charged for their mistake.  The tacos were average, I've definitely had better in old town. The shrim Taco was the only one I liked. However the Mexican mule was a highlight in a rather dismal putting where there was poor service and , below average food.

WwniVQeIAiTgE-3186-3nA.text: Great atmosphere and happy hour prices. They were very generous with the tequila in their house margarita- so good. Definitely a HH worth checking out if in Scottsdale. Also great thing, they had parking in front of the restaurant so you don't need to park on the street.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel Sprouts Nacho was so good. They also have the street corn queso drizzled all over and some deliciousness.
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The street corn queso is a must try.

m0PtPj1KKRCC7aQLApSVrA.text: Really cool place with a really nice vibe. Their guacamole was solid and their corn dish was good but the tacos were underwhelming and that's why it's only three stars. Nice selection of hot sauces.

SdClAJ43IlTXQxCXl_3Tmg.text: I was expecting average Mexican but was blown away. This is taco shop prices with foodie approval worthy combos. The brussel sprout nachos were a surprising burst of flavor with the pickled onion and egg on top. I will be dreaming about them for days.  Our table tried each of the tacos and were pleased with the flavor and tenderness of the meat. The chicken tortilla soup didn't disappoint the heaping serving had large chunks of chicken and freshly cubed avocado. My husband the finicky eater ordered the Sonoran Hot Dog. It was high beef hot dog wrapped in Texas toast and he loved every bite of it. The mango habanero wings were also a win.  Save your money and don't get the beans and rice they were lack luster and a bit bland. Our only complaint was our server was a bit slow on drinks and we had to keep getting up to order more. As a tequila snob I was pleased with the house margarita but wanted a kick so the bartender added fresh jalapenos.   I hope to make it back when we come to town for their happy hour. This place is great!

CMTbIgzO1pYAfrs14mYwZQ.text: Great atmosphere for margaritas! I enjoyed the outdoor seating and the overall vibe here. It was a bit empty on a Wednesday night but I'm sure it's more exciting during happy hour or on the weekends. The parking in the front was very convenient.  I really liked the Fresh One Margarita and thought it was made with a decent amount of tequila. I wasn't highly impressed by the food to want to come back for a second round. I shared the Brussels sprouts nachos along with chips & guac with my friend and had the salmon taco and steak taco to myself.   I would recommend trying this place just because it's a nice spot to chill and have drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fresh One Margarita with Diego Margarita in the back

k7Yim90cgdJ-blh_3THZcQ.text: Visiting from Michigan, we popped in for our last night in AZ!  Amazing margaritas, brussel sprout nachos (!), margaritas, shrimp tacos and... margaritas....!  AND what service!  I left some personal items which I didn't have time to go back and get before I headed back home.  I contacted them when I got back and they found my stuff AND offered to send it back!!!!  And they DID!!!  Thanks so much guys!  A+++++++

9iRUSeHdjyzGnOmXPWdY_Q.text: Best nachos in town. The Brussels sprouts on top really ice it something extra!! Love that they give you a holder with 6 sauces to put on whatever you order also. Used to be all day hh on Sunday but that sadly changed

Eb-H_LASm2r0OsdyaiPrxA.text: The combinations of flavor in every plate is finger licking good!!! The Brussels spout nachos are unreal and a MUST GET! The plantain tacos for all the people wanting something without meat and maybe lighter, is full of flavor and amazing textures! The poke bowls, burritos, and corn are big hits and everyone always raves about what they got here! Amazingly trendy place with good atmosphere and great location in old town!

o-lFdi4903dEb3zSfgNQVQ.text: Love this place! Best Brussel sprout nachos going!happy hour is a great deal from 3:00 to 6:00!

_jCZSJdjE_K7zFF9se3leg.text: Been here twice now for happy hour, and the deals are great! Appreciate that there's happy hour every day, and not just a few days a week. Great food, nice aesthetic, and good service. Cory, the GM, even chatted with us and went above and beyond taking pictures for us! Can't recommend this place enough!

TzucTA8wKn-xaDegsXH86w.text: Travelled about 3 hours and Yelped Mexican food places, this one came up with great reviews.  It was decent, can't say I would come back though.

mBA97a-iynHdqN29OoajFQ.text: Simple taco and burrito joint with pretty good drinks as well. Guacamole was great but more so all the taco choices were very tasty. Stopped in for lunch and was in and out in about 30 minutes. Would recommend and will be back when I'm in the area

Afxp4N5BtnYCUMa_Y5N84w.text: Went there last night with my girlfriend. Aesthetic was charming, service decent, and the food *tasted* great. We both ordered the house burrito.  I'm now writing this review the next day from one of our bathrooms as my girlfriend is occupying the other one. Both of us with upset stomachs since waking up this morning and aggressive diarrhea. We're both pretty positive that the chicken in the burritos must have not been properly cooked.  Thanks for the food poisoning Diego Pops!

CUTetEGAdr711kwae8FiVg.text: Went here for happy hour and had a great time! Half-priced apps at this time, so we got chips and salsa (for a buck!) and Brussels sprout nachos. I also got a plantain taco. The food matches the awesome atmosphere--colorful, fun and flamboyant! The Brussels sprout nachos were the best nachos I've ever tasted, and absolutely beautiful!   I wasn't impressed with the white sangria, but other than that, I have nothing negative to say! The waitstaff was great and there's a kitschy Choco Taco stand by the bar. What more could a girl want!   Great spot for all occasions, kids welcome!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The revered Brussel Sprout Nacho platter

-A6AYvc3wzYJOySerHEZSw.text: Excellent food and excellent service! Get there for Happy Hour if you can as it's half off appetisers. Corn queso was a big hit as were the chips and salsa. Tacos and bowls were delish!

IEaunHXh65BXncQyr5jOKw.text: Loved the food and drinks were super good! The only thing is that it was overly busy and the service could've been a little better.

pbyZvt1YxWZkCUFCSUmBoQ.text: I love Diego Pops! I went there yesterday for lunch with friends. I probably go here at least once or twice a month.  We ordered the Brussels Sprouts nachos to start and we each ordered several tacos. The nachos are amazing and probably the most unique nachos I've ever had. There's delicious cheese, pickled veggies, Brussels sprouts (obviously), and even a fried egg!   We each ordered a chicken taco, a beef, and a plantain. All three were delicious, but the plantain is my favorite. I also really like to get the plantain taco bowl!    My friends also like to order their Sonoran hotdog. I've never had it, but it looks delicious and I want to try it.   Be sure to order a margarita while you're there! They have an amazing happy hour

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

QjR0WFdLj4ookNSmVkZWzA.text: Great food and great drinks! I was sitting at the bar, and there was a young lady that was being trained. The manager was very rude to the trainee in front of customers. She said " don't make drinks today" across the bar, which I believe is something that she can say in private. She seemed to have an attitude with the trainee. Again, the food was excellent and so were the drinks. All staff was very professional and did an outstanding job.   I had the shirt steak tacos and the Diego margaritas which were amazing. I recommend eating and drinking here. The way the manager spoke to the trainee doesn't sit well with me, especially with me owning a business myself.

BdtNE1jjdafE8aG06vlF1w.text: Mango habanero wings were terrible.. gross texture like they were covered in wet, tasteless baby food. Queso was more like soupy cottage cheese and salsa had no flavor. Steak bowl was fine, with lots of help from the sauces on the table. Wouldn't return.

RYC4aH-dDzUB9gXTVW9zkw.text: Nice drinks, nice patio....below average food. Poke bowl had very little Tuna. Queso and chips was odd flavor cheese and the steak tacos were weak.  Serving the rice and beans in plastic cups was poor presentation and the rice was dry and clumped.

XMleYjzVr834ucjKgxX8kw.text: The street Corn queso appetizer was phenomenal!! I enjoyed the braised green chili chicken Taco and the beef machaca Taco. The meats were cooked very well, but they needed sauces (given) to add flavor. There was a green sauce that was amazing on both, and the pink sauce (color deceiving) was delicious and garlicky! My boyfriend has the shrimp bowl and also said it was a tad bland, but with added salsa and sauces it was good!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. grilled shrimp bowl
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Braised green chili chicken Taco, beef machaca Taco

JyYIYa6cEdU__vpvJbmtig.text: Walking in this place, I was in love with their decor from the neon signs to the pineapple wall. It is a bit more upscale than I expected. I sat outside at the bar. The menu is innovative with brussel sprouts nachos, which had two kinds of cheeses. The nachos had tortilla chips as well but I went back and forth between those and the brussel sprouts for good measure (and health)! They also had a list of amazing tacos, which you can get with handmade flour or corn tortillas.   I liked this place, but honestly, it's the only place (restaurant, bar, brewery) I went to on my weeklong trip to Arizona where I didn't talk to a single person. The people who come here reminded me of the Orange County (California) bunch at home.

Znz4FL9eOV59VbwXrRhGvg.text: Soooo dope. Brittany and Wyatt are the gems of this place. Drinks were good. We didn't eat but the people next to us did and seemed to enjoy it. Brittany makes the best snow-cone margarita in Scottsdale. She is resistant to use her talent because she doesn't want to embarrass the other bartenders but I say order it and let her shine. Wyatt, you're my boy! Thanks for the great service guys. We had fun  - your iowa boys

zJthg4a2gzFBlNbTKsbhOA.text: The rumors are True: the Brussels sprout nachos are to die for! An honorable mention would have to go to the quesadillas with the street corn. The food is so good and the atmosphere is really cute. Definitely a good date spot or a place for a dinner get together!

jf4LgBy_6BG03YDC16TTMA.text: Not sure if its me but the food out here just isn't tasty as the south..  Took my fiance out for dinner here and had the mango habanero wings and I'm going to say these were possibly the worst wings I've ever had.  It was if they were just deep fried with out any seasoning and dipped in some sauce and the chicken still had that raw taste.  The salmon taco and the queso tasted bland, not to mention we found not 1 but 2 hairs in the food.  1st impressions are important in my opinion so we probably won't ever eat here again.

61TgJUxUGu3EKAgwCbONoQ.text: This place reminded me of home (California) the drinks were strong and refreshing. I love the decor. The customer service is good here also. The only thing that I didn't like was the sauce choices they were too Americanized for my taste ........ and lacked flavor. Also they do not have tapitio lol which made me a little upset (personal preference)

Nf1-z0i4y0T2Fn2SyrQ7xw.text: The food tasted so fresh. Great flavors and surprising food pairings. Do not go here if you want authentic Mexican. Good food, fair pricing.

mJwb0zQG91zXcAdnKdYEDQ.text: Worst customer service ever.  They have empty tables that they won't pull up an extra seat to a table  that has plenty of room for it to fit.  Bartenders yell at you to get out of the way. It's policy they say and I guess its policy for bartenders to yell at you also.  We were just looking for a fun place to have a meal.

3g8AHMtclOVFBVLkCIxxRA.text: We stopped by on our way into town after some suggestions to come here from our hotel valet guy! We came mid afternoon and enjoyed a pitcher of house margaritas, a variety of their tacos and the guacamole and chips! We were not disappointed. Our favorite unique thing, however, was the restaurants 6 different sauces to accompany your tacos! Loved how unique and flavorful they made everything! Highly recommend coming here.

IzuhSjiwHc2an9ZBC-K7_A.text: Great spot for dinner! We were seated quickly, a group of three on a Thursday night. Service was a little slow at times, but we didn't mind. Plenty of time to chat and dine. SnoCone Margarita was so fun and they added some jalapeno spice for me!  Poke was fresh and delicious.  So many awesome sauces! Try them all. Lastly, do not forget to save room for dessert.  Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Campfire
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel Sprout Nachos (could use more Brussel sprouts)

WvDRuBBpGhP9JQrVMrMIOw.text: We sat at the bar for dinner and drinks and the bartender was too busy to give us good service. This was my second time there and the first time was great fun and food. This time the avocado ceasar salad was terrible.

B8xdKEgvMn81qWWOZzi1ig.text: This place was rad! Amazing food, delicious drinks, fantastic service and chill fun atmosphere. We were visiting and came here thanks to the yelp reviews and it didn't disappoint! The girls got the coconut guava drink- served in a mini coconut- so cute! The guys got he tequila flight and a pitcher of margs- yum! The guac is top ten favorites for me...and believe me, I know guac! ;) fun pineapple wall paper and modern art covers the walls. Tons of taco options and more, including out of this world Street corn and killer Cali burritos. Patio is really nice looking too- although it was rainy when we were there so we didn't try it yet. We will definitely be back again!

S79Hej9Vz_BRZbbOOBOFxw.text: **Service denial of a federally protected class** On the evening of Saturday, September 16- I brought 3 out of town guests to dine at what used to be my favorite Mexican spot in Scottsdale. I requested a table for 4 outdoors with an extra chair. The hostess told me immediately she was not able to bring me an extra chair. When asked why- she stated this is the "policy" of the restaurant. I asked to speak with a manager. The female "manager" on duty that evening, also in the same robotically trained tone, told me the same thing. You see, 4 months ago I almost lost my leg in a car accident when a man hit me and pinned me between two cars. I cannot sit for extended periods of time without being able to elevate my leg. I am just starting to be able to leave the house and this was a special occasion among friends for me to be able to get out for the evening. This female manager was extremely rude and kept repeating herself they would not "inconvenience" other guests and it was their policy to not allow an extra chair at my table, even though I am disabled and have special handicap passes provided to me by the government. When asked, she clearly stated it was the owner's policy to not allow this extra chair assistance. As you can see from my photographs, during our dinner- there were plenty of tables open from which an extra chair could have been borrowed and utilized until the restaurant was so packed, not one chair could be spared. Our table was in the back and completely out of any space that an extra chair would have been a fire hazard, gotten in any guests way or even a servers path.
