nvlDOuiyEocXRRpglbDbBA.text: The corn quest stuff is amazing!!!!!! Tacos are great too, and they have a awesome happy hour. I would rate the food a 4-  but the service is definitely a 2.

Sy7WjaCLSYLWOh0kN0GhBw.text: One of my fav spots in old town. Love the whole California/ healthy/ Mexican food. Brussel nachos? Amazing. Tortilla soup is one of my favs. Also, the cheese quesadilla with the beet crema (I add jalapenos) is great for dipping in the soup lol I have been here for birthdays, happy hour and just causal dinners. Love the atmosphere here!!

ys-7kHtkSXUFD_L5Z-AKQA.text: Took the family there for the first time and it was happy hour, which included half price appetizers, discounted drinks and $3 tacos all day on Monday. The portion sizes are good for the apps.  I had the Diego margarita which had plenty of alcohol and wasn't too sweet.  The tacos are on the small side but they were all delicious!  The total price was reasonable for all the food we got!  We'll definitely go back!

hBU5CszlTzYFvgATW4zBSg.text: Looove the style in this place! Great food and margaritas! Staff is sometimes very nice and sometimes wishy washy, but never terrible. Great happy hour. Highly recommend the Brussels sprouts nachos!

CrA2Bxc3TcYtgB89hZW05Q.text: Trendy and cute! A Arizona twist to Tacos and food. Not your typical bar. More of a modern feel with a cool atmosphere. Had a tasty girls happy hour. We all kind of order different things on the menu. The venue has indoor and outdoor seating. We chose to sit outside and enjoy the cool spring breeze. Our drinks and food were served in a timely manner. Overall we were all pretty happy.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chips and Salsa

wboMV_WHt6hlfXoR0jdwKw.text: Love Diego's pops!! We always come in when John the bartender is working! He does such a good job checking up on us and making sure that every time we come in, we have a great experience. Will continue to come in because of the friendly staff!

qH-Li0nFpUmbHrSIS_Ghng.text: Steve is by far the best bartender in town. Great house margaritas even during happy hour! Great atmosphere and great food, will definitely be coming back again.

TRQnKy48IaVFQOT9bjuCpg.text: This is my GO TO place. Fun atmosphere, great food & drinks. Such a unique menu I get something new every time. Ask for Michael & Steve at the bar they're the best!! #MondayTacoNight  If you're new get the nachos or pineapple pork tacos.

AHvFNgT4WMcxyG5FvJdelg.text: Great service and decent tacos. This isn't the most amazing southwestern Mexican I've had but it's decent and the decor is super funked out. The crispy cod tacos were good and the margarita was tasty - a bit pricey for the quality

E_-svLLjSV4o8rxunXgNaw.text: I LOVE Taco Monday! This is one of the few Mexican restaurants that can do crunchy tacos so well. The Taco shell is crispy and never greasy. The ice cream is delicious and if you go to Diego pops it is a must have.

8a0R_KId1RLbFWOvqzhHqQ.text: I stopped in with my sister as we are on vacation and we LOVE this place! I highly recommend the mango elderflower margarita and the Oaxacan sunrise. They were both fantastic! We will be back!

ixX0iqi6dfmWqPJhz96k-w.text: We went here during the Phoenix Open, and we're lucky enough to get a table for 9 of us. The restaurant is super cute with neon signs and pineapple wallpaper. The queso is tasty, and the grilled steak tacos were good. I like how they come a la carte so you can try different ones. I wasn't crazy about the service. Don't think I'd necessarily go back, but that's partially because I eat tacos all the time being from Austin. ;)

a7lnKIMs7EGUpJpI_cG2WA.text: Cool place to chill. Staff is nice and food is good.

jITKHmDnanKvSM2QgBTcQA.text: Delish margaritas. Very hospitable staff. Cute decor. Definite must visit in Scottsdale.

U0qyFzKeSuNfskkBXhf5wA.text: We're from out of town and rely on Yelp reviews. This place did not disappoint. Great outdoor patio and amazing food. All day happy hour on Sundays. We did a combination of tacos - the pineapple pork and braised green chili chicken are awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

IsL2xuG6LeCQPJHMJ5xxsQ.text: Food was fantastic. Atmosphere was great. The server Jessica was awesome. I would definitely come back. Hit the place for happy hour and the discounts on the tacos.

UEU8uNoOS9kcYkVQ_gxI3A.text: I came here with a friend not knowing what to expect. It's a quaint little taco restaurant with a lot of personality. The atmosphere is great, and the place is a total bop. The food was fantastic and the staff was so friendly. Our server Jessica was super nice and I'd recommend this place to anyone looking for tacos in Scottsdale.

NboOCQS_eaQmsEMoYkoasQ.text: Visited on a Sunday for the snow cone margaritas. Margaritas were the best of both worlds. Reminds you of your childhood but they are filled with tequila!  The restaurant is absolutely beautiful! Bar was gorgeous and the service was great! Will be coming back!

SjOLc4yta5KVXs0uIXgIzQ.text: Best tacos in Scottsdale!  This place is more laid back than you'd expect for a restaurant in Old Town, but that's why I like it.  Jessica has waited on me twice, and she is fantastic.  Great spot for reasonably priced & delicious food.

JFZzqW7TgGwcIYL-mcZtwA.text: Great Brussel Sprout Nachos and Mediocre Tacos. Love the choco taco! Will return again

f7wKEq2j0WNtFsQRxbJbgQ.text: Sitting at the bar on outdoor patio with a beverage and Brussel sprout nachos seems like a dream.  Simply delicious!

vE2X0Q444XfMjmHLB73OpQ.text: Who would think you could convert a pottery store into a cool restaurant?  Great atmosphere, great service, reasonable prices...great combo, and fun!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

CLvD_-oY5hCZro4fsB7e8Q.text: First stop we made when arriving to AZ and will be back this week. Great food and drinks but most importantly...AMAZING service! Thanks, Ashlyn!

PgFSJdUkzTht8-WcI_NPAw.text: Ordered the guacamole which was basically just chunks of avocado and a sprinkle of cheese. Nothing fantastic about it. Drinks are way overpriced for what you get. The only reason I'm giving it a 3 star rating is because the tacos and burritos were yummy. Highly recommend the beef machaca tacos.

L-LFImlwaAFQhwzsxDpeIg.text: Feeling sad, mad, happy, lonely, excited? Is it your birthday, anniversary, or just a Wednesday THIS IS YOUR SPOT! Best staff and food! Their happy hour kills the game and the margaritas are amazing! Order the brussel sprout nachos, they will blow your mind! #gottahavemypops

hglKY73w0Ad0GKLEgra4Gg.text: Was pleasantly surprised with this little place. I imagine the porch would be really nice during cooler weather also. I had a skirt steak bowl. I was a little weary ordering it because typically when I order steak, it's tough to chew. But this was melt in your mouth pieces and very delicious. The brown rice that was coming with it also caused me hesitation but I turned out loving it! Just really good food. It's a trendy little place.  Order their salsa and chips also. You won't regret it and that's coming from a salsa snob.

slbv-_Cv_UNFvplZsJJYYw.text: Why don't I go here more often!? TBH- I've only ordered the tortilla soup & Brussels sprout nachos but it is all you ever hoped and dreamed of. Tortilla soup has allllll the flavors..creamy avocado, perfect amount of cheese, chicken that Melts in your mouth, and the right broth. I can't even get started on the nachos, just do your table a favor and try them. Also, go wild with their sauces. Simply sauceome!

dEsfP-6cOIysu169aliakg.text: This is one of my fave spots in Scottsdale. The food is easily as good as Mex food in San Diego. The brussel sprout nachos are def something diff to try!  One of the best things about the place is the vibe at the outdoor (shaded) bar. A killer spot to throw back some micheladas and margaritas in the afternoon or pregame before hitting the clubs. Great drinks and staff!  A great late night spot too, open till midnight.

0iXcPA3gJEr20QZaHKuaDg.text: Cool spot, great tacos, and chips/guac were also good. Busy , younger crowd and the menu is basically a bunch of unique tacos along with some appetizer and drink options. Nice addition to Sdale.

Nl4hSJQHQvc0k2rEUet0QA.text: Ok Mexican food for the price. Not the best in Old Town, but good for a group that wants to catch up and enjoy company

Q8w2KBiRZOjIOBUMiBTuwA.text: Gotta love the drink in an actual coconut. Flies plantains are amazing! The ceviche was pretty good too. Didn't have to wait long and we had the best server-Anthony!

qqxF5xFiw3X1JrGA1K8wPA.text: More Taco Monday madness.   Guacamole at $7 was nice and chunky, fairly no frills with just cheese on top Grilled Shrimp Taco - $3 - best taco of the night, loaded with corn and good shrimp The Treat bar - Most of these sundaes are about $5. We tried the Smores which had all the smores ingredients, but the "ice cream" was actually that frozen soft serve stuff. So it seems like your getting a good deal, but it wasn't bad and is a cool ending to your meal.   Patio still nice and even had a good waitress.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Smores at the Treat Bar

p2yTdVnTM8y_OvFoGnG7gA.text: The food was great. If you go in before 6, you get 50% off the appetizers. I got a steak bowl and it was really good. It had rice and beans in it. Jessica was our server and she was on task. If you go to Diego Pops, ask for Jessica. I would Definitely come back to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel sprout nachos
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak bowl with rice &amp; beans

EU42BoCu00UgXRi400LI4Q.text: If I could give this zero stars I would. Our experience Saturday June 16 around 10pm and this was the first and last time I will ever walk into Diego Pops. Upon arriving we sat down at the bar and asked the bartender what they recommended because it was our first time. Acting annoyed that we even asked they said we are known for our Brussels sprouts nachos which we said didn't sound good at the moment. We then said we were feeling something seafood, and again they told us to get the nachos with disgust. Sitting there with no good recommendation we asked the gentleman next to us what he was having, and we asked for the same thing. What we received was not the same thing. When we asked about it the bartender seemed annoyed that we even said anything. To try and ignore this awful experience we got to know the nice guy next to us. After a nice conversation, the fellow offered to buy us drinks. He asked the bartender if she could get us drinks and she proceeded to tell him she refuses to serve him or us. Clearly confused because we had nothing wrong or obscure to prompt that the nice man asked for the manager at the time. Cory the manager then proceeded to yell at the gentleman when he explained the situation, making us feel unsafe and very uncomfortable. After yelling at the nice man for a few minutes Cory then tried to offer us coupons. We refused and said we will never be returning here again. And the icing on the cake was when the bartender tried to keep our change. Absolutely awful experience, terrible service, and the management was just as bad.

jJm7UrznAalMYh6GIqcPRQ.text: As a 20 year resident of Scottsdale, I remember this location being a pottery shop for the longest time.  It's nice to see them redevelop the building into a cozy Mexican restaurant.  The patio and outside bar are good areas to enjoy a meal when the weather is nice.  The prices are reasonable and I enjoyed my skirt steak rice bowl with stewed beans.  The flavors and the different sauces that you can add make for a nice option without the heavy sauces and cheese that come on dishes at most Mexican restaurants.  Overall I enjoyed my experience here and plan to return.

WPWlx7fJFIhh9qRMeBM2rw.text: I can't make this stuff up. You order chicken NO onions and get beef with onions. Something similar to this happens every time. We recently had a great experience here and thought maybe they had made some changes but I think we were wrong. It is so clear every time we go here that the servers do not care at all.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. When you order a chicken bowl NO ONIONS and you get a beef bowl with onions. This always happens here.

e30TbF6yqmFxPfShOBxwuA.text: Craving Mexican food while in Scottsdale I asked the concierge at our hotel for THE BEST (casual) spot in the area; she recommended Diego Pops. Hardly the best I'm sorry to say, but quite disappointed. It was "OK". The brussel sprout nachos were a surprisingly good change of pace for nachos, quite tasty (thank you to our server who recommended them!), watermelon and Paloma margaritas were pretty good (Paloma was the better of the 2), but my bean & cheese burrito was boring (no sauce, just a tortilla filled with refried beans and cheese.... no jalepenos, no sauce, nada, again, OK but I make better at home. The adobo chicken tacos were ok, the pineapple pork ones were better. I read other reviews that stated the staff aren't shy to remind you when it's closing time and this was our case as well. Very polite but basically "Last call at the bar would you like another?" "Yes please!" then as they were set in front of us "We're technically closed right now so no rush but we're closed." It was 5 minutes before the scheduled closing time. I get people are tired and want to leave but..........

In8EAT_jzRjNtGpbIZoSNQ.text: I LOVE the tacos here. The shrimp and pork tacos on a corn tortilla are a must order. Chicken tortilla soup is also delicious and must be tried. Brussel sprout nachos are good but nothing to write home about but the street corn queso is actually pretty delicious.  House margaritas are good and decently strong, but I love any of Diego pop's drinks that come in a coconut. So good!   The environment is really fun but I knocked this review down a star because the bartenders can be a bit strange. I wouldn't reccomend eating at the bar as they brought our entire order out In a Jumbled mix.   Definitely look this place up if you are in town. Good food and a fun environment!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel sprout nachos
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

DnNUVEz8ATVhVQMV6m4taA.text: I went to Diego Pops with my friends for the first time  and my server Anthony was very cheerful and very informative. He told us all about taco Monday and recommended the Guava coconut since we all wanted the prickly pear margaritas. He also gave us a great recommendation about the steak tacos and adding pineapple and jalapenos. It was absolutely amazing. I would highly recommend asking for him to help you out.

K3263IO2zMnVmdr7gb9Gqg.text: This is typically my favorite Mexican place in old town, but I went last night and it was a total mess. It took 15+ minutes to get drinks and my nachos came out cold without any queso on them. Who gives nachos without queso? Paying $30 for a terrible meal is not something I ever want to do again. I would go back for happy hour during the week, but will never again go on a Friday night. They clearly don't know how to handle the rush

VBBd1kq6l5b6dUHrN6xuOA.text: Came back to Diego Pops for happy hour.  Great experience at the bar with Jessica the bartender. And the waitress Katelyn were great. Food is good as always.  Keep it up.

NSGzTQBw8G4Brg1BjoLSgg.text: We came in to Diego pop with a group of 15, they were very accommodating and even asked if we had a time limit. There were no complaints about the food or service. We had a wonderful time in a casual and open environment. It's a great place for groups or even intimate dates. We laughed, we ate and had a great team lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

5CajnKvG8Pg1caYB53B-rA.text: This place is so cute and the prices are very reasonable for downtown Scottsdale. They have a cute interior and I am sure it even better atomsphere at night. If you have choice between chipotle or here come to this hip spot. I came in to place an order and their manager was super nice. He let me go home with one each sauce.  I had their Brussels sprout nachos, shrimp taco and the guac and chips. The best vegetarian nachos ever!! Loaded with perfectly roasted Brussels sprout, corn, melty cheese. Topped with an egg!!! Delicious!! The shrimp taco was loaded with fresh corn salsa and moist shrimp. The best sauces were salsa verde and avocado puree. The were both on the milder side. But the other sauce were just as good, but too hot for my whimpy taste buds. Everything is great except for one down fall, what kind of Mexican restaurant does not have a side order of guac for their tacos and nachos! You guys could easily make money selling a little side of guacamole. So I ordered the guacamole app because this California loves her avocados. The appetizer is a generous portion of guac. Will definitely be back soon and not just for a lunch order to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Patio
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Decor is so cute

zLCAAxc5f3dKP4kYZgYJmg.text: Diego Pops was absolutely delicious! I had the braised green chili chicken and crispy cod tacos. I loved both. Perhaps what put them over the top was the sauces that I could add to them. I also had their award winning guac and chips and salsa. The guac deserved the award. So good! But I also loved the salsa. It had just enough bite to it. We topped the night off with the churro fries. OMG! Seriously eat here!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Topping off the night with churro fries!!!!
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. A little Mexican Mule to start out my experience

jF6GxQARghfPLsc791gYdA.text: Great happy hour for sure. The chicken soup and the tacos are spot on.  The joint has salsas to add as desired.  All good flavors for the different meats.   Service is very nice too.  A little gem right in old town Scottsdale.

m56ZGwfD-NQqjJ3huxdYhw.text: Love the Nachos. Verrrrryyyy different and verrry good. The Watermelon Margarita was excellent as well as the Diego Margarita. Everytime I'm here on business is a must and usually our 1st stop for Happy Hour.   It's in a great location. Walking distance any area hotel.

-iJyeDgxtT0hEDHgOwiEPw.text: I loved this hip and quirky place!   I was in from out of town and my friend recommend we go here. As soon as I pulled up I was drawn in by the pretty white lights. The decor was great, service was quick and friendly and the food was tasty.  My friend had the Brussel sprout nachos and said they were good but that they used to have much more Brussel sprouts in the past. A little disappointing there.   I tried the pineapple pork and shrimp tacos. The pineapple pork was great and I loved the crispy corn tortilla. The shrimp was just ok and I didn't like the recommended tortilla on that one as much.

SzrgZMDJMHZKv_y4YR26nA.text: Came here with a friend for dinner. We enjoyed everything that was brought to the table and loved that there was a happy hour on a Sunday from 3-6. Half priced appetizers and some of their drinks were half priced as well. We tried their chips and salsa and guacamole to start and we ended up trying a bunch of appetizers for dinner. We had the brussel sprout nachos, mango habanero wings and their quesadilla with beet creme on top. We finished the meal with their mini churros and dipping sauces. Everything tasted great. Service was ok.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

xhncurVlbKm5L0oW0eCcHQ.text: Nice spot in the Fashion Square area of Scottsdale. We went during happy hour and there was a good vibe with plenty of people. Appetizers were half off and beers were $1 off and our margaritas came surprisingly back at only $5. The chips and queso is fantastic and has some sweet corn in it that adds to the flavor. The food was very good and the prices were fair, I had the house burrito for $9. The service was great. The place was busy but we were always attended to and the servers cross-covered each other so there was no lack or continuity in service. I would definitely recommend coming here for Mexican food if you're in Scottsdale or the Phoenix area.

9hG4EL8Lm7HtKfgS5o5-yA.text: Fun menu ... owners are friendly. They take pride in their dishes and eccentric menu. Great flavors combinations.

rj6b1zdpCd_lu18u503NwA.text: I love everything about Diego Pops! From the awesome location, beautiful patio. friendly staff and amazing food all for a good price, all I can say is WOW. My better 2/3r'ds and I came here once, and then came again and again...etc, lol. All their tacos are seriously superb. Always cooked properly, large portions for one taco and I have tried several, all have never let me or my BF down. Green chile chicken-awesome, adobo chicken- so moist!, grilled shrimps- lots of shrimp, good char and great flavor and then the show stopper-----Pineapple Pork Tacos!!! So excellent! The pork, the sweet, the slaw, gosh, just whenever you need a happy mood and happy mind....get one. Oh my, paired with all their awesome sauces including a very peculiar beet one that is really good, these tacos will not let you down. Their margs are great and their corn queso also tops it off as a well rounded, stuffed happy meal. Really, Really love this place :)

vYX-FXdoO6I39hlwlHNSmQ.text: Great food the bartender was amazing and very attentive great location the coconut drink was amazing. Highly recommend

yA1-0jqCB6khv4RrZkbGtQ.text: Very delish Brussels sprout and plantain taco. I love the vegetarian options! The staff kinda ignored me when I wanted a drink and I stood there visibly waiting to catch their attention in order to order one drink. The staff only paid attention to those sitting down at the bar. So me and the fam decided to just wait for seats. Then our amazing waiter made up for the trash bar staff. He was very positive and just had a great level of professionalism. The food was good overall.

FTg1cdE9v34DrbKoJZqpdw.text: haven't been to scottsadale in years and this was by far my favorite place out of my entire trip!

zvKBpvWQJdE0dZsArKDjDA.text: We landed in Phoenix for a bachelorette party. We had some time to kill so of course we needed to get the party started. Diego Pops was just the place. The food was delicious and the drinks were stiff, just the way we like them. The queso was out of this world-- different than we expected but SO good! The brussel spout nachos were life changing. If you're into sweet drinks, the snow cone margaritas were thirst quenching and so good! We would definitely return to Diego Pops... Sam our server was a gem!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

TaYQTCrBnGP6q2d2Bk7Y0A.text: Only giving 3 stars because the employees there are soooo rude! First there's the host who didn't even a knowledge us when we walked in and when she finally approached us it was with such attitude. The waitress was so short and no personality. We had the nachos and tacos + sangria and the food was delicious sucks for the costumer service because they ruined it for me

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sangria + nachos

hWQ5amF_q6UYW-4tV5muCA.text: Girl Bartender with light hair is very rude not sure if I'll return but the guy bartenders were nice

6Yvb27m78OeC8Ki39hq7gg.text: Second night in a row we sat at the bar with bartender John. Great guy, very attentive and great with joking around. Green chili chicken tacos were awesome. We come for the Cadillac margaritas

BcVrNdVX13fZ7fsAYMUlKg.text: Really great tacos! I got the grilled shrimp and a steak taco and they were good! We got the margaritas and they were also good! I liked the vibe the most as you could sit by the bar which was somewhat outside which was cool. I would say this is a great stop to get some food before strolling old town scottsdale!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

Zirj18zWFbZfXWZ6HETElQ.text: New favorite on the list! Yummy drinks, good food and fun and friendly staff. Tried the Jamaica mojito and found a slightly sweet but very flavorful and fun drink. Also the Tortilla soup is really really good! A must try! The ambiance here is fun and relaxed. Good weekend spot for food and drinks.

91SrylMlrNa_-6-7SXdk-g.text: First time here after seeing all the great reviews. It was a Wednesday night around 7:15 the wait was less than 5 minutes. The decor is cute but sitting inside gets very loud. We were greeted right away and told the server that it was our first time here. She suggested the Brussel sprout nachos, so we ordered those. While waiting for those to arrive we each ordered 2 tacos. Two shrimp, one pineapple pork and one steak.  After 30 minutes we were still waiting for the nachos and had already asked the server what the hold up was. She blamed the kitchen yet we kept seeing others getting their food before us. She said she told her manager about the delay. When they finally arrived they were good but nothing amazing as I was expecting from reviews I'd seen.  The tacos arrived shortly after along with a bunch of sauces. I realized after taking a bite of the steak taco that the sauce is provided to add flavor to otherwise bland tacos.  Once we finished we waited again for the server to realize we were done and bring the check. The table across from us was also having issues with getting their food. I'm not sure if it was the servers issue or the kitchen or a combination. Either way it was not a good experience the manager never came by and we won't be back. This seems to be a typical Old Town tourist restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel sprout nachos

mXbC0aYEF_0iFeH1GCp6fg.text: Honestly, John the bartender is hands down the most professional and friendly host. Me and my girl sat at the bar and he was full of humor and reccomendations. The five stars is 100% because of John. Not only does he make BOMB drinks, he also referees. He takes cares of his guests. 5/5 recommend

TmiQuB-GkiuVTYCRbQnsAg.text: Decent service, mediocre prices (typical of Scottsdale), great vibe/kitsch decor, and THE BEST FREAKING NACHOS I'VE EVER TASTED! Whoever thought of putting brussel sprouts on nachos is one creative, twisted, brilliant mind. The only negative thing I have to say about our visit was that the margarita I had was either extremely watered down, or the bartender forgot to add the tequila. Next time I'll stick with a bottle of Corona. That being said, the nachos guarantee that there will indeed be a next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Best. Nachos. Ever.
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

gtps94oPU_dxV9zlHq7K3A.text: I've been hearing about Diego Pops for some time now, especially with their Brussel Sprout nachos. I love Brussel sprouts, if you cook and season them correctly so I was so excited to try this place.   It is south of the Montauk and the restaurant has their own private parking lot but it is small. When we walked in, we immediately dig the vibe - kinda like a 60's diner. The employees right away were really friendly. Our server went over the menu and we decided on the famous Brussel sprout nachos, a cod taco with flour tortilla and a beef machaca taco with a crispy taco.   The nachos were a generous portion!! I suggest you share with a group of at least 4 people. We practically only made a dent. It was good, no doubt about that. The tacos though - eh, not so much. They were okay. The flavors just didn't mesh well together and the crispy cod was a little soggy.   We then ordered a churro sundae for dessert. They top the vanilla ice cream with dulce de leche and it was pretty yummy. The churros that came with it needed some work though. I didn't think they were that great, but I ate it because the combination of the cinnamon and ice cream was good.   Our bill wasn't bad. It's not crazy cheap but not over the top either. I wouldn't go back for the tacos, but I would go back to try the other items on the menu and take advantage of their happy hour.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The crispy cod and the beef machaca tacos
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The churro sundae
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The famous Brussel sprouts nachos

xhVLWvPGb0rY7e6DWjSZCg.text: Food was good. Service was great. Drinks were tasty and kept coming. I brought a friend from out of town and everyone enjoyed themselves!

lGDuvI4-3CkEroDsYcWU3A.text: When a taco shop comes up with taco Monday you know this isn't the run of the mill taco joint. I like everything about this place. Plantain tacos yes please.  It's cooling off in Arizona so Monday we went and got a taco outside on the covered patio which was the best way I can imagine to enjoy the first beautiful day of fall. Service was great. Food was great. Company was great but that didn't have anything to do with Diego pops. Six sauces come with your order. I'm a fan of the habanero stufThis is one of those places that I feel lucky to have close enough that I can go all the time. The one thing I notice is evenings it's more of a cantina and can get a little loud. I would recommend it for happy hour and I imagine they have some great drinks to go with a great menu. Let me say this I have been here at least six time so far and every time the food has been consistently good. I can't even say that about my three most favorite restaurants. This place deserves to consideration for that spot. If I could find any fault maybe twice the service was average or slightly subpar nothing to complain about. Most of the time the service is excellent. Also easy parking they have more than one lot

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Banana with creamy beans works great with their ranch salsa

XXU-yukvqZU2juVJgGYHNQ.text: I'm going straight to the point here... In town on a quick getaway vacation, stumbled here almost by accident. ate the absolute best shrimp tacos I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Outside seating area and bar

vqoi9BYLcey4xzByKPWxTw.text: Great vibe, tacos and salsas. Overall offers fun ambiance, hip bar/drinks and flavorful food...

z8s0dGUMhBBT60CEnkL7Aw.text: YUM! Just tried this last night for the first after seeing so many instagram posts of their Brussels sprouts nachos. They were worth the hype! Gluten free and vegetarian options available as well. Green chili chicken tacos were great, as was the prickly pear margarita. The atmosphere is adorable, instagram worthy!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

9awT1brbSbTlNWmuucvzbw.text: Try the fried plantain taco, the bean burrito, the awesome chips and salsa, and the lime chia water, which is just like abuelita makes.   But beyond that, there isn't much here for a vegan or vegetarian. The atmosphere is great, although keep in mind that you're in downtown Scottsdale so expect pricey food and lots of attitude.

BNp4ZmwV3utz5qy8DPPr-g.text: Very cute decor, great area, decent food. Loud. Mediocre service. I can't get very excited about writing much in this review because I just wasn't so excited about our dinner. Best part about the place, to me, was the overall vibe and decor. So, maybe go there, but not for the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

yYEhHia4L6rDlMUcWKJKUQ.text: A very fun atmosphere, decor is very unique, and the drink menu is amazing! Such a good selection of fun drinks! I ordered a selection of tacos and the coconut rice, all did not disappoint! The quest and guacamole is also a must order!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

RXiUtPWOtcj0AuhFr4hnlw.text: Cool atmosphere, good food, super friendly staff. Chrisanne made us feel very welcome as first time visitors. If you're in Scottsdale this is a great place for lunch or dinner!

8Kros14mlGx_9-XHflgwFQ.text: I am new to the area but have heard about this place countless times. The ambience really encapsulates Arizona. Indoor and outdoor seating with adorable decor. Really cute for a girls night or just a quick bite to eat. I got the elote which was super good especially with the crushed hot Cheetos on top, just a little dry. They have 6 amazing sauces at your table so I added the verde ranch and it took my elote to the next level. Their horchata was refreshing and just the perfect level of sweet. Highly recommend both. The chicken taco was nothing special but I really like that each taco comes with tortilla recommendations. I got the green Chile taco with crispy tortilla and it was good especially with the different salsas! Great place for lunch or dinner :) Ill try the Brussel sprout nachos and a Marg next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Elote and horchata!

pVjhBE5cJcyHAz0XqWnm-w.text: Diego Pops was the best stop of our weekend trip - so great, that we came back.  First time was to hold us over while we were waiting for our table at Montauk (which was over-rated by the way... should've stayed at Diego Pops.) I ordered a bloody mary, the jicama/cucumbers with chipotle greek yogurt dip and a shrimp taco. All of the things were amazing. The bloody mary mix was zesty and refreshing!  We came back again for a light dinner prior to our red eye flight back to the east coast. Sat at the bar again, and had great amicable bartenders waiting on us, who dealt with all our modifications and requests with grace.  We ordered salads - I order the kale and brussels sprouts salad with the jalapeno vinaigrette and added steak and shrimp (double protein, not half and half). The salad was warm and nourishing, and completely satisfying.  We also ordered the pineapple ceviche to start, and were not disappointed. All in all great spot for food, drinks, friendly service, and instagram-worthy ambience.

i1KsadWuVRsYd4AseSfMPw.text: I really have no clue why this place is so popular? I was trying to find something good about it the entire time we were there. I HATE giving bad reviews but I have to after this night... I was with a group of 10 for a birthday on a Friday night, so we had a 30 min wait, as expected. No problem! We went to the bar while we waited. Bartender messed up my order which was only two drinks. Only got one. My friend ended up telling him I never got my drink (this was after my boyfriend already paid for two) He nodded w a blank look on his face & then went to make my drink. He hands me my drink, and then hands me a bill. I tried to have a conversation with him about how we had already paid for it but he said that the other drink (wrong drink) was for the girl next to us and he had assumed she was with us (?) and that's what we paid for before. No apology, nothing, I was so shocked. I was about to pay because I was just over it but my friend explained again and he did his whole blank nod again and walked off. Great service.  when we were sat down, the table was for 8, and when we said it was for 10, the lady says "you said it was for 8." Like, dang, you all suck here, I guess. Service was bad for the remainder of the night and food was just okay, very over priced for serving sizes.

Sd6ttrpR7sN4ClsqyMWaGQ.text: Got the crispy fish cod taco and guava coconut drink. Taco was very good, one is good for a snack but 2-3 for a full meal. The guava coconut drink was really refreshing and not super strong. Would defiantly come back because of the service and good food!

ia9tME0PzKm25uv127FRrQ.text: Sierra was amazing! sierra had a big brides maid party and other tables but she managed to check up on my table as my as she could! she was so sweet and had the best smile! if you ever come here request her section you won't regret it! she did a kick ass job!!!!!

UGZLjxUqmR06pcJ6PaeVfg.text: 4 stars cuz it took forrrrrever to get our food. But the tacos were moist, I was moist, everything was moist.

Iv-PuPfcBLWkOPIag4oZ-Q.text: All around great experience, came here for the first time and will definitely back. This place has a great contemporary Mexican feel and the food is amazing! I got the green chili pork tacos and suggest anyone to get those as well. My boyfriend got the beef tacos and ordered some coconut guava drink; which came out in an actual coconut!So cool!  The staff was amazing as well. Our waiter, Isaac was excellent, Very efficient and helpful! Great business! Great experience!

j8ffNwFiB2dcu43JYPiS0w.text: I think there must be something wrong with me...every time I come here, I wonder to myself the following questions:  1. Why isn't the food DEEEEELISHHHHUSS? 2. And why is our service poor? Like the service should at least be good.   3. Why is my bill so much higher then Cien Agaves? 4. Why didn't I go to Cien Agaves? Or Joyride? Or Julio's Too?  Maybe it's just not meant to be for me.  I wish I liked Diego pops but I'm afraid it's not in the cards for me

w1ic3032f6HMffEBM9lmOA.text: Love this place when I get to town.  Love their sauces and choices between tacos and bowls.   Perfect amount when you don't want a lot.   The atmosphere is cute.   Love the indoor/outdoor option.  Phoebe was our server and was so nice

L5Ga0guLk9UEUst8IIQwRw.text: Favorite restaurant in Old Town. Great food, fantastic vibes, fair prices. Honestly didn't want to leave a review for selfish reasons but the whole place is fantastic and they deserve it.

yMMhdlvPK84U4Rgc65PH2A.text: The restaurant is very busy on a Sat night.  We are traveling so simply went by the Yelp reviews.  The food wasn't bad but we would not go back.   The menu is very limited and they charge for chips and salsa.  My chicken burrito had more rice than chicken in it and I don't think there was any cheese at all.  We waited over 30 minutes for our food.

Ul_ChyDIulZ7yqf0I2bY4A.text: Drinks - awesome Vibe - so good, so very good Service - ok on my visit. Not over the top Food - average, hit and miss  Go for the vibe. And drink!

LJuQWorKDCo8FfNZcnNSHw.text: Wow! Just had the Brussel Sprout nachos and they were decadent! I would go back just for these and forgo any Tacos.  Can't decide if they are healthy or not but yes or no they are fan-freakin-tastic! Been here several times and never disappointed. If you want some great food and a relaxing patio experience, this is it.  Enjoy!!!

f5cfZBg0lBRoJSsd1rp9mw.text: I'm a big Yelp fan, so whenever I go to a new state, I'm always glued to this app for great restaurants to visit. I knew that Arizona would have great mexican food and I was in luck because it just so happens to be my favorite type of food! I came across this place and knew right away that I had to try it and I am SO glad I did! Everything about this place was delicious and beautiful.   For starters, they have such an impressive drink menu but I decided to go with the Watermelon Mint margarita after my waiter recommended it and it was SO good! The perfect balance of every ingredient, nothing was too overpowering. We ordered chips and salsa for the table and it was honestly one of the best salsas I've ever had. For my meal I ordered their cheese quesadilla which is technically one of their starters, but I added avocado and corn. I'm not exaggerating when I say I could eat that quesadilla every day. There was a weird, pepto-bismol looking drizzle on top which I was skeptical about but it was so tasty!   Overall I could not recommend this place enough and it's very upsetting for me because I live 2,000 miles away. I'll just dream about it until I get to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ZyECBqvqSOJnrPK4xgKrvw.text: Only my second time at Diego Pops, but I am completely obsessed ! It is located right off Scottsdale road, there is packing in the front and extra to the side of the restaurant. This place is always packed, we went in a Wednesday night and it was still busy! We had a party of 12, they easily sat us within 10-15 minutes. You have to try the snow cone margarita, the watermelon lime flavor is the best and the perfect treat for summer. There are plenty of vegetarian options and it's super easy to veganize, which is amazing. We started with chips and salsa. The salsa is probably one of the best I've ever had, it's super spicy and has great flavor. Can I buy it in a jar? I'll have to ask next time. Next we got an order of brussel sprout nachos, and holy heck! They are life changing. The chip to cheese ratio was a little off, but they were so delicious we didn't even care. I got a brussel sprout taco and plantain taco. I wasn't really a fan on the plantain, it's a weird texture thing for me ( I don't like bananas at all ) and it was a little sweet. The brussel sprout taco was delicious and would prefer that over the plantain personally. Everyone in my party loved the food and we can't wait to go back !

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Snow cone margarita
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussel sprout nachos
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. brussel sprout taco and plantain taco

uvH8Jwc9CUkHlDaLbOkjjg.text: Really great place for a low key but stylish atmosphere. The tacos are delicious and you can have your taco in a bowl style if you're not feelin' the taco life that day. Happy hour is great with 1/2 apps, and cheap beer and margaritas! Great place for lunch with an awesome patio to enjoy the weather.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Shrimp and cod tacos with a creamy beet sauce

vwDHAA9N8uiSco_MxbFqCQ.text: Hands down, the best food I had in Scottsdale/Phoenix this trip.  I ate at very highly acclaimed, very highly priced restaurants.  Diego Pops was far superior to every other restaurant.  Why?  Fresh ingredients, creative menu, fabulous drinks, and a fun and casual ambiance.  Professional and deft service.    Not just five stars in its genre - five stars, period.

TAonsoug_pXfJUbZfwoZXw.text: I have been dying to come here for months and we finally went! We were seated quickly on a Saturday afternoon, and there were 6 of us. We didn't get the pineapple wall background but that didn't matter once the food came out! We had the street corn queso, chicken quesadillas, and a bean and cheese burrito at the table.  The salsa...   Quesadillas great (we added chicken) and the burrito was also good. We also got the watermelon margarita snow cone... yeah, I said margarita SNOWCONE. So fun and so yummy! We came to the conclusion it was rimmed with watermelon warheads  but it was so refreshing!  I will say none of us were terribly impressed with the street corn queso and felt it needed more flavor. Granted we still ate it after we mixed in some salsa because the salsa was just so good...but alone the queso was just ok.  We were short on time but their happy hour menu is legit! We will be going back soon to try more amazing options and of course take some real cute foodie photos!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Watermelon snow cone margarita!!

REsIP4sjku-dATpNpVk9Ew.text: Incredible! As a latina woman who knows great mexican food when I taste it, Diego Pops brings it. The happy hour offerings are amazing - we ordered 5 entrees including the brussel sprout nachos, queso, habanero wings and they were perfection. The margaritas are fantastic as well and after a few we switched it up to the Snow margaritas - say yes to the chili rim on yours.   I'd love for Diego Pops to come to Austin. I'm saddened to know I have to fly all the way to AZ to enjoy that again.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

YJwL7-xDH2t8JUYPP-trTw.text: First time at Diego Pops and loved the food, the atmosphere, and our server SAVAUGHN! He was so friendly and eager to make our dining experience great. We had an amazing time and will be returning soon!

HYlH_EHVZ7iEEiENNwyn5g.text: Literally writing this review while sitting here cause  so happyyyyyy!   Ambiance .  Brussels Sprout Taco can be made vegan! So yummy.   GET THE GUAVA COCONUT DRINK! So pretty (comes in a young coconut with a little umbrella) and seriously one of top 3 best drinks I've ever had.   SERVICE!!!! Okay Savaughn! He was so sweet, made great recommendations, was super attentive, and funny.  Coming back next time we're in AZ for sure!  Edit : Back the next day for coconut drinks at the bar! Dom & Wayatt killing it behind the bar. The service here!

SmQFBlKuIIh1z0fr4ZH82g.text: Good food but limited in their choices (and small ortions) for a Mx restaurant. Didn't care for their buffalo wings... I liked that they offered different sauces...

MYuwmtis-o93tTWPQIWA2Q.text: Omg everything was so good! Happy Hour Specials are a great deal! What else do I need to write?

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Street Corn Queso &amp;  Brussel Sprouts Nacho

sf1-e_2huvJ27aeN2cTNew.text: I was so excited to eat that I didn't take any pictures. A friend was visiting for her birthday and she wanted to eat good Mexican. Upon searching, we found this place and it definitely had a cool vibe. There's an outdoor seating area which we sat in. It was perfect for the surprisingly not so hot day in town!  Happy hour: they have happy hour from 3-6 and it's  1/2 off apps, and discounted beer, sangria, and margaritas. We definitely took advantage of the apps but the downside was that they didn't have a very good margarita menu. I was expecting to get some kind of flavor added but they weren't able to do that aside from the specialty margs already on the menu.   Tacos/burritos: my friend had the California burrito and she said it was amazing! I had the braised pork and green Chile chicken tacos. The chicken taco was very good but the pork just needed for taste. The pineapple was the thing that has the most flavor. I ordered some cilantro brown rice to go with it and that also needed more flavor.   Service: our server was awesome! Attentive enough without being overpowering.

VxLQW_9386tfLhOeS3dyMQ.text: Love the vibe and aesthetic of this place, it's very artsy, yet homey and comfortable all at the same time.  Great and friend staff and service, and the food actually came out pretty quickly too. I got the chicken and cod tacos, and they were super delicious.  We tried the famous brussel sprouts nachos, and they were a good flavor...but my God were they greasy. Dont get me wrong, they were good! But they were /wet/ from being so oily, and I got a little stomach disruption because of it, so... just depends on how you feel about greasy foods - my only heads up for this place (or at least that dish in particular).  Otherwise I'll be back to try more of the different dishes in the future! To get more of a secure opinion on this place.

m0Ohgi-znGFE9jazVSeupw.text: Would rate this place between 3.5 and 4.  Awesome ambience and super cool Scottsdale vibe.  Ordered - Brussels sprouts Nachos : prolly the best thing I had at this place. Tastes really great  Plantain tacos : sounded interesting but the combination of Plantains and sweet corn in a taco did not go well. Diego Margarita : I felt it's waste of $7 on this. It was just water. No hints of lime.  Starters were served at the end. Drinks came out half way through my meal. It wasn't super crowded too.  If you wanna check one of the places on your bookmarks, just visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ivzm0TQQDCpEs9K8tgW_Uw.text: Came in from surprise just to have a look at this trendy little shop!!!!  My sister in law wanted to try the snowcone margarita and she was not disappointed one bit....... this baby was fresh and very cool in the presentation.   We had the grilled street corn the brustle sprout nacho chips and salasa and also a senoran hot dog.   Really good food nachos were interesting with some pink sauce and a fried egg but was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Sonora Hot dog
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Snowcone Margarita

zLTB5pxwJIM9EUkOxRUZYQ.text: Brian wakes me up one late afternoon and tells me to shower and get dressed. He wants to take me to a dope taco spot ... 2 hours later we are at Diego's Pops. After a short wait, we are seated. We are then abandoned for 13 minutes. I counted. Brian is confused. He goes Kim I swear I've never had to wait this long for service. Someone overhears us and comes to get our drink order.  Thanks someone because I was 2 minutes away from leaving. I don't acknowledge that I was waiting because well my mother taught me to never be rude to the people cooking or serving your food. ( you guys know why) A few minutes later a manager walks by to apologize. Thank you for that. That spoke volumes. That alone is the reason I will always come back.  Now on to the good stuff.  I order the Diego margarita, which was delicious and strong! (Yum) he orders horchata (he seemed to love it).  We order the delicious light airy chips mixed in with platanos, with a side of Queso... not sure what was in  the queso... probably crack... but... I almost licked the container clean... (not sorry) and the most delicious guacamole I've tasted. It was simple and straight to the point, non of that extra filler crap that restaurants like to mix in.. thank you for that.   Now on to the tacos  From 1-5  Braised pineapple pork tacos a 10 forget the scale. The best pork tacos I've ever had. The pineapple and cojita with the pork set my tastebuds into a frenzy that was hard to take control of. I'd kill for these tacos .. (jk, or am I?)  Grilled Shrimp tacos .. a 2 I can make these at home... after eating the braised pineapple pork tacos first... eating the shrimp was underwhelming. Skip them.  Grilled adobo chicken taco. A 5. Tasty especially when you add the pink sauce to neutralize the "spice". Yummmmm! Very savory and spicy. A second favorite.  Still thinking about the braised pineapple pork tacos....  Get the coconut rice. Don't ask why. Just get it. It's delicious. That is all.   And ask for a second margarita but only if you're not driving.  Just a few FYI's  The smaller the group the easier it is to seat you guys.  Parking is tight.  Dog friendly. Friendly staff, be nice to them. Kid friendly but seriously.. leave them at home, this place is much too good for children. Enjoy this with your adult friends. Get the margaritas, they are worth the price. Monday's are for $3 tacos!   Happy hour is from 3-6 All week.    I'll be back.

6dvVxY5Zd9tk5caz1JKHPg.text: One of the best places to eat and go out in Scottsdale! I loved it so much the first time I ate there I went back the next night with more friends. They bring 6 super delicious sauces to your table to put on tacos, nachos, etc. the drinks were awesome too. Only issue is they don't take reservations and the line to get a table can be long as it's a popular place.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

JXsxrCz0LfWbVVwqGGLnXA.text: Yum! Came in for Taco Monday and they did not disappoint. I got the fried cod and a chicken tacos on corn tortillas with Rice and Beans of course!! I also got their happy hour margarita but didn't love it.  Sitting outside was so fun and Claire was awesome. She was incredibly attentive and had great recommendations. Can't wait to try more of their happy hour tacos!!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Foood!!!

bxJ57JrcXYCCrpZLpn26Gg.text: Went to this location with my husband. It's cute and not formal, very casual.  The service was good and we ordered tacos. The salsa was good but not spicy at all. It was fresh and we'll seasoned. It didn't stand out but was not bad either. We ordered asada tacos and they were ok too.not bad at all but didn't stand out either. I felt for the price they could have been a little more than the basic expected taco. Again, it wasn't bad, just didn't stand out. It's close to everything in Old town so it's a good location and convenient if you're doing other things.

LCy7NKIs6qszwvryMxTRdg.text: After waiting at our table for over an hour (and after being promised chips and salsa three times) we finally received our chips to be informed that the order that she took and hour ago has apparently not been put in and has been lost. She then took our order for a second time promising it would be 10 minutes when it was really over 30. This is a decent place for college life and low standards.

Pp0APgBzzo-WJsAEWlQ--g.text: This place is super cute! All the decorations give a great vibe to the place. The tacos are pretty good although if you are very hungry you might have to order a lot to fill up. I ordered chips with salsa and two shrimp tacos which I felt was very filling because of all the carbs. It was very flavorful even though it looked like such a small amount on their large tray plates. The best part was they had so many different kinds sauces! (Haha) they even had a pink sauce which actually tasted really good but was not spicy. Very cool place to check out for someone just visiting for the weekend!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled shrimp tacos

uWLy8lEtH7-qeJbhuQ6MlA.text: Delicious food! Had great vegan/vegetarian and gluten-free/celiac options. Our waitress was super friendly and the environment was hip & cool. Definitely will visit again if I ever find myself in Scottsdale again!

CvajhwBou2etwt7mI7gMbA.text: This place has great tacos and such a fun environment! Highly recommend!! I love the Brussels sports nachos...sounds gross but they are soooo good!

lokPESKIMgNBw1CAQ9NJaQ.text: First review of 2017! My friend and I loved this spot. I suggested it since we wanted somewhere in Old Town and it was one of my bookmarks. We started off with drinks; I got Mexican Sprite (tasted similar to regular Sprite) and my friend got iced tea. I already know I wanted to order the brussels sprouts nachos from the rave reviews and my friend wanted guacamole so we ordered both. SO MANY CHIPS. I loved the nachos; the sprouts were charred and lots of flavor with the peppers, corn, cheese and the extra sauces they brought to our table. It was fun trying them all. Happy hour meant appetizers were half off, great deal.  We decided to also get shrimp tacos on flour tortilla and I thought it was delicious. You can choose corn or crispy tortilla and get rice and other sides with it for more money. Diego Pops doesn't do Taco Tuesday BUT they do have Taco Monday, which gets them twice the customers for those thinking they have special deals on Tuesday.   Our server was friendly and funny and the place itself is cute. We sat outside as did most everyone else and they had heaters and candles to set the ambiance. I'd come back, they've got a good selection of items on their menu and food was tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Drinks
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Chips and guacamole
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussels sprouts nachos

OKJ73XwOnT9W4WuCWeno1w.text: Love this place !!! Bartenders are super cool and the food is da bomb I highly suggest.

LmTX7tRt6EzbiWboknP0EQ.text: This is my favorite little gem in Scottsdale. The food has such amazing flavor. Skylar at the Bar is my favorite mixologist. Cory is always accommodating. Love This place. Eat here 1 a week.

piD-O0ryCOZfknLjH7Pb_g.text: Came here for my first time because everyone kept talking about the nachos so i had to try them and they were AMAZING i fell in love. The atmosphere was super vibey and boho chic which i loved, but my favorite part of it all was Melissa. She was an amazing server, kind and attentive! Definitely coming back and asking for melissa next time :)

zZkcFfjbI7PssLodX0cu6g.text: Such a fun place - even with kids. The manager (at least I think she was) was AMAZING and went above and beyond to help my tired hangry 3 year old. He wanted ketchup for his hotdog and she went NEXT DOOR to another restaurant to get him some. I mean / how amazing is that? She saved the day... and saved us parents from a crying child. Server was so kind and helpful as well - just super impressed.  Also - the reason we came was for the Brussels sprouts nachos. To die for. Worth the 45 min drive 100%.

-67VYIi5EIdROgl0VA6GIw.text: Fun atmosphere, great food, and awesome service! Got a table outside and had Taylor as our waitress, she was very sweet and gave really good recommendations. Had to try the snow cone marg, which was super tasty, will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

K4guTcfH2nZZBo0OouSifg.text: Hip little taco shop in Old Town Scottsdale. The vibe is young and energetic. The food is taco shop chic. Offering their version of tacos, burritos, and a "rawish" bar. I had the California burrito. The burrito was a fancy take on a greasy favorite. It's not the best Mexican food, but the atmosphere and drinks are worth a visit. If you want good authentic AZ Mexican try Los Olivos.

dPOiNJ4fZubqh1D2T_BI0Q.text: Deliciousness - 4/5  Happiness 3/5  An interesting place that serves poke bowls and tacos. Needless to say, these tacos were not authentic. But what does it matter when they are SO delicious.  They start you off with some free chips and salsa. Make sure to also ask for their numerous other sauces and ailolis, which they provide gratis. I ordered the skirt steak, adobo chicken and salmon tacos, which I listed in order of deliciousness. Honestly, these tacos are so flavorful and well balanced that adding extra sauce is a mistake as it throws off the flavor profile. I enjoyed them as each bite was packed with flavor.   The service was a tad slow, but the server was pleasant.   I definitely would love to try a poke bowl (assuming I can get it without pineapple. DIE pineapple!) and a breakfast burrito looks delicious too. This is a nice, affordable spot full of tasty tacos in the midst of pricey spots in oldtown Scottsdale. What's not to like?

W64un4MBW9MjhOOj5Ch_XQ.text: If you get to come here and experience this delish, elevated Mexican cuisine, ask for Savaughn or Tori! Tori is very attentive and Savaughn is so engaging! They're fun and energetic, some of the best!

CL5VT-ndHrVEg6ok4PGHhg.text: If you just want to drink, it's a great place, if you want to enjoy food and drink... be ready to wait 2+ hours while others tables that got seated after you, get served food first. Not a pleasant experience whatsoever... place looks great though. Like I said, fun place just to drink and get chips and salsa.

yYIKBhNb7-6IS78d15Ze0g.text: They had pretty decent food, but it wasn't better than other Mexican food I've had. I got the green Chile chicken taco bowl and it could've used more spices. The hot sauces they provided were not spicy at all, not even remotely. And I put quite a bit on. If you like food with a kick, you won't get it here. The margaritas were great though!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Adobe chicken tacos
Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Green Chile taco bowl with cole slaw on top!

L72-GgeaAniTXCiYRapQGA.text: This was a pretty good place if you enjoy Mexican food with a little infusion!!  While tasty most of my family had a difficult time digesting the food.  Very friendly service!

nhh-6rpw39oNkhRq9lM9Mw.text: This place is pretty awesome. Cool vibes, great food, outside seating.   My Sonoran hot dog was just ok, wouldn't recommend it, but everything else was terrific. Especially the brussell sprout nachos.   4 stars bc my drink was empty most of the night and the service was a bit lacking, but nothing dramatic. Our server just didn't come around too much.   Would definitely come back again

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Brussell Sprout Nachos

T-wwqaAwWjFvRQMtIRA-qw.text: Love the tacos and the margaritas better... great staff completely friendly and I like the patio area

_uCvYvPf7pSoGGLFLs95HQ.text: I went into Diego pops last night with some friends and we got drinks from the bar while waiting for a table. The bartender was very friendly and attentive.  After a little bit of a wait for the patio we got our table. Our server, Taylor, was so sweet, attentive, and knowledgeable. She helped us navigate the menu and gave helpful suggestions when my friend said she didn't like things too spicy. The food was delicious and the location of the restaurant is perfect! I will definitely be back :)

KzNmqMlcMIHrkE0JShhLbg.text: I honestly have never had a bad experience here. I have so many food allergies and they always cater to them perfectly! They have great food and a great happy hour! If you want to go out to eat and only have like $20 to spend go there especially on Mondays when all Tacos are like $3 and during happy hour you can get amazing drinks and appetizers for cheap!!

_wH9ejO2d6z2hIqyvs8VHA.text: Awesome everything  margaritas beer food.  Such a fun place  bring your family and friends for a super Happy hour

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

mIGrXFYZgQgSeyEA3rSMUw.text: Decided to try out Diego Pops for the first time last week while I had a friend in town visiting. I have heard great things about it, and I was not disappointed. We just decided to have drinks and chips. We arrived about 10 minutes before their happy hour ended and our waitress warned us that if we wanted their deal of half off appetizers we had to order before the ending time. I asked if we could still order drinks at happy hour and suddenly it was like a flip switched and our server went from being nice and bubbly to almost angry seeming. She responded "no" and quickly walked away. When she came back we order our chips and salsa and our full priced drinks (we went with drinks that weren't on the happy hour menu anyways) the Watermelon Lime Snow Cone Margaritas. The chips were really good but insanely salty, but like you know when things are really salty and it make them addicting? Yeah that's how they were haha, and our Snow Cone Margs were super yummy but didn't taste like there was any alcohol in them. We decided not to say anything as to not upset our server anymore. Want to come back for a better experience with a different serve and also try more of their food, so overall a decent dining experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

AWhecLePLzd3jXqVU-MVVQ.text: I had the Brussels sprouts Nachos 4 separate times this past weekend. If that doesn't tell you what you need to know I don't know what will.

DGryrPIEFy311GiPH1CSVg.text: The atmosphere is was what made this place for me. The service was pretty mediocre when I was there and we were greeted with a lot of attitude. Definitely willing to come back especially for happy hour. They definitely serve all their food with a bit of a kick of spice (which I love but definitely be prepared)!

kAhDpF_1RhE0GVIEnglYdQ.text: Went for the first time today and I absolutely loved this place! Food was great but service was even better!! My server was Collin and he was such a sweetheart!! The atmosphere is also so fun and I love the aesthetic, I will definitely be coming back. Got the cheese quesadilla with corn LOVED IT.

eYyy4JU91jRE9HWdg_Gkzg.text: Honestly if I could give this restaurant zero stars I would. Horrible service, horrible drinks (ordered the prickly pear margarita) which had absolutely NO FLAVOR. Also, ordered the house burrito... a burrito with just refried would have had more flavor. Which was also served with a small handful of broken chips. Never going back there.

jO86mmj-d9H4wdfI2aUx6g.text: Pineapple Braised Pork is one of my favorite tacos in the city! The place has a real hacienda feel, as it was a pottery shop before, so its design and layout are as simple as they get. Great selection of food, great quality and their Taco Mondays are a nice relief if you're looking to get your taco fix early on in the week. Salsa selection is good, with a little bit of everything and I'm curious to have their tuna poke bowls!

photos.caption: Photo of Diego Pops - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Grilled Shrimp w/corn salsa, Pineapple Braised Pork, Green Chile Chicken and one of their Asada Tacos if I remember correctly.

IywwB58VqSQO2oDLTp6dBA.text: I came here for the first time with a couple of friends earlier this week and we had such an amazing waiter, Anthony! Very welcoming, attentive and amusing so service is 10/10. Should totally have the brussel sprouts nachos or their beef machaca tacos, too; they're so delicious! I will definitely be back soon (:

FUWg1wgCyXG26rdkYhfnSA.text: Food is pretty good but the service is terrible. Fire the entire lunch crew except the kitchen. The two Chefs were the only people working in there today. Boo. Rude waitresses.

TC-wQFMbNZkCGpt_HEDZsg.text: It was during an on-site photoshoot production for The Style Line that I discovered the striking mid-century character of the foyer and the enlivening accents of the menu at Diego Pops. The ambiance of this restaurant made for an excellent scene for pop photography. Bold neon makes an appearance around every corner; neon lettering reads "Como Mexico no hay dos" (there is no place like Mexico) and baby blue-colored booths are book-ended by neon-printed pineapple wallpaper.   I ordered the "Sweet Corn + Avocado Caesar" Salad complete with grilled salmon. This salad was served in perfect portion and proportion, making an flavorful balance of sweet and savory. I love the array of salsa that is provided with crispy tortilla chips - do not hesitate to sample each salsa and add more to your salad if you wish.   Very friendly and accommodating staff and management. I felt very welcome and comfortable in their establishment.   Be careful when parking - small lot just in front of restaurant may fill very quickly.   Please refer to my photos for more on my experience.
